In our business model, we operate with two distinct approaches: B2B and B2C.

For B2B, we sell businesses access to our platform without taking any commission. Companies also benefit from detailed dashboards, offering key insights into statistics such as carbon impact, ride usage, and more. This allows businesses to track the environmental and operational benefits of encouraging carpooling among their employees.

On the B2C side, we charge commissions on rides made outside of institutional groups. For individual users who are not part of our partner organizations, we take a small commission on each ride, ensuring our business remains sustainable while still offering affordable and flexible carpooling solutions for everyone.

The core innovation developed by Maillon Mobility, beyond the bodywork, is a chainless motorization system.
This system is designed with several key objectives in mind:
• Reducing maintenance costs by eliminating the need for a chain, grease, or derailleur—resulting in a cleaner, simpler, and more reliable setup.
• Significantly decreasing physical effort with a specific algorithm, thereby improving rider comfort and helping to protect employees’ health and safety, even on extended routes.
• Ensuring versatility and adaptability across various types of bicycles and vehicles. Maillon Mobility is fully prepared to tailor and deploy its technology in collaboration with other vehicle manufacturers.

Column31: Japet Medical operates on a B2B model, offering its CE-certified, motorized exoskeletons—primarily the Japet.W+—to companies in sectors like logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare. Column33:
Japet Medical employs advanced technologies in its Japet.W+ exoskeleton to address workplace-related lower back pain: ?
• Motorized Actuation: Four micro-motors provide active lumbar support, reducing spinal pressure during movement.  ?
• Series-Elastic Actuators (SEA): These actuators detect user movements and apply counterforce to alleviate lumbar strain.  ?
• Lightweight Design: Weighing under 2 kg, the device ensures comfort and mobility.  ?
• Removable Textile Interface: A washable “second skin” maintains hygiene standards.  ?
• Medical Certification: Class IIa CE-certified, adhering to ISO 13485 standards.  ?

This integration of robotics and medical science provides effective support for workers in physically demanding roles.

Column31:
?? OVA’s Business Model (Primarily B2G)
1. Government Licensing & Multi-Year Contracts
Clients: Ministries of Defence, Armed Forces schools (e.g., CFSATE, RCEME), and public agencies (e.g., Sellafield Ltd)

Model: Multi-year or annual licenses for StellarX or AuraX, often aligned with fiscal cycles or operational programs

Mechanism: Licensing software as a secure, on-prem or cloud-based immersive training platform

Procurement Routes: Through PSPC (Canada), DND innovation funds, NATO channels, or innovation procurement (e.g., PTC)

2. Strategic Project Delivery (Land & Expand Model)
Entry Point: Deliver targeted VR/AI training projects (e.g., CT-155 Hawk maintenance, C17 Globemaster virtual fleet)

Expansion: Scale by proving value — expand to other units, similar equipment, or adjacent training pipelines

Revenue Structure:

Fixed-price or milestone-based contracts

Typically 6–12 month delivery timelines, structured around training priorities

Lock-In Effect: Custom scenarios built for government workflows create a strong incentive to stay on OVA platforms

3. Add-On Services & Upsells
Examples:

More immersive scenarios

AI agent deployment for SOP coaching

LMS/xAPI integrations

Revenue Model: Upsell post-initial delivery, often through operational funding or capability extension phases

KopherBit’s Business Model – Built to Benefit All

KopherBit offers a modular, open ECU platform that lowers the entry barrier for small and mid-sized OEMs. By combining standardized AUTOSAR-compliant firmware, reusable toolchains, and configurable hardware, we enable partners to accelerate development without high licensing fees or vendor lock-in.

Our dual business model supports both:

***Tier-1 supply (full-stack ECU with integrated software and tools)

***Tier-2 enablement (middleware/IP licensing + development platform support).

This flexible approach allows European partners—especially those in the long tail of mobility innovation—to reuse, adapt, and grow on a future-proof platform. We don’t just deliver products—we co-create value with customers, ensuring industry standards are accessible to all, not just the few.

It’s a win-win: scalable for us, empowering for the ecosystem.

We do not yet have Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR), as our current business model is primarily based on
equipment sales and study or development contracts. However, we are progressively integrating recurring
components into our revenue structure. This includes long-term system rentals, maintenance and support contracts,
and co-development agreements with industrial partners. We are also introducing educational platforms into
universities and engineering schools, which are expected to generate steady annual income through support,
upgrades, and training services. Our commercial strategy for 2025–2026 includes the deployment of subscriptionbased
access to expert tools and analysis services, paving the way for a more predictable and recurring revenue
model. As our installed base grows, so will the share of recurring revenue in our overall turnover.
Column33: We employ advanced millimetric and terahertz imaging technologies, based on frequency-modulated continuous-wave (FMCW) radar. Our systems operate from 60 to 320 GHz, enabling real-time, contactless, and high-resolution inspection. This includes our patented uFrame matrix, the fastest depth-resolved imaging system on the market, designed for high-speed industrial lines. Our technology combines custom multi-band radar heads, proprietary optics, and signal processing algorithms to extract actionable data from complex and multilayered materials.
Column34: Our main competitors include both traditional non-destructive testing methods — such as X-ray and ultrasound — and terahertz-based companies like Terakalis. Conventional methods often require contact, involve safety constraints, or struggle with non-metallic and multilayered materials. Compared to Terakalis, our technology offers a more affordable, faster, and more scalable solution — capable of inspecting denser and thicker materials, even at high production speeds. We deliver high-resolution, depth-resolved imaging in real time, bringing terahertz imaging out of the lab and onto the factory floor.

Somanity (medical) and its subsidiary Somanity Motion (industrial exoskeletons) position themselves as leading players in innovation related to mobility assistance and the improvement of working conditions.
Column31:
Somanity’s business model is built around developing and commercializing advanced medical devices and physical assistance solutions. The company generates revenue through the direct sale and possible leasing of its mobility aids to healthcare providers, rehabilitation centers, and individuals.

Its industrial subsidiary, Somanity Motion, targets workplace ergonomics by offering exoskeletons to companies, generating income via sales, rentals, and ongoing support services such as maintenance and training.

The company tend to support its growth through fundraising rounds and aims to expand internationally to reach partners in both medical and industrial sectors.
Column33:
Somanity leverages a combination of advanced technologies to develop its medical and industrial exoskeletons :
- 3D Printing : Utilized to create lightweight, customizable exoskeleton structures, enabling rapid prototyping and cost-effective production.

- Artificial Intelligence (AI): Integrated into exoskeletons to enhance adaptability and responsiveness, allowing real-time adjustments to user movements and needs.

- Ergonomic Design: Focused on user comfort and efficiency, ensuring that exoskeletons reduce muscle fatigue and prevent musculoskeletal disorders, particularly in industrial applications.

Through the integration of these technologies, Somanity aims to provide innovative solutions that improve mobility for individuals with disabilities and enhance workplace ergonomics.
Column34:
The main competitors of Somanity in the medical exoskeleton sector include Ekso Bionics (USA), which offers motorized exoskeletons for post-stroke and spinal cord injury rehabilitation; ReWalk Robotics (Israel), specialized in devices for paraplegic individuals and patients undergoing neurological rehabilitation; and Wandercraft (France), which develops autonomous exoskeletons enabling crutch-free walking, primarily used in rehabilitation settings.

The main competitors of Somanity Motion in the industrial exoskeleton market include German Bionic, a leader in powered active exoskeletons for logistics; Ottobock, offering a range of passive exoskeletons for material handling; SuitX, an Ottobock subsidiary, focused on modular exoskeletons for various industrial applications; and Auxivo, which develops ultra-lightweight solutions for low-intensity tasks.

Revolutionizing Performance, Recovery & Beauty with Bioelectric Innovation

BarunBio is a next-generation tech company from South Korea pioneering WE-STIM™, a patented battery-free microcurrent technology seamlessly integrated into apparel and skincare.
Column31:
BarunBio is a Korean deep-tech company pioneering battery-free microcurrent stimulation (WE-STIM™), applicable to both textiles and topical formulations.

We operate two models:
?? B2B: OEM/ODM, licensing, and co-development with partners in performance wear, recovery gear, and beauty-tech.
Suitable for wellness, athletic, and luxury brands seeking science-backed innovation.

?? B2C: HYVLE, our in-house brand, offers athleisure, socks, and supports that deliver recovery and performance benefits through wearable microcurrent stimulation. (Sold via hyvle.com.)

? We empower global partners to launch smart recovery & skincare products — without batteries, devices, or discomfort.
Column33:
WE-STIM™ (Wearable Electrical Stimulation) is BarunBio’s proprietary battery-free microcurrent technology that passively generates low-level electrical stimulation through body movement and ambient electromagnetic energy — without requiring any batteries, wires, or charging devices.

?? Fully Device-Free
No electronics or external components — the stimulation is created by specially engineered textile structures or formulation matrices, seamlessly embedded into apparel or cosmetic products.

?? Textile & Topical Integration
WE-STIM™ is integrated into performance wear, compression gear, and skincare patches & fomulation using proprietary conductive fibers or materials, ensuring comfort, flexibility, and washability — while maintaining the look and feel of ordinary clothing or cosmetics.

?? Functionality through Daily Use
By simply wearing the product during normal activity, users experience continuous low-level stimulation that is designed to support muscle engagement or enhance skin surface interaction.

WE-STIM™ opens a new category of passive-functional wearables and topical products that align with consumer demand for non-invasive, technology-enhanced, and daily lifestyle-friendly wellness and beauty solutions.
Column34:
BarunBio operates at the intersection of functional wearables and beauty-tech. While no direct competitor offers a fully battery-free microcurrent technology, comparable players in adjacent markets include:

?? PowerDot (by Therabody)
EMS-based muscle stimulation devices using wired/battery-operated systems for recovery and performance enhancement.

?? Compex
Portable electrostimulation devices targeting sports recovery, relying on external power and manual application.

?? Foreo & NuFace
Beauty devices utilizing microcurrent technology for skincare benefits — but in the form of hand-held, battery-powered tools.

?? Skins compression, Nike, and other athleisure brands
While these companies offer compression wear or wellness apparel, they do not integrate active energy-conversion or stimulation technology into their textiles.

Unlike these brands, BarunBio's WE-STIM™ technology enables passive, battery-free microstimulation integrated directly into textiles or topical products — offering a unique, non-invasive, and seamless experience for daily use in sports, recovery, and beauty applications.

Column6: D-Shape specializes in 3D printing, creating eco-friendly marine structures to tackle coastal erosion and biodiversity loss. With over 500 installations worldwide, we prioritize sustainability. Our Vitareef division champions ecological conservation.
Column31:
Our business model is structured around serving two primary segments: Business-to-Business (B2B) and Business-to-Government (B2G). Here's how we engage with each:

B2B (Business-to-Business)
In the B2B sector, we target companies involved in marine construction, real estate development near coastal areas, and private environmental organizations. Our offerings to these businesses include:

- Customized Marine Structures: Providing tailored solutions for coastal protection, artificial reefs, and other marine infrastructure needs.
- Consultation and Design Services: Offering expertise in integrating 3D printing technology into existing construction processes, enhancing both efficiency and sustainability.
- After-Sales Support: Ensuring ongoing maintenance and optimization of the structures installed, thereby extending their operational life and maximizing the return on investment.

B2G (Business-to-Government)
In the B2G segment, our clients include local, state, and national governments, particularly those with coastal responsibilities. We provide:

- Coastal Erosion Solutions: Working directly with government agencies to design and implement structures that prevent or mitigate coastal erosion.
- Environmental Conservation Projects: Collaborating on projects aimed at biodiversity conservation and habitat restoration, aligning with governmental environmental initiatives.
- Policy Advisory: Assisting government bodies in developing policies that incorporate advanced technologies like 3D printing into public infrastructure projects, promoting sustainability.

Revenue Streams
Our revenue is primarily generated through:

- Project Contracts: Direct sales through negotiated contracts for specific construction projects.
- Service Agreements: Ongoing consultancy, maintenance, and support services, often structured as long-term agreements.
- Licensing and Partnerships: Licensing our technology to other companies and entering into strategic partnerships, expanding our reach and operational capabilities.

This dual-focus approach allows us to leverage our technological strengths across a broad spectrum of potential clients and projects, ensuring a diversified and stable revenue base while contributing positively to environmental and infrastructural challenges.
Column33:
Our operations utilize a combination of advanced technologies, primarily focused on 3D printing and related innovations that support our commitment to sustainability and efficiency in marine construction. Here’s a detailed look at the key technologies we employ:
1. Large-Scale 3D Printing
•	Binder Jetting Technology: This is a form of 3D printing where a binding agent is selectively deposited to join powder materials. It's particularly suited for large-scale constructions due to its ability to rapidly produce large components with high precision.
•	Concrete Printing: We use a specialized concrete mixture designed for marine environments, ensuring durability against saltwater corrosion and promoting marine life growth on artificial reefs.
2. Materials Science
•	Eco-Friendly Materials: Our research and development team focuses on creating and utilizing sustainable materials that minimize environmental impact. This includes bio-compatible concrete and recycled materials that can endure marine conditions.
•	Smart Materials: We explore the use of smart materials that can adapt to environmental changes or heal themselves to extend the lifespan of the structures.
3. Design Software
•	Advanced tools allow for precise modeling of complex structures, essential for custom designs required in both B2B and B2G projects.
•	Simulation Software: Before physical deployment, we use simulation software to predict how structures will perform in various marine conditions, optimizing designs for both performance and ecological impact.
4. Automation and Robotics
•	Automated Printing Processes: Automation in our printing processes enhances efficiency, reduces labor costs, and increases production speed, crucial for timely project completion.
•	Robotic Assembly: For larger installations, we incorporate robotic systems to assist in the assembly and placement of printed structures in marine environments, ensuring precision and safety.
5. Sensors and Monitoring
•	Embedded Sensors: Sensors embedded within the structures monitor various parameters such as water quality, structural integrity, and marine life activity. This data is crucial for ongoing maintenance and scientific research.
•	Remote Monitoring Systems: Utilizing IoT (Internet of Things) technology, these systems provide real-time data to our clients and maintenance teams, ensuring quick response to any arising issues.
6. Sustainability Innovations
•	Carbon Neutral Processes: We aim to reduce the carbon footprint of our manufacturing processes through energy-efficient technologies and carbon offset initiatives.
•	Recycling Systems: Developing systems to recycle used materials from old or damaged marine structures, promoting a circular economy.
By integrating these technologies, we not only advance our capabilities in marine construction but also ensure that our solutions are sustainable, efficient, and tailored to the specific needs of our clients and the environment.

Column6: A SaaS platform that optimizes asset management with real-time tracking, dynamic allocation, and seamless sharing across internal and external ecosystems. Results? Lower CAPEX, higher ROI, stronger synergies, and a faster shift to a collaborative economy
Column31:
Our business model is based on two main pillars: subscription fees and transaction commissions, enabling us to combine an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) platform with an integrated marketplace.

1/ Subscription Fees for the EAM Platform:

We offer a tiered subscription model with three options:

1.1/ Free Offer: Provides access to the marketplace with the ability to list and rent assets.

1.2/ Pro Offer: Priced at €900/month (or €9,600/year) for full access to advanced asset management tools.

1.3/ Expert Offer: Priced at €1,400/month (or €15,600/year) with additional features such as integration with external solutions and AI automation (via Duke and Claude).

2/ Transaction Commissions for the Marketplace:

MyAssetRocks takes commissions on asset rental transactions:

2.1/ Intragroup Rental: 5% for subscribers, 15% for non-subscribers (for the lessor), and 0% for subscribers, 10% for non-subscribers (for the renter).

2.2/ External Rental: 10% for subscribers, 20% for non-subscribers (for the lessor), and 0% for subscribers, 10% for non-subscribers (for the renter).

This hybrid model ensures we create value for companies looking to optimize their asset usage while generating revenue from both recurring subscriptions and transactional activities. It encourages businesses to subscribe to our platform and actively engage in the marketplace to benefit from reduced transaction fees.
Column34:
Our direct competitors can be categorized into two main groups: EAM solutions and rental marketplaces/professional leasing companies. Let's take a look at both categories to highlight the key differences:

1. EAM Solutions (SAP EAM, IBM Maximo, Oracle EAM)
- What they offer: These are robust solutions designed to help you track and manage a portion of your assets. They are typically feature-rich but can be incredibly complex, requiring expert-level knowledge to operate effectively.

- Limitations: While they provide useful data on asset utilization rates, the question remains: what do you do with that data? These systems provide limited functionality beyond tracking and reporting. They offer no real levers for optimizing asset use, nor do they enable internal or external monetization of underutilized assets.

2. Rental Marketplaces and Professional Leasing Companies (United Rentals, Loxam, Kiloutou, EquipmentShare)
- What they offer: These platforms focus on renting out equipment and machinery to businesses, offering a solution for external asset rental.

- Limitations: However, they do not leverage internal resources or underutilized assets within the organization. They operate in a one-way rental model, where companies have to buy or rent externally without any option for sharing resources internally or monetizing unused assets from their own pool.

So, the question remains the same: what to do with your underutilized assets?

MyAssetRocks offers a complete end-to-end solution for managing your assets, combining internal optimization, intragroup synergies, external monetization, and environmental tracking all on one unified platform.

- Internal Optimization: Maximize the use of your existing assets across the organization.

- Intragroup Synergies: Share resources within different departments or subsidiaries to reduce external rental needs.

- External Monetization: Rent out or sell underutilized assets on a built-in marketplace.

- Environmental Impact: Track and optimize the environmental footprint of your assets, contributing to a more sustainable business model.

What sets MyAssetRocks apart is our hybrid approach, combining the best of both worlds – comprehensive asset management and a marketplace that allows you to monetize and optimize your assets effectively.

Column31:
Morpheus.Network operates a dual-tiered business model tailored to meet the needs of both large enterprises and small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) through two distinct offerings:

1. Enterprise Solution – Morpheus.Network Platform
Our flagship enterprise-grade solution is a powerful middleware platform that integrates seamlessly with existing supply chain systems, enabling organizations to digitize, automate, and optimize their global trade and logistics operations. It supports:

Workflow automation using smart contracts and rule-based triggers

Document digitization and compliance (e.g., customs, COO, EUDR)

End-to-end visibility with real-time data from IoT, geolocation, and APIs

Carbon tracking and sustainability reporting

Blockchain-based traceability and audit trails

Integration with ERPs, TMS, WMS, and 3PLs

This model is consultative and modular, generating revenue through:

Licensing

Integration services

Custom development and ongoing support

It’s best suited for enterprises with complex, global supply chains looking to improve efficiency, transparency, and compliance.

2. SME-Focused Solution – Suite.Supply (formerly Speed.Supply)
Suite.Supply is a lightweight, self-service SaaS offering designed specifically for SMEs to adopt modern supply chain capabilities without heavy IT overhead. It enables:

Easy onboarding and plug-and-play setup

QR-code-based traceability with geolocation pings

Shipping document creation and digital proof of delivery

Basic API access to connect with existing systems

AI-powered tools like HS code identification via chatbot

Revenue is driven by a freemium model:

10 free shipments to start

Then a pay-as-you-go structure (e.g., ~$1 per shipment)

Tiered pricing with volume-based discounts for larger packages (e.g., 250 or 1,000 shipments)

Suite.Supply is ideal for smaller companies or startups needing compliance, visibility, and automation without enterprise-level complexity.

Column31:
1. Platform & Media Monetization
Ad Placement Fees
Through addd-link, advertisers connect directly with media owners. addd earns a commission or service fee for each completed campaign or ad placement executed via the platform.

Proprietary Media Revenue
addd owns and operates smart media formats such as DalgoD (fixed indoor signage) and DalgoT (mobile ad trucks). These media assets are utilized for client campaigns or leased, generating recurring revenue from media operations.

2. AI Data & Analytics Services
Analytics Tool Licensing & Subscriptions
Clients using addd-i or SPACE-i pay subscription or licensing fees to access real-time analytics—covering viewer demographics, attention metrics, foot traffic, and dwell time.

Custom Data Reports & Insights
Brands, retailers, and media operators can request customized reports and insight services, offering added value through deep data interpretation and strategic consulting.
Column33:
addd leverages a suite of advanced technologies to bring digital-grade performance measurement and optimization capabilities to the offline advertising ecosystem.

1. Computer Vision & AI
Audience Analytics with Vision AI
Camera-based AI detects and analyzes viewer count, gaze direction, dwell time, and demographic attributes such as age and gender, providing real-time audience engagement insights. This technology powers addd’s core products, including addd-i and SPACE-i.

Object Detection & Movement Tracking
Utilized to analyze foot traffic and vehicle flow across public, retail, and transit environments, enabling spatial behavior mapping and media value assessment.

2. Data Analytics & Visualization
Real-Time Data Processing Pipelines
High-frequency data from vision sensors and IoT devices is processed through real-time pipelines to support low-latency analytics and event detection.

Custom Dashboards & Reporting Interfaces
Interactive dashboards visualize campaign KPIs, audience patterns, spatial utilization, and media performance, enabling data-driven decision-making.

Predictive Performance Modeling
Combining historical and real-time data, machine learning models forecast campaign outcomes and recommend targeting and optimization strategies.

3. IoT & Embedded Systems
Smart Media Devices (DalgoD & DalgoT)
Equipped with cameras and environmental sensors, these embedded systems deliver measurable, dynamic DOOH experiences while capturing behavioral data at the point of exposure.

Edge Computing Architecture
Enables on-device data processing to minimize latency, enhance responsiveness, and protect user privacy by reducing cloud dependency.
Column34:
addd operates in a competitive landscape alongside several global and regional players offering AI-driven solutions for OOH advertising analytics:

Quividi: A pioneer in audience and attention measurement for Digital Out-of-Home (DOOH) advertising, Quividi utilizes computer vision to analyze viewer count, gaze direction, and demographic data in real time. Their platform provides detailed analytics on audience engagement with physical screens, directly competing with addd's addd-i solution.

Sightcorp (a Raydiant company): Specializing in real-time audience analytics through facial detection and emotion recognition, Sightcorp's technology measures engagement levels in front of screens. Post-acquisition by Raydiant, their solutions have been integrated into broader retail media platforms, making them competitive in both advertising and in-store analytics.

AdMobilize: Offering AI-powered computer vision technology for outdoor and in-store advertising, AdMobilize captures data such as impressions, dwell time, facial demographics, and vehicle counts. Their offerings overlap significantly with addd's addd-i and Dalgo hardware products.

Broadsign: A leading DOOH marketing platform, Broadsign provides programmatic advertising solutions and has integrated audience analytics capabilities through partnerships with companies like Sightcorp and AdMobilize. Their platform enables media owners to deliver data-driven campaigns with real-time audience insights. 

Panasonic: Through its visual systems division, Panasonic explores the integration of audience data into DOOH advertising. By leveraging behavioral patterns and household data, they aim to enhance targeted advertising strategies, aligning with addd's focus on data-driven audience analytics. 


KT (Korea Telecom): As a major telecommunications provider in South Korea, KT has ventured into the DOOH space by developing smart signage solutions that incorporate audience measurement and analytics. Their initiatives in integrating AI and data analytics into OOH advertising present a competitive front in the domestic market.

These companies, through their advanced technologies and strategic partnerships, offer solutions that parallel addd's mission to transform traditional OOH media into intelligent, measurable platforms.

Column33:
Cor.Sync has developed and patented a proprietary method for measuring the concentration of biomarkers and pathogens in complex substances, based on surface plasmon resonance (SPR). This method utilizes nanosensors comprised of metallic nanofilms functionalized with antibodies specific to the biomarker or pathogen used as a diagnostic parameter.
In addition, we offer a clinical decision support software that integrates troponin results with patient electronic health records and uses machine learning algorithms to provide diagnostic probability, risk of mortality, and treatment recommendations.
Column34:
The BioMérieux VIDAS, Radiometer AQT90 FLEX cTnT, Atellica VTLi High-sensitivity Troponin I Assay, and Tosoh AIA-360 devices/tests achieve a coefficient of variation (CV) below 10% for serum or plasma samples. However, this requires a preliminary centrifugation step, which is not practical in an emergency room and must be performed in the clinical laboratory.

In contrast, the Alere Triage Meters Troponin I, LSI Medience/Mitsubishi PATHFAST, Phillips Minicare I-20, Response Biomedical RAMP, and Roche Cobas h 232 devices/tests utilize whole blood with anticoagulant, yet none of them deliver a CV below 10%.

Cor.Sync has developed the first point-of-care system with diagnostic accuracy for troponin, achieving a CV of 6% at the detection limit, which matches the performance of the conventional cTnT-hs tests from Cobas 6000 and Elecsys, traditionally used as the gold standard.

Column31:
We are introducing a new business model strategy, besides direct sales for the Vivax™ ARM robot, featuring flexible leasing plans starting at just $2,000 per month.

What truly distinguishes the Vivax™ ARM is its unparalleled cost-effectiveness. The per-session cost is remarkably low, averaging at just $5.97 for a 50-minute session or $2.98 for a 25-minute session, assuming usage for 350 hours per month, six days a week.

When applied to neurological rehabilitation sessions, the Vivax™ ARM becomes a revenue-generating powerhouse for clinics. Session fees can be set between $50 and $150. For example, at a $50 price point and with 50% clinic occupancy, a 50-minute session can yield an impressive $8,375. With full occupancy, this revenue doubles to a substantial $16,750. Opting for a $150 per session rate, the revenue potential soars to $25,126 at 50% occupancy and an impressive $50,250 at full occupancy.

This extraordinary profitability translates to a swift return on investment, potentially within the same month of deployment. Depending on the price and occupancy rate of the rehabilitation clinic, the return on investment ranges from 4 to 25 times the initial investment, presenting an exceptionally lucrative and expedited business opportunity.

The Vivax™ ARM not only redefines upper limb rehabilitation but also transforms the economic landscape for rehabilitation clinics, offering a financially rewarding investment in the future of healthcare.

CIBLIJOB, la cabine  inclusive qui permet de créer son CV en parlant et de postuler en quelques minutes. Simple, rapide et accessible à tous, elle connecte directement les candidats aux entreprises qui recrutent
Column31:
CIBLIJOB devient  un jobboard physique installé dans des lieux publics à forte fréquentation (gares, centres commerciaux, campus..).
Notre modèle repose sur deux axes :
BtoB : les entreprises achètent des crédits d'annonces pour diffuser leurs offres et capter des candidatures locales.
BtoC : les candidats paient 2 euros pour générer un CV assisté par IA à partir d’une prise de parole orale et postuler immédiatement aux offres.
Ce modèle hybride nous permet de connecter efficacement entreprises et candidats en facilitant l'accès rapide et inclusif à l'emploi.
Column33:
Reconnaissance vocale : pour transformer la prise de parole orale du candidat en texte exploitable pour la génération de CV.
Intelligence artificielle (IA) : pour assister la rédaction, structurer automatiquement le CV, et proposer une mise en forme professionnelle.
Traitement automatique du langage naturel (NLP) : pour analyser et reformuler les informations fournies oralement par les candidats.
Application web embarquée : pour assurer une expérience fluide et intuitive directement sur les bornes physiques sans téléchargement.
Système de multidiffusion des annonces : pour connecter les offres disponibles sur la Jobstation aux bases de données des entreprises et à d'autres plateformes partenaires si besoin.
Infrastructure cloud : pour héberger les données de manière sécurisée et permettre l’accès en temps réel aux CV générés et aux candidatures.

Column31:
Biotechnology – Therapeutic Platform (DeepTech)
Our business model is based on proprietary viral vector technology with applications in oncolytic therapy, gene delivery, and rare neurological diseases. We operate primarily through IP licensing, co-development agreements, and long-term B2B partnerships.
Column33: Synthetic biology, viral engineering, flavivirus-based vectors, oncolytic virotherapy, gene therapy, CNS-targeted drug delivery, CRISPR editing, molecular biology, single-cell manufacturing, IP-based platform development.
Column34:
We currently do not have direct competitors.

IOZ Biotech is pioneering a first-in-class viral vector platform for oncolytic therapy and gene delivery, built using viral intelligence from flaviviruses, particularly the Zika virus. Our approach uniquely combines CNS-targeting capacity, oncolytic properties, and gene therapy potential in a single, adaptable platform.

While other companies may focus individually on oncolytic viruses, gene therapy, or CNS diseases, none leverage flavivirus biology to integrate all three. This gives IOZ Biotech a distinct position in the biotech landscape—with no direct competitors offering this level of innovation, versatility, and therapeutic reach, especially for rare and underserved neurological conditions

Column6: Loretta is a startup using enhanced AFM and in-house AI to offer fast, precise, non-invasive, inclusive biometric skin analysis for cosmetics labs and clinical trials. It aims to support dermatologists and pharmacists with diagnosis and prevention.
Column31: Loretta is positionned as a CRO and offers its service to cosmetic manufacturers big and small, through clinical testing centers or in direct contact. Our clients perform their test and gather their samples, which they send through non-refrigerated mail. Our experts perform the analysis and deliver the data along with a read-through with our team to help our clients understand the results.
Column33: Loretta uses an enhanced, miniaturized and accelerated Atomic Force Microscope specifically designed for skin cells analysis, along with an Artificial Intelligence we developed to analyse our data. These patented technologies have been developed within the Technical University of Denmark (DTU), and Loretta has exclusive access to their use.
Column34:
Very few companies use AFM technology to analyse biological tissue, and none have access to high-speed AFM, giving Loretta a unique position.
In some situations, we can compete with other skin analysis company using different methods (chemical, optical...) but most cosmetics manufacturers are looking for more analysis type to gather more data, in which case our method complements our potential competitors.

Column6: Mappedin is a global leader in indoor mapping and spatial data management. Our solutions power billions of square feet of indoor space and guide millions of people visiting malls, stadiums, airports, offices, hospitals, campuses, and more.
Column31: Mappedin's business model revolves around providing indoor mapping and navigation solutions to various enterprises. We offer a platform that allows businesses to manage their indoor spatial data and create digital wayfinding experiences. Mappedin's solutions are customizable, enabling clients to tailor the software to their specific needs. The company generates revenue through licensing fees for its software, which can be adapted to different scales and types of venues, such as shopping malls, airports, and campuses. Additionally, Mappedin provides tools for clients to update and manage their maps in real-time, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Column33: Mappedin employs several key technologies in its software and solutions. These include a robust Content Management System (CMS), AI-powered indoor mapping editor for real-time map updates, customizable Software Development Kits (SDKs) for creating tailored applications, and support for various platforms such as web, kiosk, and mobile. Mappedin's SDKs are available for JavaScript/TypeScript, React, React-Native, Android Native (Kotlin/Java), and iOS Native (Swift). The platform also supports indoor positioning systems, allowing for visual positioning and integration with device cameras to enhance navigation. Additionally, Mappedin provides tools for rendering 3D indoor maps and offers features like accessible directions, 3D model support, and pre-built map styles.

Column31:
Staff augmentation model
Augment your team with specialized professionals to scale up your workforce on demand.
Ideal for addressing specific skill gaps, scaling up for short term projects and accelerating project delivery.

Dedicated team model
Outsource the management and operation of defined areas so you can focus on core business functions.
Ideal for efficiently managing IT operations, infrastructure and targeted services while reducing overhead and risk.

Fixed scope model
Agree on a set project price and scope to ensure predictability and cost control.
Ideal for well-defined projects with clear requirements, ensuring budget discipline and delivery within agreed timelines.

Collaborative model
Work hand in hand with our experts to develop innovative solutions through shared responsibility.
Ideal for research driven projects, prototyping and knowledge exchange that spark creativity and drive business value.

Licensing model
Access and leverage our proprietary technologies, software and solutions under a licensing agreement.
Ideal for tapping into cutting edge tools to reduce development time and cost.
Column33:
Software & mobile development
We code in mainstream and modern languages (Java, Python, PHP, Node js, Scala, Ruby, JavaScript, TypeScript, Swift, Kotlin, Dart, Objective C).
For front-end we use frameworks like Angular, React, Backbone and Vue. Back-end work runs on Spring, Laravel, ASP NET, Django, Flask, Play, FastAPI, .NET Core, Ruby on Rails and Express. We persist data in SQL (MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and NoSQL stores (MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, DynamoDB). Mobile apps are built natively (iOS, Android) or with React Native, Flutter, Xamarin, Ionic plus package managers like CocoaPods and Swift Package Manager. We also leverage low-code tools Power Automate and Power Apps.

Data & AI
Our data pipelines use Airflow, AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, Camunda, NiFi and Kafka for ETL and streaming. Warehouses include Redshift, Snowflake and BigQuery.
AI work relies on Python libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, scikit-learn), R, NLP toolkits (NLTK, spaCy), OpenAI and LangChain.
For analysis and reporting we lean on Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Power BI, Tableau and Grafana, plus custom dashboards.

Cloud & DevOps
We run on AWS, Google Cloud, Azure and Oracle Cloud.
CI/CD pipelines use Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions and Azure DevOps, with Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm and Argo CD for infrastructure as code.
For monitoring and logs we use Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch and Azure Monitor. API design and testing go through Postman, Swagger and AWS API Gateway.

Quality assurance & testing
Automated tests use Selenium, Appium, Playwright, Cypress, JUnit, NUnit and TestNG. API tests run in Postman, SoapUI and Rest Assured. Test reporting uses Allure and Zephyr.

UX & interface design
We prototype and design in Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Illustrator and Photoshop, with animations in Lottie. Styling relies on CSS, Sass and SCSS. User research and analytics tap into FigJam and Google Analytics.

IoT & hardware
Firmware and embedded code in C, C++, Python with STM32, Arduino and FreeRTOS. Mechanical design in Creo. We follow quality and safety standards (CE, FCC, UL) and choose materials via UL Prospector.

Column31:
1 # SaaS Subscription
Make IT Safe is a cloud-based platform offered via annual subscription, priced based on company size, selected modules, and number of users.
- Scalable model that evolves with client needs and maturity
- 12–36 month contracts to secure recurring revenue and boost customer loyalty

2 # Modular Offering
The platform includes various functional modules (risk analysis, compliance management, security audits, third-party management, action plans...), enabling:
- Usage-based pricing
- Progressive adoption
- Adaptability to different user profiles (CISOs, DPOs, Risk Managers)

3 # Complementary Services
To support successful implementation and usage, Make IT Safe offers:
- Personalized onboarding
- 100% French-speaking support
- Training and change management assistance
- Partnerships with consulting firms for specific missions (e.g. vendor assessment, system integration, compliance)

4 # Target Markets
- Large enterprises and mid-sized businesses (250–5000+ employees)
- Regulated sectors: banking, insurance, healthcare, energy, public sector
- Organizations with strong compliance obligations (GDPR, DORA, NIS2)

Column33:
The Sommie platform employs a modern tech stack and advanced AI capabilities, including:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI):
1. Generative AI, Machine Learning
2. Natural Language Processing (NLP) for user interaction and profiling
3. Computer Vision for label and wine recognition

- Development Stack:
1. Backend: Python (FastAPI), Node.js
2. Frontend: React.js
3. Mobile: React Native (for cross-platform access)
4. Database: PostgreSQL
5. Infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes, AWS or GCP
6. CI/CD Pipelines for continuous integration and deployment

- APIs & Integrations:
1. Integration with restaurant POS/ERP systems
2. E-commerce APIs for product listing, pricing, and logistics
3. Payment gateways and travel booking platforms

This architecture enables scalability, modularity, and rapid deployment across new markets.
Column34:

1. Vivino – Offers wine reviews and user ratings but lacks advanced personalization, sommelier-level pairing, and enotourism integration.

3. Hello Vino – Provides wine recommendations, but focuses mainly on the U.S. market and lacks multilingual, enotourism, and B2B modules.
4. Digital sommelier bots (from wine retailers) – Typically rule-based, lacking true AI personalization and cross-platform experiences.

Sommie’s differentiation lies in its:
1. Use of AI + NLP + Vision for highly personalized recommendations
2. Dual module approach: B2C (users/e-commerces) and B2B (restaurants)
3. Integration with enotourism, logistics, and education
4. Multilingual and international expansion readiness

Wonder DataLabs operates a high-margin B2B SaaS model designed for enterprise scalability and long-term customer value creation:

Revenue Streams:

Platform Subscriptions - Recurring monthly/annual fees for access to our three core platforms (Sentinel, Wise, Mentor), creating predictable, scalable revenue

Usage-Based Pricing - Per-unit monitoring (Sentinel), per-workflow modules (Wise), and per-user licenses (Mentor), allowing customers to start small and expand as value is proven

Implementation Services - One-time professional services fees for platform configuration, integration, and customization, ensuring rapid time-to-value

Success-Based Expansion - Land-and-expand strategy where initial deployments in single departments naturally grow across the enterprise as ROI is demonstrated

Core AI & Machine Learning:
Proprietary LLM Ranking Algorithm - Custom-developed for industrial data interpretation and accuracy

Deep Learning Models - Time-series analysis and anomaly detection for equipment monitoring
Vector Databases - High-performance similarity search for semantic document analysis

MQTT Protocol - Secure, efficient data transmission from industrial equipment
RESTful APIs - Seamless integration with existing enterprise systems

Cloud-Native Architecture - Scalable deployment on AWS/Azure with edge computing capabilities
Containerized Microservices - Kubernetes-based for reliability and scalability
Mobile-First Development - React Native for cross-platform field applications
WebAssembly - High-performance computation in browser environments

Industrial-Specific Innovations:
Digital Twin Modeling - Virtual representations of physical assets

Column6: "Pioneering a responsible digital economy — Peulh Fulani merge Green Tech, Metaverse, and Digital Innovation to protect our planet and oceans, while reimagining how we create, collaborate, and grow sustainably using Technology"
Column31:
Peulh Fulani is a visionary fashion brand that fuses sustainability, cultural identity, and technological innovation. It addresses deep and evolving customer needs through the following dimensions:

Environmental Degradation in the Fashion Industry
The fashion industry is one of the top global polluters—generating excessive textile waste, emitting high levels of CO?, and contributing to ocean and land pollution through microplastics and chemical dyes.
? Peulh Fulani actively challenges this by using recycled plastic—often collected from oceans and coastal areas—to create luxurious fabrics. This initiative supports ocean health while reducing dependency on fossil-fuel-based materials.
Desire for Meaningful Fashion Rooted in Heritage
Today’s consumers are not only looking for sustainable fashion, but for fashion that tells a story. Many brands lack a deep cultural foundation.
? Peulh Fulani brings African heritage to the forefront—honoring craftsmanship, storytelling, and traditional aesthetics—while blending them with modern silhouettes and avant-garde innovation.
Gap Between Haute Couture and Sustainability
Luxury fashion is often perceived as wasteful or disconnected from environmental ethics. On the other hand, sustainable fashion is sometimes seen as lacking elegance or refinement.
? Peulh Fulani bridges this divide by preserving the meticulous standards of haute couture—attention to detail, exclusivity, artistry—within a framework of sustainability and ethical production.
Demand for Digital Integration in Fashion
As fashion expands into the digital realm, customers want immersive experiences that feel authentic and connected to brand values.
? Peulh Fulani leverages the Metaverse (via Atlantis) to co-create fashion in virtual spaces, while exploring AI to generate designs, optimize production, and personalize user experience. This positions the brand at the frontier of fashion tech.
Need for Brands with Social Impact
Beyond style, consumers are increasingly concerned with how brands treat people—workers, artisans, communities.
? Peulh Fulani collaborates with local African artisans, supports women’s empowerment, and fosters inclusive economic development, turning fashion into a tool for societal transformation.
Retailers’ Quest for Innovation and Authenticity
Independent boutiques often struggle to stand out in a crowded market.
? Through exclusive capsule collections, territorial rights, and customizable digital partnerships, Peulh Fulani offers retailers a future-forward, culturally rich, and environmentally responsible brand experience.

Column6: Enerdrape commercializes the world’s first non-invasive geothermal panels to transform underground spaces into renewable heat sources. Easy to install, scalable, and CO?-saving, it’s a breakthrough solution for decarbonizing buildings.
Column31:
Enerdrape operates a B2B business model combining hardware sales and engineering services.

We sell our prefabricated geothermal panels directly to building owners, real estate developers, and energy professionals, along with associated design, feasibility, and engineering services for system integration. Our revenue streams include:

CapEx-based product sales (panels sold per m², currently CHF 150/m²)

Engineering and consulting services

In the future: Energy-as-a-Service (EaaS) and leasing models for recurring revenue

Additional upside: CO? credits and advertising potential on visible installations

We focus on retrofits and new constructions in urban areas, particularly underground car parks and tunnels, and scale through a growing network of installation partners, HVAC firms, and EPC contractors.
Column33:
Enerdrape employs an innovative geothermal technology based on modular, prefabricated, and non-invasive heat exchanger panels. These panels capture geothermal and residual heat from underground environments (e.g., car parks, tunnels) without any need for drilling or excavation.

Key technologies and components include:

Integrated thermal heat exchangers delivering up to 170 W/m²

High-performance, durable materials that are recycled and recyclable

Closed-loop hydraulic circuits compatible with all standard heat pump systems

Modular design allowing for quick installation and scalability

Smart system integration enabling seamless retrofit or new-build deployment

This technology allows efficient, low-carbon heating and cooling in dense urban areas, overcoming the traditional barriers of geothermal energy adoption.
Column34:
Enerdrape’s direct competitors include companies offering geothermal heat pump systems and prefabricated heat exchangers. These include:

Dandelion Energy (US) – Offers residential geothermal systems but requires drilling, making it less adaptable to urban environments.

Celsius Energy (France) – Specializes in geothermal borehole technologies with advanced drilling techniques.

Rehau, Uponor, Kigo – Provide prefabricated thermal exchange systems, though primarily focused on other HVAC or conditioning applications.

What sets Enerdrape apart is its non-invasive approach, allowing installation in existing underground spaces without drilling, making it uniquely suitable for dense urban retrofits and underground infrastructure.

We have open-ended contracts with each of our insurance partners—they pay us for every qualified user we refer, with no volume cap. This creates a recurring revenue stream, reinforced by network effects as more users attract more insurers, and vice versa. 

Soon, we’ll also monetize our AI advisor as a SaaS product and launch a Data offering to deliver market intelligence and user trend insights to insurers.
Column33:
WESUR is built with a modern, scalable tech stack: we use OpenAI to power our insurance copilot, offering personalized guidance 24/7. 
Our frontend runs on Next.js, while our backend combines Express and TypeScript for performance and flexibility. All data is stored securely in PostgreSQL, ensuring reliability and scalability as we grow.
Column34:
On the French market, our historical competitors are legacy insurance comparison platforms like LeLynx, LesFurets, or LeComparateurAssurance. 

But we’re not entering that red ocean head-on. Our positioning is unique: we focus on transparency, personalized advice, and service quality—not just price. This distinct approach allows us to collaborate with insurers who typically avoid traditional comparison platforms, as they don’t want to be reduced to a pricing war. 

Other potential competitors include insurers and insurtechs themselves, but many now become partners or clients, using our tools to enhance their own distribution.

Powered by AI and data, our system is nearly fully automated and highly scalable, enabling us to deliver a premium 24/7 advisory experience while maintaining a lean and efficient cost structure.

Column6: Xpdeep offers the first fully integrated AI framework that turns deep learning from a black box into an actionable enterprise-grade asset — designed to be trusted, governed, certified, and deployed in mission-critical environments.
Column31: Yearly subscription to the full solution + licensing fee on model deployment or usage.
Column33:
Works on PyTorch.
Visualisation application developed on React.
Column34:
Xpdeep competes with a mix of players across three spaces:
- Post-hoc explainability tools like SHAP, LIME, and Captum — which attempt to explain black-box models after training. Unlike these tools, Xpdeep generates explainable models by design, ensuring trust, traceability, and actionability from the start.
- MLOps platforms (e.g., DataRobot, H2O.ai, Seldon, and AWS SageMaker) — which help with model deployment and monitoring but do not offer built-in explainability or intelligent model optimization during the training phase.
- AI framework providers like TensorFlow and PyTorch — widely used for building models, but requiring extensive custom development to achieve the level of governance, explainability, and business alignment that Xpdeep delivers natively.

Xpdeep stands apart by unifying model creation, explanation, simulation, optimization, and deployment into one framework — with built-in governance and actionable intelligence, enabling enterprises to scale certifiable deep learning across high-impact environments.

Column33:
AI supported Liquid crystal contact thermography. 
Contact thermography is a method that allows functional imaging of organ function. The basis of this method is the dermothermic effect, which consists in depicting on the skin surface changes occurring during the formation of new, pathological blood vessels (neoangiogenesis process). This process involves a local increase in temperature around the lesion focus, which manifests itself on the surface of the breast skin and is recorded by liquid crystal matrices in the form of colored images.
https://www.braster.eu/en/technology/contact-thermography

Column31:
We follow a hybrid model combining SaaS, hardware, and subscription-based revenue, structured through strategic licensing partnerships:

SaaS Licensing – Our AI-powered design software is licensed to partners like Autodesk, enabling structural optimization and impact-aware design in existing digital workflows.

Hardware Licensing – We license our portable production units to industrial partners such as Caterpillar for on-site fabrication of circular building components.

DIY Tools & Kits Licensing – We co-develop and license our DIY construction toolkits to tool manufacturers like Hilti, empowering communities to build affordably and efficiently.

Subscription Services – Through partnerships (e.g., with Habitat for Humanity), we offer access to modular architectural designs, implementation support, and community-building tools on a subscription basis.

Carbon Credits – By reducing emissions and material waste, our system generates carbon credits that can be traded, creating an additional revenue stream.
Column33:
AI-Powered Design Software – for structural optimization, material efficiency, and adaptive architecture.

Geometry & Origami Engineering – for modular, foldable, and structurally resilient design strategies.

Circular Design Principles – reducing emissions, waste, and raw material use in construction.

Portable Production Units – compact machines to fabricate 4 circular composite building blocks on-site using local/regolith-like materials.

DIY Construction Systems – toolkits and guides for community-led, low-tech, high-impact habitat construction.

Earth Observation Data (EO) – to inform site-specific design based on terrain, climate, and risk analysis.

ValueCo integrates sustainability into valuation by delivering a transparent, anonymised ESG market view. Our SaaS aggregates internal extra-financial scores from asset managers to eliminate rating noise and capture the market's collective intelligence.
Column31: We are developing a SaaS product with an annual subscription to align with industry standards, especially the practices of ESG data providers. Asset managers, listed corporates, and institutional investors can access dedicated analytics depending on their use cases. Asset managers who share proprietary data can access a free tier on our platform with limited analyses as an incentive to keep contributing to our model.
Column33:
ValueCo offers a SaaS platform for professional investors and listed companies. By aggregating proprietary ESG scores from asset managers with public financial data, our platform captures the market sentiment on a company's sustainability performance and isolates the direct impact of sustainability initiatives on market performance. 

Data science and AI algorithms automate the stages of anonymisation and normalisation of each data signal and the resulting market models. They leverage advanced statistical techniques and machine learning to determine the causal link between ESG performance and financial outcomes (e.g., ROE, profitability). 

Our product either works as a standalone platform or interacts with our clients’ internal systems through APIs. We follow best practices in cybersecurity, as highlighted by our ISO27001 and SOC2 compliance.
Column34:
Some of our competitors offer indicators or scores directly, such as MSCI, Morningstar and ISS, or combine different existing services to offer a new, more flexible and personalised service. However, this type of service does not enable investors to understand their biases, communicate their differentiating factors or improve their shareholder engagement.

Audit or advisory actors can address the same issues as us, but with an expensive, unsystematic bespoke advisory approach and lower market coverage. Their services are highly targeted and only cover part of the dimensions we cover with our analyses.

Column6: In Situ is a healthtech startup that uses cell therapy to developed innovative approaches to healing human tissues. Our first product is the 3D biodressing to treat patients with chronic wounds and severe burns. Our goal is to improve the quality of life.
Column31:
The Mesencure product will be manufactured at In Situ’s laboratory and distributed through reference hospitals that treat patients with chronic wounds and burns.
We currently have the capacity to produce 400 Mesencure units per month. Once we reach the commercialization stage, these biodressings will be distributed at an estimated cost of $1,500 per unit.
Column33:
Technologies employed
We use 3D bioprinting technology to produce biodressings containing stem cells. These dressings, called Mesencure, are applied directly to wounds or burns, offering a non-invasive and highly effective treatment approach.
Mesencure contains stem cells derived from human umbilical cord tissue, which significantly accelerate the healing process in patients suffering from hard-to-heal wounds, such as chronic ulcers and severe burns. By preventing complications, Mesencure contributes to reducing overall treatment costs for both patients and healthcare systems.
A single local application is often enough to markedly improve wound healing. In addition to being painless and easy to handle, Mesencure offers a user-friendly solution for healthcare professionals.
This stem cell-based bioprinted technology is unprecedented both in Brazil and internationally. Currently, our indirect competitors are conventional treatments—such as ointments, standard dressings, and dermal matrices—which often fail to fully resolve the wound or take a long time to do so.
Column34:
Among the indirect competitors that come closest to Mesencure’s technology (which involves cultured cells) are three U.S.-based products: Apligraft and Dermagraft (both by Organogenesis), and Epicel (by Genzyme). None of these are currently available in Brazil.
Apligraft and Dermagraft use skin cells derived from donors. In addition to their high cost (approximately $2,000 per application), a major drawback is that they provide only temporary wound coverage and are eventually rejected by the patient’s body. This requires weekly dressing replacements, significantly increasing the overall treatment cost.
Epicel, on the other hand, uses the patient’s own skin cells, which are not rejected. However, it is a highly personalized therapy, making it non-scalable. Another significant limitation is the extremely high cost—between $6,000 and $8,000 per 1% of body surface treated.
Mesencure (In Situ) is made from human umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells. These cells—our product’s core therapeutic agent—are obtained from donated umbilical cord tissue, a biological material that is typically discarded as medical waste, resulting in a highly available and sustainable cell source.
Moreover, these stem cells have strong therapeutic potential for wound healing and are not rejected by the recipient, making Mesencure a scalable and effective treatment option.
In summary, Mesencure’s main competitive advantages are its superior technology, more accessible cost, and a safe, sustainable production process.

Column6:
Avec A2D découvrez notre système automatisé de pointe capable de capter, traiter et analyser en temps réel, les données des infrastructures et ouvrages.
 Grâce à notre technologie, l’évaluation de l’état de santé des bâtiments n’a jamais été aussi précis
Column31:
* Target Sectors: Seaport, Energy, Insurance and smart cities.

* Market Trend: Global infrastructure monitoring market projected to grow due to increased investment in smart infrastructure and digital transformation.

* Revenue Model: Subscription-based SaaS platform with tiered pricing based on project size, data volume, and feature usage.
Column33:
A2D offers an end-to-end software solution for the automatic detection and evolution analysis of infrastructure defects, geolocated onto a detailed 3D digital twin. The innovation lies in the full automation of the entire workflow, from data acquisition using drones and sensors, to near real-time data processing, enabling faster inspection and monitoring of large-scale infrastructures. This drastically accelerates the monitoring process, ensuring that even long-range infrastructures are continuously inspected for potential issues.

The novelty of A2D's approach is its All-in-One SaaS platform, a revolutionary solution that empowers infrastructure managers to oversee the entire lifecycle of their assets—from construction monitoring to maintenance—in a fully integrated, digital environment. This new paradigm eliminates the need for multiple tools, offering seamless access to high-resolution data, actionable insights, and automatically generated technical reports, all through a single, scalable platform.
Column34:
A2D "Acquire to Decide" competes globally in the AI-driven infrastructure monitoring space, particularly in the structural health monitoring (SHM) domain. Globally, competitors include large players such as Siemens, GE Digital, IBM, C3.ai, PTC, and Hitachi, all of which offer AI-powered digital twin solutions, predictive maintenance, and industrial IoT applications. In Japan, competitors like Hitachi and Fujitsu lead the market with similar capabilities, combining AI, IoT, and data analytics to monitor infrastructure health and safety.
A2D distinguishes itself by offering end-to-end SaaS solutions that automate the entire process, from data acquisition via drones (terrestrial, aerial, and submarine) to the generation of comprehensive technical reports, through fusion with Experts’measurement directly into the plateforme, in real-time. This comprehensive automation, which includes the use of 3D digital twins, sets A2D apart from competitors who often require more fragmented or manual workflows. A2D's real-time monitoring and defect evolution tracking capabilities allow infrastructure managers to act faster and more efficiently, saving time and reducing operational costs compared to competitors that focus on either isolated monitoring or require additional integration efforts.
A2D also emphasizes scalability and security with a cloud-native approach, making it ideal for long-range infrastructure such as highways, bridges, and ports. While other competitors offer AI tools, A2D's fully integrated and automated system, including geolocalization of defects, represents a novel SaaS approach to SHM that simplifies infrastructure management and maintenance, appealing to sectors like insurance, reinsurance, and civil engineering.

Column6: BlueMarvel AI helps industrial teams assess the health of their operations by connecting to existing systems and using AI to flag what’s critical, what can wait, and what’s improving—so you can act faster, reduce downtime, and boost efficiency.
Column31:
BlueMarvel AI Business Model
BlueMarvel AI monetizes through a tiered platform model combining recurring revenue, professional services, and future IP licensing.

We meet customers where they are on their digital maturity curve — starting with diagnostics and scaling into embedded intelligence.

1. Snapshot (One-Time Diagnostic Reports)
What it is: A fast, no-integration historical data assessment
Revenue model: One-time fee per report (
Customer value: Low-lift entry point that proves value quickly
Business value: Scalable lead-gen and cash-generating gateway

2. Live Deployment (Recurring Software Revenue)
What it is: Always-on, real-time monitoring of operational health
Revenue model: Annual recurring revenue (ARR) via SaaS licensing
Customer value: Continuous insight, alerts, and performance tracking
Business value: High-margin, sticky recurring revenue

3. Solution Development (Custom AI + Integration)
What it is: Tailored analytics, integration with OT/IT systems
Revenue model: Time & materials or milestone-based fees
Customer value: Solves high-value, site-specific challenges
Business value: Funds product development and deepens relationships

4. Future Model: IP Licensing & Data Monetization
Strategic roadmap:
Licensing of AI models and insights into OEMs and platforms
Aggregated, anonymized industrial benchmarking
Business value: Long-term defensible moat through proprietary models and datasets.
Column33:
Core Technologies Behind BlueMarvel AI

AI & Machine Learning
Anomaly detection using unsupervised learning (e.g., isolation forests, autoencoders)
Time-series forecasting for equipment behavior and performance degradation
Root cause analysis algorithms tailored to multivariate process data
Custom scoring models for operational health and triage

Industrial Data Engineering
Time-series data pipelines built on tools like InfluxDB, Apache Kafka, and Python/Pandas
Normalization & contextualization of OT data (e.g., PI System, PLCs, SCADA)
Edge-to-cloud architecture for real-time and historical analysis

Software Stack
Backend: Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL
Data infrastructure: Snowflake, AWS S3, Redshift, or customer-specific environments
APIs: RESTful APIs for easy integration with existing IT/OT systems

User Interface & Visualization
Custom web UI using React and Plotly/D3.js for interactive triage views
Visual scoring dashboards with red/yellow/green prioritization
Exportable PDF & Excel reports for snapshot delivery

Security & Compliance
Data never leaves customer control unless explicitly shared
Follows industrial cybersecurity best practices 
Deployable on-prem, in private cloud, or hybrid environments

Using a breakthrough plasma-catalytic process, GERAD Tech helps pollutant-heavy industries reduce their carbon footprint while turning their waste into hydrogen.
Column31:
GERAD Tech operates on a hybrid business model combining:
1.	Technology Licensing – We license the PC-H?SMR process to refineries, petrochemical plants, and biogas units, with contracts including upfront license fees and recurring royalties based on hydrogen production volume.
2.	Catalyst Sales & Recycling—We supply proprietary, patented catalysts as reactor consumables and offer annual replacement and recycling services.
3.	Technical Support Subscriptions – We offer annual maintenance packages that cover remote monitoring, system upgrades, and performance optimization.
Column33:
The PC-H?SMR (Plasma-Catalytic Hydrogen Sulfide Methane Reforming) project by GERAD Tech integrates multiple advanced technologies to enable clean hydrogen production while valorizing industrial waste gases. The key technologies employed are:
1- Non-Thermal Plasma (NTP)
2-Heterogeneous Catalysis
3-Plasma-Catalysis Coupling
4-Modular Reactor Design
5-Gas Separation and Product Recovery
6-IoT & Data Monitoring
7-Thermodynamic and CFD Modeling
Column34:
Our top three competitors in the hydrogen production space are:
1.	Steam Methane Reforming (SMR) – The incumbent method, which, although cost-effective, produces high CO? emissions and relies on water and fossil fuels.
2.	Methane Pyrolysis – An emerging process that splits methane into hydrogen and solid carbon without CO? emissions, but is energy intensive and less proven at scale.
3.	Electrolysis (Green Hydrogen) – Produces zero-emission hydrogen using renewable electricity, but remains prohibitively expensive for industrial-scale applications.
PC H?SMR differentiates itself by using waste H?S and CH?, operating without water input, and generating valuable co-products, thereby offering superior economic and environmental benefits.

Column6: NeuroSoV is an academic spin-off targeted at developing innovative therapies for neurologic disorders. Our first asset is a drug candidate capable of slowing down the progression of Parkinson Disease. We are currently finalizing the pre-clinical stage.
Column31: License the molecule to a pharma or big biotech after the conclusion of phase one of clinical trials.  Proceed with the development of molecules on our pipeline.
Column33: Biotechnology and drug development
Column34:
The Parkinson’s disease treatment landscape is divided into symptomatic treatments, which alleviate symptoms without addressing disease progression, and gene therapies that target specific genetic mutations. Companies like Acorda Therapeutics and Roche lead in symptom management, while firms like BIAL and Bayer-AskBio focus on gene therapy. NeuroSoV stands out by targeting the underlying pathological mechanisms of the disease, complementing both existing treatment approaches and addressing unmet needs in the market. Symptomatic treatments involve therapeutic drugs that alleviate the symptoms by targeting motor and non-motor symptoms, without addressing the underlying disease or slowing its progression, providing temporal relief. Some of the pharmaceutical companies that provide them are (Table 1):
 
-	Acorda Therapeutics (Inbrija)
-	AstraZeneca (MEDI1341)
-	Edison Pharma (Vatiquinone)
-	Prana Biotechnology (PBT434)
-	Prexton Therapeutics (Foliglurax)
-	Prothena Corporation (PRX002)
-	Roche
-	Sanofi
-	Abbvie
-	Acadia Pharmaceuticals
-	Biogen
-	Lilly

Column6:
Revolutionizing Performance, Recovery & Beauty with Bioelectric Innovation

BarunBio is a next-generation tech company from South Korea pioneering WE-STIM™, a patented battery-free microcurrent technology seamlessly integrated into apparel and skincare.
Column31:
BarunBio is a Korean deep-tech company pioneering battery-free microcurrent stimulation (WE-STIM™), applicable to both textiles and topical formulations.

We operate two models:
?? B2B: OEM/ODM, licensing, and co-development with partners in performance wear, recovery gear, and beauty-tech.
Suitable for wellness, athletic, and luxury brands seeking science-backed innovation.

?? B2C: HYVLE, our in-house brand, offers athleisure, socks, and supports that deliver recovery and performance benefits through wearable microcurrent stimulation. (Sold via hyvle.com.)

? We empower global partners to launch smart recovery & skincare products — without batteries, devices, or discomfort.
Column33:
WE-STIM™ (Wearable Electrical Stimulation) is BarunBio’s proprietary battery-free microcurrent technology that passively generates low-level electrical stimulation through body movement and ambient electromagnetic energy — without requiring any batteries, wires, or charging devices.

?? Fully Device-Free
No electronics or external components — the stimulation is created by specially engineered textile structures or formulation matrices, seamlessly embedded into apparel or cosmetic products.

?? Textile & Topical Integration
WE-STIM™ is integrated into performance wear, compression gear, and skincare patches & fomulation using proprietary conductive fibers or materials, ensuring comfort, flexibility, and washability — while maintaining the look and feel of ordinary clothing or cosmetics.

?? Functionality through Daily Use
By simply wearing the product during normal activity, users experience continuous low-level stimulation that is designed to support muscle engagement or enhance skin surface interaction.

WE-STIM™ opens a new category of passive-functional wearables and topical products that align with consumer demand for non-invasive, technology-enhanced, and daily lifestyle-friendly wellness and beauty solutions.
Column34:
BarunBio operates at the intersection of functional wearables and beauty-tech. While no direct competitor offers a fully battery-free microcurrent technology, comparable players in adjacent markets include:

?? PowerDot (by Therabody)
EMS-based muscle stimulation devices using wired/battery-operated systems for recovery and performance enhancement.

?? Compex
Portable electrostimulation devices targeting sports recovery, relying on external power and manual application.

?? Foreo & NuFace
Beauty devices utilizing microcurrent technology for skincare benefits — but in the form of hand-held, battery-powered tools.

?? Skins compression, Nike, and other athleisure brands
While these companies offer compression wear or wellness apparel, they do not integrate active energy-conversion or stimulation technology into their textiles.

Unlike these brands, BarunBio's WE-STIM™ technology enables passive, battery-free microstimulation integrated directly into textiles or topical products — offering a unique, non-invasive, and seamless experience for daily use in sports, recovery, and beauty applications.

Column6: NEKOD helps enterprises govern and de-risk business-built software, from legacy macros, to no-code apps and AI generated tools. We automate compliance, risk assessments, and visibility across shadow IT.
Le Koinpost is a platform that connects residents to local composting points and rewards them with organic produce in exchange for logging their food waste deposits on the app.
Column31:
Le Koinpost operates on a subscription-based model. Users pay a small monthly fee (e.g. €3) to access the platform, geolocate composting sites near them, and earn points each time they deposit their food waste. These points can be exchanged for rewards—mainly organic produce from local AMAPs and urban farms—creating a circular, local, and sustainable ecosystem.

On the other side, Le Koinpost partners with CO-OPs and urban producers and grocers to distribute rewards, and compensates them monthly based on user activity. Additional revenue streams may include partnerships with municipalities or CSR programs with companies looking to engage citizens or employees in low-carbon practices.
Column33:
Le Koinpost relies on a web-based progressive application accessible via mobile and desktop, built with lightweight front-end frameworks (React.js) and a back-end powered by Node.js and Firebase for real-time data handling. The platform integrates geolocation services (Google Maps API) to help users identify nearby composting points and log their deposits.

We use a points-tracking system that records user activity and translates it into tangible rewards. A basic admin dashboard allows compost site managers to validate deposits and track local engagement. The system is designed to be scalable and modular, allowing us to integrate future features such as QR code scans or smart bin sensors for automated tracking.

Data collected is anonymized and helps us generate insights on user behavior and compost activity at the neighborhood scale—valuable for both platform improvement and public stakeholders involved in waste reduction and urban sustainability.
Column34:
Le Koinpost operates at the intersection of waste reduction, civic tech, and local food systems. Its direct competitors fall into a few categories, but none combine all its features (geolocation + rewards + community composting). Some key players include:

Les Alchimistes

Eisenia / Trivéo / Label Verte

Ma Petite Planète (for behavior change, gamified ecology)
? Offers digital eco-challenges with point systems, but not focused on composting or circular food systems.
Too Good To Go (indirect competitor)
? Offers food waste reduction via surplus food rescue, but no composting component.
