Cellex is an Italian SME developing next-gen bioreactors for biotech, tissue engineering, and cultivated meat. Its patented systems improve efficiency by up to 200%, enabling scalable, reproducible, and low-stress cell culture across diverse applications.
Column31:
Cellex operates under a B2B (Business-to-Business) model, selling its technologies directly to companies, research institutions, and clinical or industrial labs. Its business model is structured around two complementary streams:

Hardware Sales
Cellex designs, manufactures, and sells proprietary bioreactors—SUSPENCE® and BioAxFlow—to customers in the biopharmaceutical, regenerative medicine, and cultivated meat sectors. These systems are sold as capital equipment with high added value and scalability.

Recurring Revenue through Consumables and Services
The bioreactors are designed to work with custom accessories, scaffolds, cartridges, and technical support services, providing Cellex with a recurring revenue stream beyond the initial equipment sale.

Collaborative R&D and Public Funding
Cellex participates in EU-funded and national R&D projects, often in partnership with universities, hospitals, and biotech companies. These projects help fund innovation, validate new use cases, and drive early adoption.

Scientific and Clinical Co-development
Cellex works with research centers and early adopters to generate peer-reviewed publications using its technologies, which in turn build scientific credibility and facilitate market entry in regulated sectors.

This blended model enables Cellex to sustain a technology-driven, capital-light growth strategy, combining high-margin product sales with long-term relationships and recurring income.
Column33:
Cellex integrates a unique combination of hardware engineering, fluid dynamics, automation, and materials science to create next-generation bioreactor systems for advanced cell culture. Its technologies include:

Impeller-Free Suspension Culture (SUSPENCE®)

Uses non-mechanical mixing to circulate cells and medium, eliminating traditional impellers.

Minimizes shear stress, leading to higher cell viability and better consistency, especially in the production of monoclonal antibodies, vaccines, and other biologics.

Patent-protected design ensuring homogeneous culture conditions at scale.

Perfusion-Based 3D Tissue Culture (BioAxFlow)

Enables automated cell seeding and controlled medium perfusion through scaffolds.

Designed for tissue engineering, disease modeling, and cultivated meat.

Creates uniform oxygen and nutrient distribution, ensuring reproducible 3D growth across tissue types.

Supports various biocompatible scaffold materials with interchangeable holders.

Optimized Fluid Dynamics

Both systems rely on precision flow design to avoid gradients, reduce dead zones, and create physiologically relevant environments.

This leads to superior cell proliferation, differentiation, and metabolic activity.

Modular, Scalable Design

Devices are built to support scaling from research labs to industrial production, addressing a key gap in translational biomanufacturing.

Modular architecture allows for custom configurations and integration into existing workflows.

Automation & Digital Integration (planned expansion)

Although currently focused on hardware, Cellex is integrating sensors, data acquisition, and process control systems.

This sets the stage for smart bioprocessing and AI-driven digital twin applications, enhancing reproducibility and compliance.

Advanced Materials & Fabrication

Use of biomedical-grade materials, including borosilicate glass and biocompatible resins.

Components are designed for sterility, chemical resistance, and GMP compatibility.

Together, these technologies allow Cellex to deliver high-efficiency, low-stress, and highly reproducible bioprocess environments, addressing the unmet needs of modern biotech, regenerative medicine, and food-tech sectors.
Column34:
Examples of direct competitors:

Sartorius AG (Germany)

Global leader in bioprocessing equipment, including stirred-tank bioreactors.

Key Difference: Focus on traditional systems; lacks Cellex’s impeller-free or perfusion innovations tailored for tissue engineering and cultivated meat.

PBS Biotech (USA)

Offers Vertical-Wheel™ bioreactors for high-efficiency cell suspension.

Key Difference: Optimized for bulk cell expansion; Cellex offers broader application with 3D perfusion and scaffold support.

Cellec Biotek (Switzerland)

Specializes in perfusion bioreactors for tissue engineering.

Key Difference: Strong in static culture models; Cellex provides dynamic flow, automation, and scalability.

Eppendorf (Germany)

Produces a wide range of small- to mid-scale bioreactors.

Key Difference: Generalist approach; Cellex targets specialized, high-performance niches with integrated design for emerging biotech sectors.

Synthecon (USA)

Focused on Rotating Wall Vessel bioreactors for 3D cultures.

Key Difference: Uses low-shear microgravity simulation; Cellex achieves more controlled and scalable flow with perfusion.

We use bioinformatics pipelines optimized for FFPE samples, low-input DNA, and multi-tumor applications. Robust data security, regulatory compliance, and scalable infrastructure ensure performance, reliability, and adaptability in clinical and research environments.
Column34: Our key competitors include Guardant Health, Foundation Medicine, Tempus, Invitae, Caris Life Sciences, and NeoGenomics, all major players in genomic profiling and biomarker discovery. Other companies like SOPHiA GENETICS and PathAI overlap in broader data-driven medicine and AI-powered diagnostics. Unlike larger, generalized platforms, MSInsight stands out with its specialized approach to MSI detection using next-generation sequencing (NGS) data, offering a nimble, high-precision alternative tailored for clinical and research applications.

Joulzen transforms old oil tanks into intelligent thermal batteries. We capture surplus renewable energy as heat when it's cheapest, reducing heating costs by 94% while increasing energy independence to 87%. Don't worry, heat happy!
Column31:
Our business model combines hardware, software, and energy market integration for multiple revenue streams:

1. Hardware Solution (B2B2C): 
We sell our tank transformation systems through local installers who serve as trusted intermediaries. Homeowners benefit from government subsidies covering 75-100% of installation costs in many regions, while we maintain healthy margins of approximately 30% per system.

2. Software Optimization (SaaS+): 
Our model-predictive control system operates at two tiers:
- Basic functionality is included with all installations
- Premium features unlock advanced optimization that increases efficiency by an additional 30%

Rather than a flat subscription fee, we implement a profit-sharing model where we capture a percentage of the additional savings generated by our system, creating perfect alignment with customer interests.

3. Flexibility Aggregation (Future):
As our installed base grows, we'll aggregate these distributed thermal batteries into a virtual power plant. This allows us to offer grid-balancing services to transmission system operators during periods of energy surplus, generating revenue that we share with our customers.

Enterprise Solutions: Larger organizations can access customized plans that include advanced features and integrations, with pricing based on project complexity. ?

Alp Valley operates on a custom-built solution model, where we act as a project orchestrator.

We sell the client a turnkey solution (advisory + coordination + final delivery) under a global contract.

Column31: We operate under a SaaS business model, leveraging our innovative GenAI platform, Sesame®, to deliver scalable and flexible solutions tailored to enterprise needs. Our pricing is designed for SMEs with 100 to 1,000 employees, ensuring both accessibility and cost-effectiveness. Subscriptions range from €11 to €15 per user per month, based on a 12-month contract with monthly payments.
Column33:
The deep tech innovation behind Sesame® is built on the following core features:

•	E2EE RAG Architecture: Ensures full data ownership, confidentiality, and compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2, and the European AI Act. Sesame® uses AES-GCM encryption, encrypted vector databases, and secure enclave infrastructure for unmatched security and privacy.
•	LLM-Agnostic EU Language Support: A modular LLM architecture supports multiple open-source models, optimizing for different languages and user configurations.
•	Shared Knowledge with Adapters: Integrates tenant-wide public knowledge through transformer-based adapters, enabling efficient model tuning.
•	Advanced Running Context Window (RCW): Uses state-of-the-art NLP to actively manage conversation history, creating high-level memory chunks for better context retention.
•	Enhanced Contextual Understanding: Combines VectorDB for semantic retrieval with Knowledge Graphs for advanced relational data mapping.
•	Sesame.API (RAGaaS): Provides a public API offering Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) as a Service, supporting advanced query completion and knowledge management.
•	Click2onPrem: Enables fast, secure on-premises deployment of RAG solutions, maintaining strict data security while transmitting only operational logs and health data.
•	Agents: Specialized agents manage and execute complex multi-step tasks within the RAG pipeline.
•	Knowledge Synchronization Automation: Automates updates to knowledge nuggets through dynamic subscription logic that detects changes in data sources.
•	Trusted References and Enrichment: Cites knowledge sources directly in LLM answers and enriches responses using AI-Act-compliant EU search engines.

These features highlight our commitment to delivering a cutting-edge platform for advanced language processing and robust data management, tailored to meet the complex needs of modern enterprises.

Yello is a audio-based mobile learning app for middle and high school students. Using AI, microlearning, and gamification, it offers personalized learning, aligned with official curricula. Beyond students, It's also addresses teachers' and schools' needs.
Column31: Yello operates on a freemium business model that ensures accessibility while generating sustainable revenue. Core content—audio lessons, summaries, and quizzes—is offered free of charge and available offline, making it accessible to students regardless of their location or financial means. Premium features, such as microlearning, personalized learning paths, progress tracking, AI tools, and advanced performance analytics, are available through a subscription model. In parallel, Yello collaborates with institutions—governments, NGOs, and schools—to integrate the platform into formal education systems, often through subsidized or sponsored access.

It uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) for personalized content recommendations and adaptive learning paths, tailored to each learner’s level and progress.  The AI also powers a writing assistant and an educational chatbot to support students in real time. The platform is designed to allow content downloads, enabling students to study offline ensuring reliable access even in low-connectivity areas.  Data analytics are integrated to track usage, and monitor student performance. These technologies work together to deliver an engaging, inclusive, and efficient educational solution.
Column34: Yello’s main direct competitor in Senegal is Jangalma, a mobile platform that also targets secondary school students with educational content. While Jangalma offers lessons and exercises online, its approach is primarily text-based and often requires an internet connection. In contrast, Yello delivers audio-based content accessible offline, combines microlearning, and integrates gamification to boost engagement. Moreover, Yello leverages AI for personalization, offering a tailored learning experience that Jangalma currently lacks. This positions Yello as a more inclusive, mobile-first, and context-adapted solution for learners across francophone Africa.

Cyber4Care - Archify.fr: Resilience Tech® for healthcare and local authorities. A sovereign, low-energy appliance combining hardware, collaborative software, and AI to maintain operations even without IT or network access.
Column31:
We operate on a hardware-enabled SaaS model. Archify.fr is delivered as a physical appliance combining a secure local server, a pre-configured collaborative environment, and specialized AI support for business continuity. Clients pay an initial fee for the device and installation, followed by an annual license covering maintenance, updates, cloud backup, and AI services.

This model ensures high value from the start and predictable recurring revenues. Our primary customers—public healthcare institutions, medico-social organizations, and local authorities—value sovereign, stable, and supportable solutions. Our offer is simple, transparent, and compatible with public procurement frameworks.

Beyond the sale of appliances, our growth strategy includes strategic partnerships for regional-scale deployment, recurring licensing (1 800 €/year/device), and premium services (multi-site coordination, simulation exercises, custom content).

Our model scales through networks, not users: we grow by equipping structures site by site, enabling local resilience at scale.
Column33:
Archify.fr combines several technologies to ensure local operational continuity—even without access to IT infrastructure or the internet.
Edge computing: All critical data and collaborative tools are hosted locally on a secure appliance (NAS + firewall/router), enabling autonomous operation during outages.

Collaborative software suite: A pre-configured environment provides local messaging, file sharing, plan access, and coordination tools usable by non-technical staff.

Specialized AI assistant: Our contextual AI system is trained specifically on business continuity (PCA, Plan Blanc, PCS…) and guides users in degraded situations—activated through alternative secure networks.

Encrypted cloud backup: A lightweight, sovereign mechanism ensures remote backup of documents without compromising data privacy or performance.

Frugal design: The solution is optimized for low energy consumption, high availability, and minimal dependency on external systems.
Column34:
Archify.fr addresses a need that is not fully covered by existing solutions. While there are players in cybersecurity (bastion hosts, detection tools) and in crisis management (cloud-based platforms), none provide a local, autonomous, and sovereign solution tailored to the operational reality of public services.

We differ from:

    Cybersecurity appliances (e.g., Stormshield, Gatewatcher) focused on perimeter defense, but not designed for degraded operations.

    Cloud-based crisis management tools (e.g., Imago, CrisisGo), which become inaccessible if networks go down.

    Classic SaaS collaboration platforms, which require both connectivity and IT teams to operate and maintain.

Archify.fr opens a new space: Resilience Tech®—a category of sovereign, low-energy digital tools designed to maintain public missions when digital infrastructure fails.

Column34:
In France, Pixstart’s main direct competitors with EcoScan are Kayrros (if they expand further into biodiversity), TerraNis (satellite-based environmental monitoring), and Kermap (land cover and vegetation analysis). While many companies around the world use Earth Observation (EO) data, very few are specialized in biodiversity assessment, and even fewer are able to transform open EO data into actionable, sector-specific insights.

Pixstart already serves multiple sectors — including water, energy, and infrastructure — with operational satellite-based monitoring solutions. With EcoScan, we are now expanding our offer to cover biodiversity and ecological quality assessment, fully aligned with CSRD and the EU Taxonomy. This positions Pixstart as a differentiated player in a high-potential, still under-addressed market segment.

Column6: Illuminate the Future with NRG ON! Smart savings in style. Our innovative shading system blends intelligent light control with clean energy generation. Experience the harmony of design, tech, and sustainability. For a greener tomorrow with light & shadow.
Column31:
The business model is based on an innovative approach in the field of green technologies and sustainable energy solutions, specifically for both the private and commercial sectors.
NRG-ON offers a scalable and user-friendly solution for integrating photovoltaic systems that not only benefit the environment but also provide economic advantages for our customers. At the core of the business model are various key partners who support us in the development and distribution of the product.

Key Partners and Activities:
Our core activities include continuous research and development as well as prototype creation. We focus on integrating additional components, ensuring user-friendly installation and integration of our systems, as well as launching and distributing the product. We are building partnerships with suppliers and manufacturers and handle capital acquisition and financial planning. In addition, we aim to achieve certifications and standards to ensure high quality and reliability for our customers.

Pilot Partners:
Our key partners include pilot customers such as Fritz-Walter-Stadion Kaiserslautern GmbH, Bauernhof statt Altenheim e.V., Atca Verkehrstechnik GmbH, Kamaste.it Softwareentwicklung, IT-Projekte und Vertrieb GmbH, and Balkon-PV Trippel. These partners support us with market entry and test our products in real-world settings. We are also mentored by via-mon GmbH, which supports us in R&D and scaling production.

Key Resources:
Our main resources at NRG-ON are in the field of R&D—specifically the technologies and innovations developed in-house. Additional resources include production facilities and infrastructure, qualified human resources, and a growing brand, along with promising partnerships and customer relationships. To realize our vision, initial capital and financing—as well as patents protecting our technological solutions—are essential. Further valuable resources include strategic cooperations and networks that enable the founding team to effectively deploy green technologies and materials.

Value Propositions:
With our core product, NRG-ON delivers a sustainable, affordable, self-sufficient, and easily (dis)mountable energy solution for everyone. In addition to the core product, we offer a range of customizable solution packages tailored to individual customer needs. These range from the base unit to combination solutions with inverters and storage systems, and even comprehensive setups for new buildings. Particularly notable is our integrated approach, which enables renewable energy solutions to be efficiently implemented in both existing structures and new developments.

Customer Relationships:
Our B2B customer relationships are highly personalized and include tailored offerings and individual consultations. The team plans to offer regular training sessions and webinars to help clients get the most out of our products. Furthermore, NRG-ON provides a comprehensive after-sales service and offers system upgrades and extensions. An exclusive customer portal allows easy management of products and services.

Sales Channels:
We utilize a range of distribution channels, with an initial focus on pilot projects and proactively managed direct sales to corporate clients (B2B). We also collaborate with sales partners and real estate developers and participate in trade fairs and events to showcase our product to a broader audience. Long-term, distribution will primarily be handled in partnership with companies in the construction and window industries, where large order volumes are expected.

In preparation for the later B2C outreach phase, social media and influencer marketing will play a key role. The same applies to planned direct sales through a NRG-ON-branded online shop and partnerships with DIY stores and retailers, targeting eco-conscious consumers seeking to reduce their energy costs and carbon footprint.

Target Groups:
Our business model addresses both B2B and B2C customers. In the B2B segment, we focus on large companies and institutions interested in sustainable and cost-effective energy solutions. In the B2C segment, we target environmentally conscious consumers looking to lower their energy bills and carbon footprint.

Cost Structure:
Our cost structure includes production costs, research and development expenses, marketing and sales expenditures, logistics and delivery costs, as well as operating and administrative expenses. Additional costs arise from technology and software development and financing efforts to support our growth.

Revenue Streams:
Our primary revenue stream comes from product sales, where customers make a one-time purchase. Additionally, we offer subscription models for maintenance services and software solutions. Bulk orders from B2B clients are another significant source of income. Revenue is also generated through training and consulting services that help clients maximize the benefits of our solutions. Further income is derived from licensing our technology and from the sale of energy data and analytics.

Conclusion:
This business model supports a sustainable and scalable solution to future energy challenges. With our innovative approach and focus on green technologies, we aim not only to make a positive ecological impact but also to achieve economic success. The NRG-ON team is confident that this model not only meets current demands but will also make a significant contribution to the energy transition of the future.

Column6: IDCITI is a GNSS tech startup offering uGPS, an indoor GNSS solution that provides sub-meter accuracy in GPS-denied areas like tunnels and parking structures. Using SDR, uGPS integrates with existing GPS receivers without extra hardware.
Column31: uGPS addresses the critical pain point of GPS signal loss in indoor and underground environments such as tunnels and parking garages. Customers—including smart city developers, public infrastructure managers, and autonomous mobility services—struggle with accurate positioning where satellite signals fail. uGPS provides seamless, high-precision indoor positioning using SDR-based GNSS signal emulation, ensuring navigation continuity and enhanced safety.
Column33: The uGPS system is an SDR-based GNSS signal generator that uses an FPGA and a high-precision OCXO clock to generate real-time satellite-equivalent waveforms. It transmits these signals into indoor environments via an RF module and antenna. With a proprietary correction algorithm, uGPS maintains location accuracy within 3 meters even while in motion. It is fully compatible with existing GPS receivers, enabling seamless positioning indoors and underground without additional devices. Users can continue using smartphones and in-vehicle navigation systems as usual.

Column6: PINECO develops ThermoCure, an eco-friendly concrete heat-curing system that reduces CO2 emissions by 64% and ensures safe, efficient curing. We provide flexible solutions for construction and precast industries aiming for carbon-neutral innovation.
Column31:
PINECO operates a B2B business model centered around licensing and direct sales of its eco-friendly heat curing system, ThermoCure, to construction companies and precast concrete manufacturers.

We generate revenue through two primary channels:
1. System Sales & Installation – For precast concrete factories, we offer full system sales and integration services.
2. Rental & Service Contracts – For construction sites, especially those requiring temporary installations (e.g., winter concreting or infrastructure projects), we provide rental-based systems with tailored technical support.

In addition, we pursue government-funded deployments and public-private partnerships for eco-infrastructure initiatives, aligning with global carbon neutrality goals. Our long-term strategy includes scaling through local distributors in key overseas markets and developing digital control platforms for smart curing process optimization.
Column33:
Our core technology, ThermoCure, integrates advanced heat transfer engineering, energy optimization algorithms, and environmentally safe materials to deliver high-efficiency concrete curing.

The key technologies employed include:
1. Localized Surface Heating Technology: Instead of heating the entire curing space, we apply heat directly to the concrete formwork using embedded flexible heating pads, dramatically improving thermal efficiency.
2. Smart Temperature Control: Real-time temperature sensors and feedback algorithms enable precise control over curing conditions, ensuring concrete strength development and minimizing thermal stress.
3. Modular System Design: Our system is easy to deploy and scale across various construction environments, from remote infrastructure sites to automated precast production lines.
4. Low-Carbon Curing Process: ThermoCure replaces fossil-fuel combustion systems with clean electric heat sources, enabling CO? emission reductions of up to 64% and energy savings of up to 79%.

These technologies ensure safer work environments, superior concrete quality, and compliance with global decarbonization standards in construction.
Column34:
Our direct competitors include companies that offer traditional steam or fossil-fuel-based curing systems, as well as a few emerging players developing electric curing solutions for concrete. These include:
1. Conventional boiler-based curing system providers widely used in precast plants and winter construction.
2. Localized electric heating solutions from engineering firms attempting to address energy consumption, though often limited in scalability or control precision.
3. Companies developing insulated curing tents or thermal blankets, which offer passive heat retention but lack active control and energy efficiency.

However, PINECO’s ThermoCure stands apart through:
1. Direct heat application to the formwork, reducing energy loss.
2. Real-time smart temperature control, ensuring consistent concrete quality.
3. Proven field performance in extreme cold-weather infrastructure projects.

Significant reductions in CO? emissions and operating costs, verifiable through quantified data.

We’re not just improving an existing process—we’re redefining how concrete is cured with climate technology at its core.

Column31:
Toonimotion produces short-form animations based on licensed webtoon IPs and monetizes them through a B2BC, B2B, and B2C model.

B2BC:
We distribute localized short-form animations to global OTT platforms such as Netflix, YouTube, DramaBox, and Rakuten Viki. This hybrid model targets both platform buyers and end viewers, ensuring fast, scalable global distribution.

B2B:
We produce animations for webtoon IP holders with adaptation needs. In addition to production fees, we retain partial rights to derivative works, generating long-term royalties.

B2C:
Our content is available to global users via our own streaming website (toonimotion.net) and YouTube channel, where we offer premium episodes on a pay-per-view basis.

Digital cutout animation workflow built on professional video software, optimized for converting static webtoon images into dynamic short-form content

Column6: Fair Patterns is an AI solution that takes the headache out of digital compliance. Digital regulations are rising, and 97% of sites have legal violations. We find these issues 100 times faster than humans and fix them easily.
Column31:
Fair Patterns operates on a subscription B2B model. We charge businesses, law firms and regulators based on (i) the number of domains they want to audit, (ii) the number of jurisdictions they want to cover and (iii) whether they want a dedicated fair pattern for each violation (i.e. an interface already adapted to their brand graphic charter and tone of voice), or whether they want a generic fair pattern in each case, that they will adapt themselves.
Fair Patterns also includes a dedicated subscription for our AI agent which helps designers and developers avoid creating new dark patterns at the mockup or integration stage.
We also developed a cookie scanner which scans both the code and the UI of cookie banners: this is a distinct yearly subscription based on the number of cookie banners our clients want to scan.
Column33:
We use 4 large language models: Gemini, GPT-4-o mini, Microsoft Phi.3.5 and Baselabs Flux, that combine NLP and computer vision.  We chose these models because they are context specific. We have heavily fine tuned these models and created hundreds of subagents to detect breaching interfaces at a very granular level.

Our architecture is as follows:
Infrastructure layer: Google cloud, chosen because reliable and cost effective
Data layer: research based insights, deceptive design website, secondary research, chosen because context specific
Database structure: JSON, tabular database, chosen because efficient
Language layer: python and react, chosen because scalable 
Code layer: GitHub, Google cloud, Google firebase, Google chrome store, chosen because scalable
Application layer: React, deployed on Vercel, chosen for ease of use.
Column34: We have one competitor in Australia: The Dark Patterns Lab.

Column6: CloudFret is a smart freight platform using real-time data and AI, to reduce empty return trips and cut transport costs. With over 18,000 trucks and a profitable hybrid model (SaaS + services), now expanding to Spain and France, and raising funds to go global.
Column31:
CloudFret operates a multi-revenue model:

- Commission per transaction: ~25% on each matched shipment.

- SaaS subscriptions: Monthly fees of $50 (transporters) and $100 (shippers) to access advanced features.

- Value-added services: Monetized services such as fuel optimization, insurance, and spare parts for transporters.

This hybrid model ensures both recurring revenue and strong margins, while driving network effects and long-term stickiness within our ecosystem.

'- AI & predictive algorithms for real-time freight matching, minimizing empty truck mileage.

- IoT integration (GPS + weight sensors): Enables real-time tracking and identification of available cargo space.

- Data analytics & carbon reporting: Offers clients dynamic dashboards for CO? savings, operational efficiency, and route optimization.

Cloud-based platform (web + mobile): Scalable infrastructure supporting international expansion and seamless user experience.

Our proprietary tech stack is designed to scale globally while delivering measurable environmental impact through logistics decarbonization.
Column34:
CloudFret operates in a competitive landscape that includes both traditional freight brokers and digital freight platforms:

- TIMOCOM (Germany): A large European freight exchange platform, primarily focused on load-posting rather than real-time optimization.

- ONTRUCK (Spain): Digital freight brokerage focused on last-mile and regional transport in Western Europe.

- TRUKKER (UAE): Active in the Middle East and North Africa, with an emphasis on full-truckload digital brokerage.

- Convoy (USA - ceased operations): Former benchmark in digital freight matching and sustainability focus, showing high VC interest in this model.

- Fretron and Blackbuck (India): Emerging players focused on digitizing trucking in fragmented markets.

Unlike these competitors, CloudFret uniquely targets the Europe–Africa corridor with a dual-market focus, integrating AI-driven empty truck detection, real-time cross-border matching, and a business model combining commission, SaaS, and value-added services—making it the first climate-positive freight tech leader across the Mediterranean.

Column6: SafeSip empowers rural Africa with its biomimicry-inspired straw, a portable three stage filter that removes 99.99% of pathogens. At just $5 each, our eco-friendly straw provides up to 1500 liters of safe water over 5 years, reducing plastic and diseases.
Column31: SafeSip’s revenue combines affordable direct sales, strategic partnerships, and grant funding to drive both impact and sustainability. We sell each straw at $5 (50% gross margin on $2.50 COGS) through local retailers, school programs, micro?distributors and our e?commerce site, with bulk discounts (10–25%) for NGOs, schools and government agencies. Partnerships with WASH programs and humanitarian organizations under subsidized distribution agreements extend our reach into hard?to?serve communities. Non?dilutive grants (Tony Elumelu, GIZ, Climate?KIC) and impact investment (Cemex S.A.B. de C.V.) fuel R&D and working capital. We also generate recurring revenue from paid training and technical advisory services on filter maintenance and water?quality monitoring. Looking ahead, a refill-and-replace cartridge program ($1 per membrane) will deepen customer relationships and capture ongoing value throughout the straw’s five?year lifespan.
Column33: SafeSip straws integrate cutting?edge filtration and biomimetic design to deliver safe drinking water instantly: a 0.01??m ultrafiltration membrane (mimicking kidney glomeruli) removes 99.99% of bacteria, parasites and microplastics; a non?woven particulate pre?filter captures sediment; and an activated?carbon layer embedded with antimicrobial peptide?inspired beads (modeled on Bombina orientalis defenses) inhibits biofouling while improving taste. All components are housed in recycled, food?grade polymer casings engineered for durability and low flow resistance. Our proprietary membrane fabrication and bead functionalization processes ensure consistent pore size, long lifespan and scalable, low?cost manufacturing.
Column34: SafeSip’s direct competitors include LifeStraw and Vestergaard’s LifeStraw Go, which use hollow-fiber membranes for point?of?use filtration; Sawyer Products’ PointONE syringe filters offering ultrafiltration cartridges; Katadyn Micropur chemical treatment packets that inactivate pathogens; and GRAYL purifiers combining electroadsorption and UV in compact bottles. While these solutions also deliver safe drinking water, SafeSip’s biomimicry?inspired 0.01??m UF membrane, antimicrobial carbon beads, recycled?plastic housing, five?year lifespan and $5 price point uniquely balance performance, affordability and sustainability.

Column6: Planivore helps public organizations track strategic and climate action plans. Our platform ensures alignment, accountability, and transparent progress reporting through structured initiatives and dynamic performance dashboards.
Column31:
Planivore’s business model is a hybrid SaaS + professional services model tailored for public sector and institutional clients:

1. SaaS subscriptions:
- Autonomous plans (monthly or annual) for smaller organizations.
- Enterprise plans (licensing per user or per site) for larger clients, with advanced features like multi-plan tracking, reporting modules, and integrations.

2. Professional services:
- White-glove onboarding
- Strategic plan structuring and data import
- Training and change management

3. Partner model:
- Certified strategic planning consultants use Planivore with their clients.
- Channel partnerships with digital transformation firms.

4. Optional modules:
- Financial planning (e.g. municipal capital investment plans)
- Public dashboard for citizen transparency
- AI assistant for plan creation and monitoring (under development)
Column33:
'- Modern web stack
- Cloud-based: Hosted on secure, scalable infrastructure
- API integrations: Microsoft 365 / Azure
- Data visualization: Interactive dashboards and progress indicators (gauges, color codes)
- AI integration (in progress): NLP-based assistant for plan generation and risk detection
- Role-based access control: Fine-grained permissions for transparency and governance
Column34:
Direct competitors of Planivore include:
	1.	Cascade – Strategic execution software for large organizations, with a focus on OKRs.
	2.	AchieveIt – Tracking platform for strategic plans, widely used in government and healthcare.
	3.	Perdoo – OKR and strategy execution platform with real-time dashboards.
	4.	Profit.co – OKR-based system with strategy mapping and task tracking.
	5.	WorkBoard – Strategy execution tool used by large enterprises with AI-powered insights.
	6.	Mooncamp – Strategy and OKR software with flexible dashboards and integrations.
	7.	Pytheos – France-based SaaS for strategy tracking and public sector reporting.

These tools often focus on private sector KPIs or corporate OKRs, while Planivore differentiates itself with:
- Public sector alignment (climate plans, transition strategies, citizen transparency),
- Structured strategic plans (not just OKRs),
- Integrated financial and accountability modules,
- Public dashboards,
- French and English support, multilingual platform

Column6: BeZero Carbon is a carbon ratings agency. It equips world-leading organisations with the knowledge, tools and confidence to make better climate decisions. Its aim is to scale investment in environmental markets that deliver a sustainable future.

Holis is a collaborative LCA and eco design platform that enables companies to quantify, improve and report their products and services' socio-environmental performance, blending AI with a didactic interface to assess various impacts across any supply chain.
Column31:
Holis is offered as a SaaS solution, with annual subscriptions ranging from €3,000 to €200,000 (excl. VAT), depending on the industry, the number of modelizations, the level of support, and selected options such as ERP/PLM integration or website embedding. This model generates a 77% gross margin after accounting for variable costs (cloud infrastructure, environmental data licenses), enabling strategic reinvestment in R&D and customer acquisition.

These efforts are primarily focused on highly regulated sectors such as textiles and construction, where demand for Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) solutions is growing rapidly.

With over 30 clients to date, we experienced strong growth in 2023, with revenue increasing by 380% and the team size multiplying by 2.5. We aim to maintain a similar momentum in 2024, while staying true to our core impact objective: an average environmental footprint reduction of 20% compared to baseline scenarios. These results underscore the relevance of our model and the growing adoption of our solution by companies.
Column33: As a SaaS provider, our main resources are our talent and our cloud infrastructure. Beyond equipment and standard work tools (GitHub, Notion, Workspace), our development team uses a classic tech stack (React, Node, PostgreSQL) to streamline hiring. On the infrastructure side, our partnership with Microsoft facilitates deployment (hosted in France, ISO 27001 certified), particularly for AI technologies (NLP, optimization) that automate data extraction and verification.
Column34:
'- Simapro (Netherlands - 1990s) - One of the first LCA software, and exclusively dedicated to experts. It enables to conduct highly-detailed, complex assessments, and is one of the market leader.

- GaBi / Sphera (USA - 1990s) - Similar to SimaPro, it is slightly more user-friendly. However, it tends to favour its internal environmental database, hindering efforts to make studies transparent and comparable with one another at a global level.

- Glimpact (France - 2017) - one of the new-gen LCA platform, which is known for focusing exclusively on the PEF methodology drafted by the EU. They participate in various official French and EU LCA boards and also offer a company-wide approach (OEF). However, they restrict modelling to narrow LCA surveys, limiting the variety of products that can be assessed (and excluding services).

- FairlyMade (France - 2018) – A SaaS solution specifically for the textile industry. It operates as an expert firm with a digital interface for exchanging results with clients, offering a higher level of analysis but (besides their ecodesign tool launched late 2024)  retaining expert constraints such as longer waiting times and a data collection process with intermediates.

As a younger company (founded in Oct. 2022), we have not yet implemented some of the advanced features available in SimaPro and GaBi (i.e. sensitivity analysis) and are only on the beginning of our ESG offer (CSRD, carbon footprint, etc.) compared to Glimpact. Nevertheless, our interface and automation features have been preferred by expert and novice users alike for their ease-of-use and efficiency. We have faced and won RFPs against all of these four competitors.

Column6: MUZARD jewelry gives you complete control over your fragrance. Choose the intensity and duration, and preserve your perfume's original character, without chemical contact with the skin. All this (super)power on your wrist, elegantly. Your scent, your way.

Quideos provides tailored price coverage for all agricultural products, helping farmers, cooperatives, and agri-food companies secure their margins and plan investments with confidence, across the entire value chain.
Column31: Quideos operates on a transaction-based model. We offer tailored price hedging contracts to agri-food stakeholders - farmers, cooperatives, processors, and distributors - who need to protect themselves against agricultural price volatility. Quideos covers a wide range of agricultural products such as meat, fish, fruits, vegetables, cereals and inputs (eg. packaging). Clients pay a premium, and in return, receive a pay-off if market prices fall outside the selected range. Our revenue comes from this premium, making our model accessible, scalable, and directly aligned with client needs.
Column33: Quideos technologies combine data analytics and financial modeling. We use statistical algorithms to process historical price data (from sources like INSEE, FranceAgriMer, Eurostat) and evaluate risk exposure. Our web platform enables users to configure coverage scenarios based on price ranges, volumes, and timeframes.
Column34: Quideos addresses a gap that most traditional tools leave open. On one side, crop insurance covers yield losses but not price volatility. On the other, financial hedging tools (like futures and options) are only available for a small number of listed commodities, typically used by large market players. Our closest international competitor is Stable (US/UK), who offers price risk solutions for some agricultural products, but is not active in Europe. In France and Europe more broadly, no player currently offers price coverage on non-listed agri-food products making Quideos a first mover in this space.

Column6: MellowVans are electric delivery vehicles that provide low-cost, efficient, and emission-free utility services in cities. They are unique, replacing traditional delivery motorcycles, bikes, and larger vans.
Column31:
MellowVans Updated Business Model
MellowVans designs and manufactures purpose-built electric delivery vehicles optimized for last-mile logistics. Our business model focuses on two primary channels:

Outright Vehicle Sales

Direct sales to fleet operators, logistics companies, and retailers.

Includes optional after-sales service, racking, branding, and fleet management technology.

Enables customers to own the asset outright and manage their own operations.

Finance Leasing Solutions

Structured lease agreements (typically 3–5 years) that include maintenance, telematics, and optional insurance.

Reduces upfront capital requirements and simplifies total cost of ownership for clients.

Ideal for clients looking for flexibility, operational support, and lower financial barriers to adoption.

Value-Added Services
Branding & Advertising Solutions: Customizable vehicle wrapping for high-visibility marketing.

Fleet Management & Telematics: IoT-enabled tracking, data analytics, and route optimization.

After-Sales Support: Maintenance, spare parts, and customer service through certified partners or direct support channels.
Column33:
Electric Vehicle (EV) Technology:
Our electric delivery vehicles utilize advanced EV technology, encompassing electric motors, battery systems, and sophisticated power management solutions. This ensures efficient propulsion and sustainable operation while contributing to a quiet and emissions-free transport system.

Internet of Things (IoT) Connectivity:
The vehicles are equipped with full IoT functionality, integrating sensors and communication technologies for real-time monitoring and data collection. This includes precise tracking of shipment location, temperature control, and monitoring of overall shipment condition, enhancing the reliability and security of our delivery services.

Cold-Chain Technology:
To cater to the transportation of sensitive goods like perishable items or pharmaceuticals, our vehicles incorporate cold-chain technology. This technology maintains specific temperature conditions throughout the journey, ensuring the integrity of the transported items.

Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure:
As part of our commitment to sustainability, the project includes an electric vehicle charging infrastructure. This encompasses the technology associated with electric vehicle charging stations, providing convenience and accessibility for our electric delivery vehicles.
Column34: MellowVans operates in a competitive landscape that includes both global and regional players offering electric delivery vehicles and micro-mobility solutions. Key competitors include companies like B–ON, EAV, Tropos Motors, and ARI Motors, who provide various electric cargo vehicles targeting last-mile delivery. Traditional van manufacturers like Renault, Nissan, and Ford are also entering the small electric van segment with larger, more expensive models. However, MellowVans differentiates itself through its balance of affordability, cargo capacity, and operational efficiency, positioning it as a cost-effective alternative to both cargo bikes and full-size electric vans.

Column34:
Our direct competitors are the current solutions used today, which include:
-> Road vehicles (vans, ambulances, personal cars):
Often oversized and costly for transporting small medical or urgent payloads. Not efficient in rural or low-density areas.
->Helicopters:
Technically capable but expensive and overkill for most lightweight deliveries.
->Lack of service:
In many areas, especially rural (in France near our HQ, not in Zimbabwe only) or remote, no delivery solution exists at all — people or healthcare workers have to move the goods themselves.

We don’t compete with innovation.
We compete with absence, inefficiency, and excessive cost.

Our revenue strategy evolves with market maturity.
Short-term (Now):
•	Direct sales to academic centers and hospital networks
•	Upfront cost plus SaaS subscription
•	15+ Letters of Intent for paid pilots already secured
Medium-term (2-7 years):
•	License to MedTech companies with operating room (OR) presence (e.g., scopes, robotic, integrated ORs, etc.).
•	Leverage existing distribution networks and reimbursements (bundles)
•	Current term sheet (not signed) from major MedTech distributor, advanced conversations with most
Long-term (7+ years):
•	Value-based outcomes model
•	Percentage of cost savings from reduced complications
•	Policy-driven adoption, pushed by payers already investing in the space
This staged approach allows us to generate early revenue while building the partnerships and evidence needed for larger-scale deployment. As surgical societies and payers push for more transparent and consistently high-quality surgical care, our value-based model becomes even more attractive.

Column6: Abyssale is an AI-powered platform that helps Agencies and Marketers generate banners and visuals at scale for ads, emails, print campaigns and social media. We automate creative production to save time and boost performance.
Column31:
Abyssale operates on a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) business model with a combination of subscription-based and usage-based pricing. Customers subscribe to monthly or annual plans that scale according to feature access, team size, and volume of creative output. The platform offers flexible pricing tiers—from self-serve plans for individuals and small teams, to customized enterprise packages that include advanced automation capabilities, API access, and dedicated support.

In addition to core subscriptions, Abyssale monetizes through usage-based components such as credit consumption for asset generation, API requests, and asset storage. The platform also offers optional add-ons and integrations, including custom onboarding, branded template development, and white-label solutions for agencies and partners. This hybrid pricing model enables Abyssale to serve a wide range of customers—from startups to large marketing teams—while aligning revenue with platform usage and value delivered.
Column33:
Abyssale’s technology stack is purpose-built to address one of the most pressing challenges in digital marketing today: scaling high-quality creative production through automation and AI.

At its core, the platform combines a high-performance, cloud-native architecture with proprietary rendering and layout systems. The backend—built with Go, Python and Node.js—supports fast, parallelized image generation across thousands of variations, while a React-based frontend ensures a seamless user experience. This foundation enables both self-serve users and enterprise teams to operate at scale without sacrificing quality or control.

What truly sets Abyssale apart is its hybrid creative engine, which integrates state-of-the-art AI models (GPT-4, Flux, Claude) with proprietary layout analysis tools powered by OCR and YOLO-based vision systems. These models are orchestrated through in-house pipelines that transform raw AI outputs into structured, editable, and reusable creative assets—a core capability that most generative tools lack.

The result is not just visual content generation, but agentic creative automation: marketers can prompt the platform to generate multi-format, brand-consistent banners that remain fully editable—unlocking a new layer of creative operations at scale.

The platform is tightly integrated with the broader marketing ecosystem through tools like Zapier, Make.com, and Airtable, ensuring smooth adoption and measurable ROI. Abyssale’s infrastructure, deployed across AWS, is designed for global scalability, high availability, and rapid iteration through CI/CD.

This technical foundation is not only a barrier to entry—it’s also the engine behind Abyssale’s vision to become the infrastructure layer for creative automation in the AI era.

Column6: Capoom leverages AI-driven automated 3D modeling to generate on demand, ultra-realistic, lightweight 3D synthetic data and digital twins; empowering autonomous systems, robotics, digital-twin applications, architecture, and the metaverse.
Column31:
Capoom’s business model combines:
	1.	SaaS API Subscriptions – tiered monthly/annual access to OPUSAPI.
	2.	Usage-Based Fees – metered billing by data volume, scene complexity, or compute time.
	3.	On-Premise Licensing – term or perpetual licenses for air-gapped or regulated environments.
	4.	Paid Pilots ? No-Touch Conversion – bespoke paid pilots that convert into self-serve, automated subscriptions.
	5.	Reusable Endpoint Library – pilot-built endpoints added to a catalog, enabling rapid onboarding of new clients.
Column33:
We’ve built Capoom on a modern, cloud-native AI/3D stack:
	•	Procedural Modeling Engine (C++ core with Python bindings) for fully parametric 3D asset generation
	•	Image-to-3D Reconstruction & Gaussian Splatting for photorealistic scene capture
	•	Heuristic Pipeline (domain rules + controlled randomization) in Python
	•	AI Layer leveraging fine-tuned LLMs (e.g. OpenAI/GPT-style models via RAG) and CV networks (PyTorch, Detectron2) to ingest text, images or CAD
	•	Microservices & API (REST/gRPC) containerized with Docker & Kubernetes
	•	GPU-Accelerated Compute on NVIDIA hardware (CUDA) via AWS/GCP clusters
	•	CI/CD & Infra as Code (GitHub Actions, Terraform) for rapid iteration and scale
Column34:

Column6: NEYOS develops and produces geolocated alert devices combining cellular network and 5G satellite. OTRAC, the first solution in the range, addresses multiple challenges: personal protection, logistics supervision, vehicle tracking, etc.
Column31:
NEYOS combines several complementary revenue streams: the sale or rental of its OTRAC device, coupled with connectivity monetization through two models.
Subscription plans, designed for industrial and logistics use cases, provide recurring revenue. Pay-per-use credits offer greater flexibility, tailored to seasonal or event-driven needs.
This hybrid model allows NEYOS to address a wide range of use cases efficiently.
To accelerate the distribution of its technology, NEYOS is currently building a network of distribution partners, with business referral models under development.
Column33:
NEYOS has developed a three-part solution: a robust hardware device, a proprietary embedded operating system, and a dedicated cloud infrastructure for collecting and leveraging field data.

Connectivity is based on global cellular and satellite standards, ensuring full interoperability with existing infrastructures.
This technological choice eliminates any dependency on closed or proprietary systems such as Starlink, Iridium, or GlobalStar.

Our platform is designed to integrate seamlessly with existing B2B software ecosystems, turning raw field data into high-value operational services.
Column34:
There are competitors in each of the verticals addressed by NEYOS — from personal tracking in remote areas to field logistics and outdoor events (non-exhaustive list: Garmin, Spot, Queclink...).
Most existing devices rely exclusively on either cellular (4G) or satellite connectivity. This specialization limits their coverage, flexibility, or cost-efficiency.

Many current solutions come from the B2C world or are designed for very specific use cases, often with limited interoperability, rigid subscription models, or complex integrations.

In contrast, NEYOS stands out with a standardized hybrid 4G/satellite technology, a business model combining recurring and usage-based revenue, and a professional B2B vision focused on field performance, interoperability, and scalable deployment.

Column6: SenseBioTek is pioneering early cancer detection through a revolutionary technology analyzing volatile organic compounds emitted by the human body. It's a non-invasive screening tool, easy to use and cost-effective, dedicated to healthcare professionals.
Column31:
SenseBioTek adopts a B2B model, targeting general practitioners as key users and entry points for early cancer screening in primary care. Our economic model is designed to ensure accessibility, affordability, and seamless integration into medical practices.
1. Device-as-a-Service (DaaS):
- We provide our diagnostic device through a leasing or subscription model, minimizing upfront costs for physicians.
- The subscription includes hardware access, software updates, maintenance, and user support.
2.	Single-Use Test Kits:
- Revenue is primarily driven by the sale of single-use VOC collection kits, ensuring a scalable and recurring income stream.
3.	Pay-per-Test or Monthly Plans:
- Flexible pricing models, pay-per-test or bundled monthly packages, allow practitioners to choose based on their patient volume and budget.
4.	Added Value for Practitioners:
- Enables early diagnosis and enhances clinical decision-making.
- Potential for insurance reimbursement or government support in the context of public health programs.
- Creates an opportunity for general practitioners to generate additional revenue beyond standard consultations by offering innovative diagnostic services.
Column33: Our non-invasive diagnostic device captures VOCs through a single-use collection system, then transfers them to a detection chamber equipped with advanced nanosensor arrays. These sensors detect specific VOC patterns associated with cancerous activity. The data is processed using AI-driven signal analysis to deliver rapid and reliable diagnostic insights, directly at the point of care.
Column34: SenseBioTek’s direct competitors are companies developing non-invasive cancer detection technologies based on breath analysis These include Owlstone Medical (UK), Breathomix (Netherlands),  and Menssana Research (USA).

Column6: SnapAll by TimelapseLab is AI-powered software for remote construction site monitoring. It works with any IP camera or TimelapseLab 4K device, blurs sensitive data for privacy, and sends automated alerts, reports, and updates to users.
Column31: Snapall offers at a recurring monthly cost, the real-time construction site monitoring software that simplifies industry 4.0 technologies. The platform seamlessly integrates with any existing camera connected to the internet, allowing for complete, fast, and easy project oversight directly from your smartphone via automatic timelapses and smart reports.
Column33: SnapAll uses advanced AI and neural networks to provide real-time construction site monitoring. It integrates with existing cameras to offer seamless monitoring via a web app. Key technologies include AI-driven alerts for milestones and safety hazards, automatic image blurring for GDPR compliance, and real-time detection of people, vehicles, and materials. SnapAll also generates automatic timelapse videos, enhancing project documentation and communication. These cutting-edge technologies make SnapAll an efficient and secure solution for construction site management.
Column34:
Competitors like viAct, EVERCAM, and OpticVyu offer specialized cameras or systems for construction site monitoring, but they often require additional hardware and lack seamless integration with existing cameras. Some competitors also provide AI-driven analytics, but they fall short of SnapAll’s commitment to GDPR compliance with real-time image blurring for privacy protection. While they offer basic timelapse and reporting features, none match SnapAll’s combination of automatic timelapse video generation and smart, AI-powered alerts for milestones and safety hazards.
What truly sets SnapAll apart is its all-in-one solution that integrates effortlessly with existing cameras, ensures full privacy compliance, and provides advanced AI features, making it the most flexible and reliable choice for construction site monitoring.

TiCON System Ltd., HQ in South Korea, with offices in Bangladesh and USA, specializes in generative AI, Agentic AI, and DevOps. Our 100+ engineers delivers cost-effective, tailored software for startups to enterprises, driving innovation and global growth.
Column31:
TiCON System Ltd. operates a robust business model centered on delivering high-value, technology-driven solutions through Generative AI, Agentic AI, DevOps, and cloud services. Our model is designed to address customer pain points, drive innovation, and ensure cost-effective, scalable outcomes for startups, SMEs, and large enterprises. Below is an overview of our business model, aligned with our expertise and global presence in South Korea (HQ), Bangladesh, and the USA:

1. Revenue Streams
Custom Software Development: We design and deliver tailored software products, including AI-powered applications and DevOps solutions, to optimize business processes. Clients pay for end-to-end development, from ideation to deployment, based on project scope or milestone-based contracts.
Cloud Migration and Support Services: We offer Free AWS Migration to attract clients to our cloud ecosystem, generating revenue through ongoing AWS Monthly Billing Support and managed cloud services. This includes infrastructure optimization, cost management, and security enhancements.
Outsourcing Partnerships: As a trusted outsourcing partner, we provide dedicated teams of engineers for long-term or project-based contracts, charging based on time-and-materials or fixed-price models.
Consulting Services: We offer consulting in AI, DevOps, and cloud strategy, charging hourly or project-based fees to help clients architect scalable, AI-driven solutions.
Subscription-Based AI Solutions: For select AI-powered tools or platforms (e.g., automation or analytics solutions), we may offer subscription models, ensuring recurring revenue.

2. Value Proposition
Cost-Effective Innovation: By leveraging AWS-managed services and our 100+ skilled engineers, we deliver high-quality, customized solutions at competitive prices, addressing the pain point of high development costs.
Seamless Cloud Adoption: Free AWS Migration and billing support remove barriers to cloud adoption, ensuring scalability, security, and cost efficiency.
Tailored AI and DevOps Expertise: Our focus on Generative AI and Agentic AI enables clients to integrate cutting-edge technology, solving the challenge of limited in-house AI expertise.
Global Reach, Local Expertise: With offices in South Korea, Bangladesh, and the USA, we provide localized support while delivering globally scalable solutions, addressing outsourcing reliability concerns.
Agile Delivery: Our highly motivated, self-organized team ensures timely, high-quality delivery, reducing time-to-market for clients.

3. Customer Segments
Startups: We help early-stage companies build cost-effective, scalable software and cloud infrastructures to accelerate growth.
Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs): We provide tailored AI and DevOps solutions to optimize operations and compete with larger players.
Large Enterprises: We deliver complex, secure, and scalable solutions for corporations seeking digital transformation or outsourcing partnerships.
Industries: Our services span healthcare, finance, e-commerce, manufacturing, and more, addressing diverse business needs.

4. Cost Structure
Human Resources: Salaries for our 100+ engineers, AI specialists, and DevOps experts across South Korea, Bangladesh, and the USA form a significant portion of costs.
Technology Infrastructure: Investments in AWS partnerships, cloud tools, and AI development platforms ensure cutting-edge service delivery.
Marketing and Sales: Expenses for global outreach, partnerships, and client acquisition to maintain our international presence.
Operational Costs: Office maintenance, software licenses, and administrative expenses across our three locations.

5. Delivery Model
Project-Based Engagements: Fixed-price or milestone-based contracts for custom software and cloud migration projects.
Dedicated Teams: Long-term outsourcing partnerships with dedicated engineers working as an extension of the client’s team.
Managed Services: Ongoing cloud management, billing support, and AI solution maintenance for sustained client success.
Agile Methodology: Our self-organized team follows agile practices to ensure flexibility, transparency, and iterative delivery, addressing client needs at every stage.

6. Competitive Advantage
Free AWS Migration: Lowers the entry barrier for cloud adoption, attracting clients to our ecosystem.

AI Specialization: Expertise in Generative AI and Agentic AI differentiates us in a competitive market, addressing niche technological needs.

Global Presence: Our multi-country operations enable cost optimization (e.g., leveraging Bangladesh for cost-effective talent) while maintaining high-quality delivery.
Trusted Partnerships: Strong international relationships and a proven track record as an outsourcing partner build client confidence.


7. Growth Strategy
Expand AI Offerings: Develop proprietary AI tools or platforms to increase subscription-based revenue.

Strengthen AWS Partnership: Deepen collaboration with AWS to offer exclusive services or certifications, enhancing credibility.
Global Market Penetration: Leverage our presence in South Korea, Bangladesh, and the USA to enter new markets, particularly in Asia and North America.

Talent Development: Invest in upskilling our 100+ engineers to stay ahead in AI and DevOps trends, ensuring continued innovation.


TiCON System Ltd.’s business model is built on delivering exceptional quality, fostering innovation, and transcending borders to turn visionary ideas into impactful solutions. By addressing critical pain points—such as cloud complexity, high costs, and AI expertise gaps—we drive business growth and technological advancement for our global clients.
Column33:
TiCON System Ltd. leverages a robust stack of cutting-edge technologies to deliver Generative AI, Agentic AI, DevOps, and cloud solutions, addressing customer pain points with secure, scalable, and cost-effective software products. With our headquarters in South Korea and operations in Bangladesh and the USA, our 100+ skilled engineers utilize the following technologies to drive business innovation for startups, SMEs, and large enterprises:

1. Generative AI Technologies
Machine Learning Frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformers for building and training generative models like large language models (LLMs) and image generation systems.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): SpaCy, BERT, and GPT-based models for text generation, sentiment analysis, and conversational AI.
Computer Vision: OpenCV and Stable Diffusion for generative image and video solutions, enabling applications like content creation and visual analytics.
Reinforcement Learning: Libraries like Ray RLlib for optimizing generative AI models in dynamic environments.

2. Agentic AI Technologies
Agent Frameworks: LangChain and AutoGen for developing autonomous AI agents capable of task orchestration, decision-making, and multi-step workflows.
Knowledge Graphs: Neo4j and RDF for enabling context-aware, reasoning-based AI agents.
API Integration: RESTful APIs and GraphQL for connecting AI agents to external systems, ensuring seamless automation and data flow.
Robotic Process Automation (RPA): UiPath and Automation Anywhere for integrating agentic AI with business process automation.

3. DevOps Technologies
Containerization: Docker and Kubernetes for building, deploying, and managing scalable, microservices-based applications.
CI/CD Pipelines: Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, and GitHub Actions for automating software delivery, ensuring rapid and reliable releases.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Terraform and AWS CloudFormation for provisioning and managing cloud infrastructure efficiently.
Monitoring and Logging: Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for real-time performance tracking and issue resolution.

4. Cloud Technologies (AWS-Centric)
AWS Core Services: EC2, S3, RDS, and Lambda for building scalable, serverless, and cost-efficient cloud infrastructures.
AWS AI/ML Services: SageMaker for model training, Comprehend for NLP, and Rekognition for computer vision, enhancing AI-powered solutions.
AWS Security: IAM, KMS, and AWS Shield for ensuring robust security and compliance in cloud environments.
AWS Cost Optimization: AWS Cost Explorer and Trusted Advisor for providing Free AWS Migration and AWS Monthly Billing Support, addressing cost-efficiency pain points.

5. Programming Languages and Frameworks
Python: Core language for AI, machine learning, and automation, leveraging libraries like NumPy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn.
JavaScript/TypeScript: Node.js, React, and Angular for building scalable web applications and front-end interfaces.
Java: Spring Boot for enterprise-grade backend systems, ensuring reliability and performance.
Go: For high-performance, lightweight microservices in cloud-native applications.

6. Databases and Data Management
Relational Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, and AWS RDS for structured data management.
NoSQL Databases: MongoDB, DynamoDB, and Cassandra for handling unstructured data in scalable applications.
Data Warehousing: AWS Redshift and Snowflake for analytics and big data processing.
Caching: Redis and Memcached for optimizing application performance.

7. Security and Compliance
Encryption: TLS/SSL and AES-256 for secure data transmission and storage.
Identity Management: OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, and AWS Cognito for secure user authentication.
Compliance Tools: AWS Config and CloudTrail for ensuring adherence to GDPR, HIPAA, and other regulatory standards.

8. Collaboration and Productivity Tools
Version Control: Git, GitHub, and Bitbucket for collaborative code management.
Project Management: Jira, Trello, and Asana for agile development and transparent client communication.
Communication: Slack and Microsoft Teams for seamless coordination across our global teams.
Why These Technologies?
Our technology stack is carefully selected to address key customer pain points:

Scalability and Security: Kubernetes, AWS services, and encryption tools ensure robust, secure infrastructures.
Cost Efficiency: IaC, AWS Cost Explorer, and free migration services reduce operational costs.
Innovation: Generative and Agentic AI frameworks enable cutting-edge solutions for automation and insights.
Speed: CI/CD pipelines and agile tools accelerate time-to-market.
Global Reliability: Cloud-native technologies and distributed teams ensure consistent delivery across borders.

By combining these technologies with our highly motivated, self-organized team, TiCON System Ltd. delivers tailored, high-quality solutions that optimize business processes and drive technological advancement for clients worldwide.

Strategy on µBatteries will be mostly driven by the medical sector where we hope to be able to sign the co-development programs with major implantable device players, a fast-growing €6 billion opportunity where ultra-compact, reliable energy is critical.
We are an innovative industrial startup, which aim’s is bringing together the entire value chain (device designers, integrators and suppliers), by bringing our cutting-edge technology to the heart of product issues (stakes, lifetime and reliability).
Column33:
Leveraging 15 years of CNRS research and 36 patents, our team has developed Coralium, a 3D bio-inspired energy storage technology. Made using materials and processes compatible with the semiconductor industry, it delivers record energy density in a compact format and increases surface area by 700 times compared to flat systems. That means up to 40 times the performance of today’s commercial solutions.
Coralium was born from the needs of smart medical devices, but its potential is much broader. It is also ideal for space, energy, and environmental applications.
Column34:
With these competitive advantages, the Energy Density of our micro-capacitors is 2,5µF/mm2 at 3,8V and will reach 10 µF/mm2 by mid-2025 (for a price of 8$/µF), 40 times better than our most advanced competitor in capacitors, Murata, which displays 0,25µF/mm2 at 3,8V (for a price of 30 to 56$/µF).
On the battery market, planar thin-film µbatteries players like Cymbet, Ilika, FrontEdge Tech or InfinitePower Solution are way behind with energy densities up to 1 mWh/cm2. TDK and I-TEN, ceramic micro-batteries producers reach between 1 and 8 mWh/cm2 but aim to address different market segments because of a lower density. Newcomer Inject Power reaches 3,5 mWh/cm2 with thicker layers, but seem to have reached a maximum allowed with planar technologies. In comparison, VOLTIFY will display 50 mWh/cm2 with their first prototypes due 2025, 14x denser than this closest competitor.

Column31:
Integrated OEM Solutions for Cardiac Event Early Warning

We specialize in delivering comprehensive Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) solutions that encompass hardware, software, and Software as a Service (SaaS) offerings. Our mission is to empower our clients by addressing their specific challenges and enhancing their capabilities in the realm of cardiac event early warning systems.

Key Components of Our Business Model:

Hardware Development and Integration:
Design and manufacture of advanced wearable devices equipped with sensors for real-time cardiac monitoring.
Seamless integration of hardware components to ensure reliability and accuracy in data collection.

Software Solutions:
Development of intuitive software platforms for data analysis, visualization, and alert generation.
Customization of software interfaces to align with client branding and user experience requirements.

Software as a Service (SaaS):
Provision of cloud-based services for data storage, processing, and remote access.
Scalable solutions that allow clients to manage and monitor patient data efficiently.

Comprehensive OEM Services:
End-to-end support including product design, development, testing, and deployment.
Ongoing technical support and maintenance to ensure optimal performance of deployed solutions.

Value Proposition:
Customization: Tailored solutions that meet the unique needs and specifications of each client.
Scalability: Flexible systems that can adapt to varying scales of operation, from small clinics to large hospital networks.
Innovation: Continuous integration of the latest technological advancements to stay ahead in cardiac monitoring solutions.
Support: Dedicated support teams to assist clients throughout the product lifecycle.

By offering a holistic suite of OEM services, we aim to be a trusted partner for organizations seeking to enhance their cardiac event monitoring capabilities. Our integrated approach ensures that clients receive not only high-quality products but also the necessary support to implement and maintain these solutions effectively.
Column33:
1. Advanced Sensor Technologies
Electrocardiography (ECG): Utilizing one-lead ECG sensors reaching sample rate 500Hz for accurate detection of cardiac electrical activity, enabling identification of arrhythmias and ischemic events.

Accelerometers and Gyroscopes: Incorporating motion sensors to assess physical activity levels and detect postural changes, contributing to comprehensive patient monitoring.

Temperature Sensors: Monitoring skin temperature to provide additional context in assessing patient health status.

2. Data Transmission and Connectivity
Bluetooth and Wi-Fi: Enabling seamless data transfer from wearable devices to mobile applications and cloud platforms for real-time monitoring.
myrhythmnow.com

Cellular Networks: Facilitating data transmission in remote or rural areas where traditional connectivity may be limited.

3. Cloud Computing and Big Data Analytics
Cloud Storage: Securely storing vast amounts of patient data, ensuring accessibility for healthcare providers and compliance with data protection regulations.

Big Data Analytics: following IEC 60601-2-47, removing motion artifacts algorithm  analyzing collected data to identify patterns, predict potential health issues, and support clinical decision-making.
myrhythmnow.com

4. Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)
Predictive Analytics: Utilizing AI algorithms to analyze historical and real-time data, predicting potential cardiac events and enabling proactive interventions.
myrhythmnow.com

Automated Alerts: Implementing ML models to trigger alerts for healthcare providers or patients when certain thresholds or irregularities are detected.
myrhythmnow.com

5. Body Area Networks (BANs)
Wireless Sensor Networks: Deploying BANs to collect and transmit physiological data continuously, enhancing patient mobility and comfort.

6. Regulatory Compliance and Standards
FDA 510(k) Submission: Ensuring our devices meet stringent regulatory requirements for safety and efficacy.

ISO 13485 Certification: Adhering to international standards for quality management systems in medical device manufacturing.

By integrating these technologies, we provide end-to-end solutions that empower healthcare providers to monitor patients effectively, predict adverse cardiac events, and deliver timely interventions. Our commitment to innovation and quality ensures that our clients receive reliable, scalable, and customizable solutions tailored to their specific needs.

Teem Fish operates a B2B SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) and hardware-enabled services model. Our core offering combines:

Hardware Sales & Installation
We provide fisheries with onboard electronic monitoring (EM) systems, including AI-capable cameras and sensors, tailored to the vessel and fishery type.

Subscription-Based Software Access
Our cloud-based EM review platform is offered as a subscription service. This includes data upload, video review, AI-assisted species ID, and compliance reporting tools.

Data-as-a-Service (DaaS)
Fisheries agencies, industry groups, and certification bodies can access validated data feeds or insights via API, supporting science, regulation, and market traceability.

Professional Services & Support
We offer training, onboarding, AI model customization, and technical support to local monitoring partners, fostering ecosystem growth and local ownership.

This hybrid model supports both scalability and affordability, making it accessible to small-scale and industrial fleets while enabling recurring revenue and AI-driven margin expansion over time.
Column33:
Teem Fish employs a robust and integrated technology stack that brings together hardware, software, and AI to deliver efficient, scalable, and transparent fisheries monitoring. Our key technologies include:

1. Edge AI
Smart cameras and on-vessel processors analyze video in real-time to identify species, detect fishing events, and flag anomalies.

Enables immediate feedback and reduced data review costs.

2. Cloud Infrastructure
A scalable cloud-based SaaS platform for data storage, video review, annotation, AI model training, and reporting.

Accessible to government agencies, industry partners, and local service providers for transparent data sharing.

3. Hardware Suite
