Column6: Skynopy is a French spacetech startup revolutionizing satellite communications by offering "connectivity as a service." By leveraging ground station networks and providing plug & play solutions, we eliminate complexities to download fastly satellite data
Column31:
Skynopy offers a refined approach to satellite communication, combining one-time setup services with ongoing operational support to ensure seamless and secure operations:

1. Non-recurring fees:
Our one-time services are designed to optimize your satellite mission:

Satellite integration: We ensure that satellites, including those already in orbit, are fully integrated into our network.

Tailored equipment selection: We assist in selecting the ideal onboard radios, antennas, and other critical components for optimal performance.

Ground station & communication optimization: Our team fine-tunes ground stations and communication settings for maximum efficiency.

2. Recurring fees:
Once your satellite is operational, we provide ongoing services to support its success:

Centralized ground network access: Access our network effortlessly via a single, unified API.

End-to-end data sovereignty: We ensure that you retain full control and security over your data from satellite to cloud.
Column33:
Skynopy is building a secured cloud-based infrastructure that allows satellite operators to seamlessly communicate with their satellites by unifying multiple ground station networks in a single interface. The ground station network includes antennas from existing Ground-Station-a-Service providers, private networks, and Skynopy's own stations. 

1. RF : Satellite-Ground Communication Layer

a. Virtualized modem / RF equipment for ground stations: Flexible ground station interfaces that can adapt to multiple satellite communication protocols via software.
    
b. RF Signal Processing & SDR (Software-Defined Radio): Enables dynamic frequency tuning and protocol adaptation for heterogeneous satellite systems.
    
c. TT&C (Telemetry, Tracking & Command) Automation: Automates link establishment, health checks, and command delivery to satellites.
    
2. Software / cloud-native infrastructure

The infrastructure is composed of:

a. A control plane: to allow satellite operators to book contacts with their satellites via an API. Behind the API, the control plane orchestrates the various ground station networks.
b. A data plane: that transmits the data between the satellite operator infrastructure and the ground station antennas, uplink, and downlink.
c. A monitoring plane: to centralize infrastructure and operational metrics and logs.

3. Security & Sovereignty

The link between a satellite and ground control (telemetry & telecommands) is critical. Skynopy protects it using a powerful, next-generation VPN technology:

a. High-level end-to-end encryption: Data is fully encrypted and anonymized to block hackers and prevent tampering.
b. Distributed network: Communication packets are split, encrypted, and routed through a global network, making them untraceable and secure.
c. Data sovereignty: Processed satellite data is transmitted securely to trusted sovereign clouds, such as SecNumCloud-certified platforms, ensuring compliance with EU and French data protection laws.
d. Hardened infrastructure, compliant with classified data security pipeline: Facilities are built with high physical security standards, ensuring resilience to both cyber and physical attacks.

Nellow is targeting the microelectronic AI and logic chips market, thanks to the invention of a new non-volatile technology. Our innovation is protected by 9 patent families and will significantly reduce the energy consumption of microelectronic chips.
Column31: Nellow ultimately targets all the digital applications currently based on the CMOS technology, from smartphones to AI. This market of chips for logic and AI is expected to represent 1 T$ in 10 years, with a Compound Annual Growth Rate of around 10%.
Column33: Our technology is based on quantum materials and on the physical principle of ferroelectricity. As such, it is non-volatile, i.e., in the absence of power supply the logic state is retained. Therefore, there is no static energy consumption. Also, the logic and memory functions are not spatially separated as in current CMOS architectures, but gathered in the same device. This suppresses the large energy cost associated with moving data between the logic and memory units. Combined with ultralow switching energies and low working voltages, Nellow’s innovation makes it possible to envision energies per operation orders of magnitude below what can be achieved with the current CMOS technology.

Column6: Blue Frog Robotics embodies AI with BUDDY, the social robot powered by generative AI, computer vision and smart mobility to enhance EDUCATION, HEALTH, and HOSPITALITY, delivering measurable value at scale and making social robotics accessible to all.
Column31:
Blue Frog Robotics operates on a direct sales model with associated service recuring subscriptions.

We offer the Buddy robot for purchase at a price of €2,500 excl. tax (EU only), along with an annual subscription of €480 excl. tax covering software updates, technical support, and service maintenance. An optional SDK license (€360 excl. tax/year) is available for developers to build and deploy custom applications.

In addition, we provide a full ecosystem of accessories (trolley, docking station, flyer holder, reception stand, custom stickers, etc.) and training services (remote onboarding, on-site training, SDK developer training) to support adoption and customization.

Currently, we do not engage in leasing, loan, or co-development models. Our focus is strictly on product sales and associated services. However, in response to growing demand, we are actively working on a rental offer (Robot As A Service).
Column33:
At Blue Frog Robotics, Buddy is more than a robot, he is a technological platform combining state-of-the-art innovations to deliver meaningful, emotional, and useful interactions across various sectors.

Buddy leverages AI and Generative AI technologies (e.g., ChatGPT, Mistral, Claude) to engage in natural, context-aware conversations. This allows Buddy to answer questions, hold educational dialogues, assist in orientation tasks, and even support roleplay scenarios in therapeutic or educational settings.

Computer Vision & Environmental Awareness
Equipped with HD cameras, infrared sensors, and ultrasonic sensors, Buddy can:
- Recognize and follow people
- Detect gestures and facial expressions
- Analyze the environment in real time for safe and effective interaction

This makes Buddy capable of personal identification, interactive games, and autonomous behavior.

Emotional AI
Buddy is designed with emotional intelligence at its core. He expresses a range of emotions (joy, surprise, fatigue, frustration...) through facial animations, sound, and body movement, creating a unique empathetic bond with users. His behavior adapts to context, creating more engaging and human-centric interactions,  particularly powerful in education, autism support, and elderly care.

Smart Navigation & Autonomy
Thanks to tis sensots and cameras  and advanced algorithms, Buddy can move autonomously in controlled spaces. He is capable of obstacle avoidance, orientation guidance, and dynamic interaction based on proximity and user engagement.

Open & Scalable Software Architecture
Buddy runs on Android-based architecture with an open SDK that enables developers to create and deploy custom apps. He also supports remote updates and fleet management, making him scalable for both single-use and multi-site deployments.

Connectivity
Buddy connects via WiFi, 4G, Bluetooth, and includes USB ports for integrations or expansions. This allows for seamless telepresence, content updates, and connectivity with third-party systems.

Column31:
We are executing a phased go-to-market strategy designed to generate early revenue and de-risk our path to regulatory approval. In the near term, we monetize through fee-for-service partnerships with pharmaceutical companies and CROs by:

- enabling functional patient stratification in clinical trials, and
- supporting preclinical drug development by testing compounds on our metastatic tissue platform — including applications for targeted therapies like ADCs. This approach offers immediate R&D cost savings and better translational relevance for our partners.

In parallel, we are advancing the clinical validation of our Class III IVD medical device for personalized treatment selection in metastatic cancer — our long-term regulatory and commercial focus.

All activities build toward a unique strategic asset: a biobank of annotated metastatic tissue and drug response data with longitudinal clinical outcomes. 

This positions us for multiple exit scenarios, including acquisition by diagnostics, pharma, or platform players seeking proprietary, high-quality human data at scale.

BANF Smart Tire System uses tire-mounted sensors with 3-axis accelerometers and wireless charging, providing real-time data on pressure, temperature, and AI-driven features like toe alignment, camber, and load—surpassing traditional TPMS limits.
Column31:
By providing real-time data on tire pressure, tread wear, alignment, and load, BANF helps prevent:
- Sudden tire blowouts due to underinflation or excessive wear
- Accidents from poor traction caused by worn or uneven tread
- Dangerous situations from improper wheel alignment or overloading
- Loss of control in adverse weather or road conditions

BANF’s system is especially valuable for fleet operators and safety-conscious autonomous vehicle companies seeking to minimize risk, extend tire life, and ensure optimal vehicle performance
Column33:
1) Tire-Mounted Intelligent Sensors: BANF integrates tire-mounted sensors equipped with proprietary 3-axis accelerometers, enabling precise measurement of tire motion and forces in all directions (X, Y, Z axes). These sensors also include pressure and temperature sensors, providing real-time monitoring of critical tire health metrics.
2) Wireless Power Supply (Smart Profiler): BANF’s Smart Profiler delivers wireless power to sensors inside fast-rotating tires, overcoming the battery limitations of traditional TPMS (Tire Pressure Monitoring Systems). The profiler is connected to the vehicle’s battery and typically installed on the mud flap, ensuring continuous sensor operation and enabling high-frequency data sampling.
3) AI-Driven Analytics: Collected data is analyzed using machine learning and AI algorithms, offering actionable insights on tire wear, wheel alignment, load, and even road surface conditions. The system can detect issues such as loose lug nuts, misalignment, and abnormal wear, which are leading causes of tire-related accidents

Column6: Massive Bio is a global oncology technology company that uses AI to match cancer patients with clinical trials, aiming to democratize access to cutting-edge treatments with operations in over 17 countries.
Column31: Massive Bio operates a multi-sided business model that leverages its AI-powered oncology platform to connect cancer patients with clinical trials, while simultaneously offering pharmaceutical companies, CROs, hospitals, and payers access to a large, consented patient population enriched with clinical and genomic data. The company generates revenue through B2B partnerships by providing trial enrollment services, real-time patient matching, and data-driven insights that accelerate drug development and commercialization. Its operations span 17 countries and are supported by a robust ecosystem of patient advocacy groups, physician networks, and proprietary registries, all integrated into a seamless digital workflow that ensures compliance, scalability, and patient-centricity.
Column33: Massive Bio employs a sophisticated technology stack centered around its proprietary AI platform, SYNERGY-AI, which leverages its own proprietary LLMs and GPT-4 Turbo to extract over 180 structured clinical parameters from unstructured medical records and match patients in real time to over 19,000 actively recruiting oncology trials. This platform integrates computer vision, natural language processing, and predictive analytics, and is deployed globally via cloud infrastructure to hospitals, research sites, and physician practices. Supporting technologies include Python, GCP (Google Cloud Platform), BigQuery, Apache Airflow, DBT, Terraform, and Epic FHIR apps, enabling seamless interoperability with hospital EMRs and ensuring compliance with GDPR, CNIL, and FDA standards.
Column34:
Massive Bio operates in a competitive landscape where its core AI-driven oncology trial matching platform faces direct competition from companies like Flatiron, Tempus, Ontada, Deep6, Paradigm, and Reify Health (Care Access). These companies also focus on leveraging real-world data and artificial intelligence to streamline patient identification and trial matching, particularly in oncology. Their platforms often integrate with electronic medical records (EMRs) and offer predictive analytics to optimize trial enrollment, similar to Massive Bio’s SYNERGY-AI engine.

In the broader clinical trial ecosystem, Massive Bio also competes with patient recruitment and engagement platforms such as Antidote, Inato, Power, AutoCruitment, and Trial Library, which specialize in direct-to-patient outreach and site activation. Additionally, in the commercial analytics and drug matching space, companies like IQVIA, Komodo Health, Odaia, and Aktana offer data-driven insights for pharmaceutical commercialization. Niche players like Leal Health (TrialJectory), Clara Health, and Perthera also compete in precision oncology and patient navigation, making the competitive field both deep and diverse

Nellow is targeting the microelectronic AI and logic chips market, thanks to the invention of a new non-volatile technology. Our innovation is protected by 9 patents and will significantly reduce the energy consumption of microelectronic chips.
Column31: Nellow ultimately targets all the digital applications currently based on the CMOS technology, from smartphones to AI. This market of chips for logic and AI is expected to represent 1 T$ in 10 years, with a Compound Annual Growth Rate of around 10%.
Column33: Our technology is based on quantum materials and on the physical principle of ferroelectricity. As such, it is non-volatile, i.e., in the absence of power supply the logic state is retained. Therefore, there is no static energy consumption. Also, the logic and memory functions are not spatially separated as in current CMOS architectures, but gathered in the same device. This suppresses the large energy cost associated with moving data between the logic and memory units. Combined with ultralow switching energies and low working voltages, Nellow’s innovation makes it possible to envision energies per operation orders of magnitude below what can be achieved with the current CMOS technology.

EVB360 – Business Model Overview

EVB360 designs and assembles universal, modular energy storage systems (20–80 kWh) that are:
Compatible with 95% of inverters
Reusable, repairable, and scalable
Battery-chemistry agnostic (LFP, NMC, etc.)
Designed to minimize e-waste and maximize lifecycle
Compliant with local data governance (data stays in-country)
Column33:
EVB360: The Open Standard in Energy Storage

At EVB360, we’re breaking down barriers in energy storage with a universal, open technology that works with 95% of inverters on the market. Unlike closed systems that lock you into a single brand or force costly upgrades, our solution is fully compatible with all battery formats and chemistries—past, present, and future.

Our systems are reusable, modular, and designed for repair, not replacement, making them the most sustainable and ecological option available. And because we believe in data sovereignty, all data stays in the country of origin—supporting local governance, security, and compliance.

EVB360. Energy without limits. Compatibility without compromise.

Peripheral is a new form of reflex-based interaction that alerts and guides operators via peripheral vision—without distraction. It lowers cognitive load, needs no training, fits any mask, and enables instinctive action in complex environments.
Column31:
High-Potential Optical Technology, Backed by a Scalable Business Model

We are developing an optical supervision solution that combines hardware and software, with a three-phase go-to-market strategy:

    Sales of a complete system (optical insert + supervision software) to enable fast adoption and immediate field feedback.

    Supply of interoperable optical inserts, integrated into existing systems, with software interfaced to the client’s tools.

    Software-only licensing model, interfacing via dedicated communication protocols and command stations.

This step-by-step approach allows us to validate the market, increase value creation at each stage, and achieve strong scalability through a high-margin, SaaS-driven model.

We are building a platform technology at the core of tomorrow’s optical systems.
Column33:
PERIPHERAL’s technology relies on visual “patterns” that trigger attention and vigilance when perceived through peripheral vision. This visual language—what we call “visual grammars”—is at the core of our system.

A 2023 academic review confirms these mechanisms exist in humans, though they’ve only been studied in primates. We’ve launched an R&D roadmap with internal teams and scientific partners to expand the nuance and variety of these grammars.

Today, we can instinctively guide a user left, right, to stop or move—without conscious processing. We can also deliver basic commands and provide continuous spatial awareness. In time, these grammars will enable more complex interactions: danger zones, pace changes, or alertness cues.
A European research project (FEDER) is underway with the University of Caen, VERTEX, and GREYC, exploring multi-sensory stimuli.
Our first patent has been granted in France and the US and is being extended internationally (EU, Japan); four more are planned.
Column34:
PERIPHERAL develops reflex-based interfaces that harness unconscious attention and vigilance. Integrated into existing safety equipment, it uses specific LED flashes placed at the edge of the visual field to guide and alert—without distraction, screens, or added cognitive load.
In extreme environments—smoke, mud, vibrations—soldiers, firefighters, and workers often operate hands-busy and under intense stress. In these moments, AR and haptic systems become unusable: screens are inaccessible and the brain blocks complex processing.
PERIPHERAL offers a unique advantage: it reduces cognitive overload and enables instinctive reactions, even in motion and high-pressure situations. No need for interpretation or training—just pure, unconscious guidance.
Competing technologies may be powerful, but they demand attention the brain cannot spare in critical moments. PERIPHERAL works where others can’t: under stress, in action, in real life.

Safee is a compact safety device with a 105dB alarm connected to a mobile app. It provides critical alerts, live video streaming, real-time tracking, fall detection, and a discreet mode, ensuring your protection anytime, anywhere.
Column31:
Safee operates on a hybrid B2B and B2B2C model designed for scalability and recurring revenue:

1. Hardware Sales (One-time revenue)
Safee device (MagSafe-compatible smart case), distributed via retail partners (e.g. Boulanger), corporate channels, and direct sales

2. Software-as-a-Service (Recurring revenue)
Mobile app subscription includes unlimited streaming, contact management, legal storage, and route tracking
SaaS-only version available for users without the device (ideal for corporate or institutional clients)

3. Event-based Licensing (B2B2C)
Temporary licensing for large events (festivals, conferences, campuses) The app is offered free to users during the event, with revenue generated from the organizer. 

4. Enterprise and Institutional Offers
Tailored packages for Corporates (employee safety, lone workers), Insurers (value-added service integration), Governments and NGOs (public safety programs)

Business model includes hardware leasing + SaaS + alert center integration
Column33:
Safee’s solution is built on a modern, robust and scalable tech stack, fully developed in-house:

1. Mobile Application
- Framework: React Native (cross-platform for iOS and Android)
- State Management: MobX
- Tooling: Expo for rapid development and deployment
- Services:
          Firebase (for analytics and background services)
          OneSignal (push notifications)
          Sentry (error tracking)
          i18next (internationalization)
          Video & audio streaming: via react-native-video 
          and expo-av

2. Hardware
Safee MagSafe smart case:
- Bluetooth-enabled
- Integrated 105 dB alarm
- USB-C rechargeable
- Compatible with any smartphone using magnetic attachment
- Lightweight (40g) and long-lasting (30-day standby battery)

3. Backend Infrastructure
- Framework: NestJS (Node.js)
- Database: Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL
- Cloud Services: AWS (EC2, RDS, S3, ELB)
- API Security: Passport.js (JWT, local strategies)
- DevOps & Infra: Terraform for infrastructure as code

This stack allows for real-time data handling, high reliability, and strong user privacy — all essential for safety-critical applications.
Column34:
Safee operates in the personal safety tech space, where a few players offer partial or niche solutions. However, Safee’s combination of hardware + real-time SaaS + wide-ranging use cases gives it a significant strategic advantage.

The connected personal safety landscape includes a variety of players, ranging from mobile apps and standalone devices to institutional solutions. We can identify four main categories of direct or indirect competitors:

1. Mobile Personal Safety Apps
Many mobile apps allow users to alert trusted contacts or emergency services in case of danger. Among the most well-known:
- bSafe (Norway): Sends GPS location to emergency contacts.
- Life360 (USA): Focused on real-time family tracking, widely used by parents.
- Noonlight (USA): Silently triggers emergency alerts via an in-app button.

These freemium-based apps benefit from wide adoption — in 2023, over 60% of smartphone users had installed a personal safety app.

Limitations: Without a dedicated physical device, these apps rely on the user's ability to unlock their phone, open the app, and trigger an alert — steps that can be too slow or ineffective in high-stress or aggressive situations. Most also lack an immediate deterrent effect.

2. Standalone Personal Alarm Devices
This market includes a range of personal gadgets such as keychains, smart jewelry, or safety watches. These are designed to be portable, discreet, and simple to use — typically aimed at women, athletes, or vulnerable individuals.

Key examples include:
- Run Angel (Ireland): A wristband with a 120 dB alarm and connected alert system for joggers.
- InvisaWear (USA): A line of smart jewelry developed with security company ADT. A press on the jewelry sends GPS-based alerts and can trigger professional response.
- Safelet (Netherlands): A connected bracelet designed for quick activation and smartphone connectivity.

While these products are portable and discreet, they also have key limitations:
Alarm volume is often lower than professional-grade (around 120 dB).
Most do not capture audio or video evidence, limiting post-incident action or legal use.
Many require a smartphone to function, making them less reliable in cases of theft or high-stress emergencies.

Safee stands out in this category by combining a powerful 130 dB alarm with live audio/video evidence capture, enabling a complete and legally valuable protection system.

3. French Competitors
In France, few companies offer an integrated hardware + software solution like Safee for the general public.

The historical player is My Keeper, a Nice-based startup launched in 2016. Initially focused on personal alert buttons, they have shifted towards a B2B and institutional model (schools, municipalities, etc.).

Their current solution involves interconnected beacons: when one is triggered (e.g. in a school), all nearby devices activate a collective alarm, and a 24/7 monitoring center is alerted. Today, My Keeper protects over 3,000 schools and 25,000 teachers in France — a strong indicator of its relevance in closed environments.

However, their solution is mainly designed for contained spaces and crisis plans (e.g. lockdowns, terrorist alerts), not for urban mobility, families, or live events.

In contrast, Safee adopts a B2C approach, built for personal, mobile, and urban usage. This differentiation avoids direct competition with My Keeper and allows Safee to address under-served segments.

Other French initiatives exist, but they’re complementary and not technologically comparable:

App-Elles: A solidarity app to support women victims of violence, focused on connecting users with support organizations.

Téléphone Grave Danger (TGD): An official device provided by the Ministry of Justice, only available by court order, and not commercially distributed.

In conclusion, while the need for personal safety is well established in France, few players offer a complete, real-time, and legally actionable solution for the general public like Safee. This reinforces the uniqueness and strategic value of Safee’s positioning in the national market.

Column6: By combining microfluidics and microrobotics, MovaLife aims to enhance the IVF process. This groundbreaking approach notably relies on microrobots teleoperated by embryologists, allowing cells to remain within the incubator's controlled environment.
Column31:
MovaLife has two main sources of revenue: the sale of instrumented incubators and their consumables, notably the microfluidic chips embedding the microrobots. Additionally, the provision of associated services, ranging from maintenance to training, represents a third recurrent revenue stream.
The business model will be tailored to the specific characteristics of each target market, encompassing direct sales of devices and consumables as well as leasing or pay-per-use arrangements.
These products may be marketed directly to assisted reproduction laboratories or, in territories with more complex access, through specialised importer.
Column33:
We are developing an innovative technology stemming from research conducted at the robotic institute (ISIR) at Sorbonne Université that combines microrobotics and microfluidics, relying in particular on teleoperated microrobots the size of gametes.
This approach enables all essential in vitro fertilisation procedures to be performed remotely by embryologists, while maintaining the cells within the protective controlled environment of an incubator.
Column34: Our approach, which aims to replace current incubators, positions suppliers of IVF incubators as our direct competitors—or potential partners. Additionally, providers of devices for gamete or embryo selection also constitute competitors within our competitive landscape.

Column6: Cocoding is your ultimate Agentic AI software development team. Transform a single prompt into a fully functional SaaS in just minutes. With CoCoding, your SaaS is instantly deployed to AWS or GCP, making the development process faster, smarter, seamless.
Column31:
Our business model combines subscription-based SaaS with a pay-as-you-go infrastructure component:
Free Tier: Limited access to our platform (1 basic application per month) allowing users to experience the core functionality while creating viral growth through word-of-mouth.
Pro Plan: €149/month targeting individual entrepreneurs, startup founders, and small teams. Includes up to 10 applications, enhanced customization, and basic integrations.
Business/Enterprise: Custom pricing based on usage needs, targeting agencies, educational institutions, and larger companies. Includes advanced features like team collaboration, API access, white-labeling, and priority support.
Cloud Deployment Infrastructure: We also offer a pay-as-you-go model for applications deployed to production. Users only pay for the actual cloud resources their applications consume, with transparent pricing tied directly to usage. This allows customers to scale efficiently as their user base grows without upfront infrastructure costs.
Column33:
Our technology stack leverages cutting-edge AI and cloud infrastructure:
Core AI Technologies:

Multi-agent LLM orchestration framework for specialized development roles
Fine-tuned code generation models optimized for specific programming languages
Custom prompt engineering system for requirement analysis
Vector database for code pattern recognition and optimization

Infrastructure:

Containerized deployment using Kubernetes for scalable, isolated environments
WebSocket-based real-time code streaming and terminal integration
Session management system for concurrent development environments
Distributed cache architecture for optimized performance

Development Environment:

Django backend with Next.js frontend for a responsive user experience
PostgreSQL for relational data with MongoDB for document storage
Redis for session state and real-time messaging
CI/CD pipeline for continuous deployment of generated applications
Column34:
Our direct competitors represent various approaches to simplifying development, but none offer our complete solution:
Replit: Focuses on providing a collaborative coding environment but still requires technical expertise. Unlike CoCoding, they don't transform natural language into complete applications.
Lovable: Offers frontend-only development assistance, lacking our comprehensive full-stack capabilities and custom backend logic generation.
Databutton: Specializes in data applications and dashboards rather than general-purpose software development, serving a narrower use case than our platform.
V0: Similarly uses AI for application generation but relies on a chat-only interface rather than our multi-agent approach, resulting in less consistent output quality.
bolt.new: Provides simplified web app development but with more limited customization options and without our robust database integration and backend logic capabilities.

Column31:
Callendar's business model is designed to be scalable and efficient. Once the tool is developed, the marginal cost of each new analysis becomes nearly zero, providing a sustainable economic advantage that enables continuous investment in innovation. 

Currently, our revenue primarily comes from service contracts. In the medium term, we aim for 70% of our revenue to come from our platform, through one-time studies and SaaS subscriptions. The remaining 30% will come from additional services, such as custom module development and user support for interpreting and applying results. 

Our main costs are human resources, with significant investment in IT infrastructure. We also participate in the IPSL scientific computing center, ensuring the robustness and performance of our climate analyses. 

In 2024, our revenue was €180k, reflecting our solid foundation as we move toward a more scalable model that drives long-term growth.
Column33:

Built on best-in-class climate data, our platform offers unmatched accessibility and enterprise- wide monitoring, making it the most innovative climate risk tool and empowering decision-makers to act on critical climate information. 

Callendar innovates by automating key climate risk assessment stages using modern digital technologies, significantly lowering costs and time.

Dana Health transforms maternal mental health care with an AI-powered digital therapeutic that enables early detection of perinatal conditions, offering personalized support to women and a cost-effective, evidence-based solution for health care systems.
Column31:
Dana Health embraces a hybrid business model, combining B2B2C and B2B approaches to maximize expansion and impact.

Initial phase - B2B2C (Business-to-Business-to-Consumer) Model
In the initial phase, we distribute our preventive mental health solution through key social agents, such as private clinics, health insurers and employers, who provide direct access to pregnant women. This is implemented under a monthly, quarterly or annual subscription model. The social agent can fully or partially cover the cost for users, incentivising large-scale adoption. This model ensures a direct benefit for women while ensuring the commitment of strategic partners to perinatal mental health.

Advanced phase - B2B (Business-to-Business) model
Once our software is certified as a medical device (PDTx), the solution will be transformed into a certified digital therapy, allowing its prescription by health professionals. This will enable a B2B model, where the health system will be able to reimburse the cost of the therapy to patients. The usage cycles will be quarterly with a licensing and pay-per-use (PPU) model by health institutions.

Scalability and growth
This hybrid model allows for rapid expansion, initially accessing more accessible markets and, once the solution is validated as a certified therapy, integrating it into the healthcare system for mass adoption. The highly scalable technology and established distribution channels ensure that the solution reaches more women, improving the efficiency of perinatal mental health care and ensuring access to crucial resources.
Column33:
Dana Health develops a pioneering solution to transform the prevention and treatment of maternal mental health disorders through scalable, artificial intelligence (Al)-based technology. Our algorithms, trained with ML on innovative data sets including behavioral, linguistic, social, and biomarker information, enable real-time risk assessment, providing personalized care and adjusting analysis and interventions to each user's specific needs.

Key features that set us apart:
• Personalization: The algorithm's ability to tailor screening and monitoring based on each patient's individual data.
• Accuracy and Sensitivity: Significant improvement in accuracy and sensitivity when identifying risk profiles, surpassing current solutions.
• Early intervention: Ability to detect the first signs of anxiety and depression before serious symptoms develop.
• Accessibility: Cost reduction and improved access to tools that facilitate monitoring and prevention, allowing for more efficient care.

Our innovation is not only preventative,
but also data-driven, providing healthcare systems with a certified, technology-enabled solution. This
improves screening accuracy, optimises clinical outcomes and offers personalised mental health support for pregnant women, ensuring they receive the right care at a crucial time in their lives.
Column34: The global digital therapeutics market is growing at a CAGR of 28.5%, driven by increasing demand for accessible and scalable solutions to address mental health disorders, advancements in artificial intelligence and digital biomarkers, clinical validation of digital therapeutics as effective treatments, and interest from insurers and healthcare systems in adopting cost-effective tools. Within this market, mental health is the leading category. Dana is the first European Digital Therapeutics specialising in perinatal mental health. Facing competitors such as Curio (US, MamaLift Plus, limited to mild/moderate PPD), Ovia (US, wellness apps without certification) and Canopie (UK, prevention without clinical validation), Dana offers a comprehensive clinically validated and certified solution, positioning itself as a leader in addressing a critical and unmet need.

Wormsensing develops ultra-thin piezoceramic sensors that bring mechanical systems to life. Our Dragonfly® technology unlocks new levels of control and performance for Industry 4.0 and transportation by capturing data previously unreachable.
Column31:
We operate on a B2B model, with two main revenue streams:
	1.	Sensor sales (Dragonfly® product line) for integration into critical infrastructures and machines.
	2.	Partnership and OEM integration with major industrials (Airbus, EDF, Renault…) for co-development or scale deployment.
We are also exploring licensing models for high-volume industries and offer engineering services for advanced test campaigns.
Column33:
Proprietary 10µm piezoceramic sensor layer
	•	Ultra-thin flexible substrate (29x8mm, 0.1g)
	•	Analog and digital signal acquisition (charge & voltage)
	•	Plug & Play compatibility (IEPE, ICP)
	•	Dynamic range: 0.01 Hz to 100 kHz
	•	Integration-ready for embedded systems and AI-based data pipelines
	•	Fully passive sensor (no power required)
Column34:
Our main competitors are legacy strain gauges, MEMS sensors, and accelerometers from companies like PCB Piezotronics, Kistler, HBM/Hottinger Brüel & Kjær, or TE Connectivity.
However, these solutions are often rigid, less sensitive, energy-dependent, or limited in bandwidth and adaptability. Wormsensing positions itself as a complementary but superior solution — enabling a new class of “physical intelligence” for machines.

Column6: Electrogenos' technology cuts the cost of green hydrogen by 30%. Our alkaline electrolyser stacks can be manufactured anywhere locally at just $85/kW — 5× cheaper than EU and 1.5× cheaper than Chinese competitors — while delivering 20% higher efficiency.
Column31: Electrogenos operates a technology licensing and hardware supply model. We design and manufacture advanced electrolyser stacks. We are able to manufacture and sell our systems, or license the design of these to our partners and integrators in the hydrogen value chain. Our model focuses on replacing existing stacks or enabling new hydrogen production capacity at significantly lower capital and operating costs. We also pursue revenue through pilot deployments, joint ventures, and long-term supply agreements in high-growth sectors like green steel, green cement and e-fuels.
Column33: Electrogenos leverages a proprietary catalyst system that delivers 2x the activity of platinum at 1/50th of the cost. This enables exceptional energy efficiency, with systems reaching up to 98% efficiency and operating across a wide dynamic range—ideal for intermittent renewable input. Our stacks are based on traditional alkaline water electrolysis (AWE) but achieve PEM-level performance at significantly lower cost, with demonstrated performance of 40.2 kWh/kg H? at 3000 A/m² and scalable up to 20,000 A/m² at 49 kWh/kg H?. The system’s low onset potential and overpotential allow fine-tuned operation in response to electricity pricing.
Column34:
Electrogenos competes with leading electrolyser manufacturers, each with different approaches:

1. Thyssenkrupp nucera – Uses precious-metal-based catalysts in traditional alkaline systems; high capex and limited flexibility.

2. Nel Hydrogen – Nickel-based alkaline electrolysers; proven but costly and less responsive to variable renewables.

3. Hysata – A newer player with a membrane-free, capillary-fed electrolyser; promising but unproven at scale and still expensive.

4. Sungrow Hydrogen – Focuses on low-cost alkaline systems from China; lower cost but lower performance and limited efficiency.

Electrogenos operates at Hysata’s efficiency levels while costing less than Sungrow—offering up to 5x lower manufacturing costs and 20% higher efficiency. The result: high performance with unmatched affordability.

Column31:
Omarigot’s business model is built around a digital platform that centralizes aquaculture expertise and structures the sector through multiple revenue-generating streams. The platform offers paid access to technical support services, diagnostics, training, and production monitoring for fish farmers.

In the long term, it will also include a marketplace for the sale of fish, inputs, and equipment, thereby creating an integrated economic loop. In parallel, activities at the Lac Ranch du Jourdain site generate income through direct fish sales, a restaurant, nature tourism, and immersive aquaculture experiences. Omarigot is thus betting on a hybrid model that combines technology, agriculture, and rural tourism, while strengthening the local ecosystem by including marayeuses (women fish traders), distributors, and young entrepreneurs in the value chain.
Column33:
The technology used by Omarigot combines digital tools and artificial intelligence solutions to professionalize and make fish farming more accessible. The web and mobile platform is built on a cloud-based architecture, ensuring continuous access for users, even in connected rural areas.

It includes a centralized database for monitoring fish farming operations, dynamic dashboards to track key production indicators (growth, feeding, mortality), and an AI-powered advisory system based on real-time field data analysis.

In the future, connected devices (IoT) will be integrated to monitor water quality and other critical parameters, enabling automated alerts and improved decision-making. This combination of smart technology and a user-friendly interface makes Omarigot a comprehensive and scalable solution for modernizing the aquaculture sector.

Column6: NeuroPixel is a Gen-AI startup focused on the fashion e-commerce space. They help fashion brands create high quality marketing assets and content with AI using synthetic human models and AI powered lighting adaptation without any hallucinations of the app
Column31:
Over the last year, we have been working with several paying customers via a Service model. Specifically customers share the images with us, which we process at our end and send back. 

Recently in February 2025, we have just launched our self-service solution/DIY Platform which is a usage-based subscription model. To elaborate, Users get a certain amount of credits at different tiers (Starter/Pro), and can use those to generate images/videos using our tools.
Column33:
With our technology, the apparel can be shot on any regular person, and we can convert that model to a photorealistic AI generated person of any ethnicity. We also have proprietary IP around lighting adaptation which we can use to convert a studio-shot image to a photorealistic on-location image anywhere in the world. Lastly, we can also create powerful social media videos using AI at a tiny fraction of the cost and time of executing photoshoots. 

In order to build the required verticalized stack, our DNN architecture is developed using a Modular framework that combines various Open Source Foundational Models like SAM1/2 (for Segmentation), Flux1.1 Pro/SDXL/SD3.5 (for Generation), Llama 3.2/Janus Pro [for Multimodal Understanding] etc. 

We have fine-tuned and built the Proprietary DNN Stack on top of these Open Source architectures to work better specifically for the fashion domain.

Till date, we’ve filed 4 Patents (Provisional Filing) across Conditional Generation with desired Consistency using Light Map, Synthetic Human Generation & Attribute Modification and Apparel Segmentation.

Lium develops an autonomous tethered balloon equipped with cameras and artificial intelligence to provide continuous real-time surveillance of sensitive industrial sites. Our solution detects fires, gas leaks, and intrusions at the earliest stage.
Column31:
Our business model is based on two main pillars:

- Sales of our solution: we sell our autonomous tethered balloon systems (hardware and software) to industrial clients for site surveillance and environmental monitoring.
- Recurring revenue through services: we offer ongoing maintenance, software updates, and optional monitoring services under annual or multi-year contracts.

This hybrid model allows us to combine upfront revenue from system sales with long-term, recurring income from service agreements.
Column33:
We combine several advanced technologies:

- Tethered balloon platform for long-duration aerial surveillance

- Embedded AI algorithms for real-time detection of fires, gas leaks, and intrusions

- Optronic sensors (visible and infrared cameras) for wide-area monitoring

- Autonomous motorization system for automatic positioning and stabilization

- Secure communication systems for continuous data transmission

- Integration with external industrial security and monitoring networks
Column34:
Our direct competitors are companies providing aerial surveillance solutions for industrial sites, primarily:

- Drone-based security service providers (requiring pilots and limited flight duration)

- Fixed surveillance systems (CCTV towers, thermal camera networks)

- Satellite-based monitoring solutions (less responsive and less continuous)

However, few competitors offer autonomous, tethered aerial surveillance combining real-time detection, long-duration flight, and AI-driven analysis as we do.

GUNDO is redefining food retail with embedded, AI-driven nutrition. Our white-label SaaS plugs into e-commerce and fitness platforms, turning every customer journey into a smart, personalized health experience that drives loyalty and sales.
Column31:
GUNDO operates under a B2B2C subscription-based model. We partner with retailers and fitness companies to integrate our personalized nutrition technology into their platforms (e.g., e-commerce, apps, in-store experiences). The business model includes:

1. White-label integration: Our modules adapt to the look & feel of each partner, enhancing their existing customer journey with personalized nutrition features.

2. Revenue sharing: Partners offer our services to their clients through different subscription tiers (Basic, Medium, Advanced, Premium). Revenue is shared based on the level of service and involvement:
-In some tiers, only GUNDO and the retailer are involved.
-In others, additional partners like health labs are included for tests (e.g., genetics, blood, microbiota).

3. Freemium entry point: We offer a basic free version to attract users and convert them into paying subscribers.

4. Modular tech stack: Our solution is modular and scalable, allowing each B2B partner to start small and grow with more features over time.

This model allows GUNDO to scale quickly by leveraging existing customer bases of our partners, while delivering high-value, personalized experiences that improve engagement, health outcomes, and revenue.
Column33:
GUNDO leverages a combination of advanced technologies to deliver ultra-personalized nutrition at scale:

1.AI & Machine Learning:
- Algorithms analyze genetic, microbiota, blood, and behavioral data to generate personalized dietary recommendations.
- Product tagging and scoring systems (e.g., GundoScore) evaluate food products across over 90 nutritional parameters.

2. Data Integration & APIs:
- Seamless integration with retailers’ and partners’ systems via secure APIs (e.g., product catalogs, customer profiles, check-out systems).
- Real-time personalization embedded in e-commerce and mobile apps.

3. Data Security & Privacy:
-  Hosted on Google Cloud with high-level encryption and compliance with GDPR and other data protection regulations.
-  User data vault architecture with explicit user consent for use and sharing of health data.

4. Modular Web Platform:
- Built with React and Node.js, the platform is modular and customizable, allowing white-label deployment for each partner.
- Frontend integrates shopping experiences with personalized nutrition guidance.

5. Scientific Validation Tools:
- Integration with lab partners for genetic, microbiota, and blood testing, and interpretation of results using validated frameworks.

These technologies enable GUNDO to offer a robust, scalable solution that adapts to different B2B environments while ensuring scientific accuracy, usability, and security.
Column34:
GUNDO operates in the intersection of personalized nutrition, digital health, and retail tech. Our direct competitors include:

1. ZOE (UK/US):
Offers microbiome and blood sugar-based personalized nutrition plans. However, ZOE is a D2C model, while GUNDO focuses on B2B2C, integrating directly into retailers' and fitness partners' platforms.

2. Youniq Health (Europe):
Provides DNA-based nutrition recommendations, primarily through labs or clinics, lacking direct integration with the shopping or fitness experience.

3. Edo App (Italy):
A mobile app that scores food products for consumers. While similar in product evaluation, Edo does not offer hyper-personalization based on health data or full white-label integration for B2B.

4. Spoon Guru (UK):
Works with retailers to help users find products based on dietary preferences. GUNDO goes further by using genetic, microbiota and blood data, and offering full nutritional plans and dynamic personalization.

GUNDO's Key Differentiators:

-Integration with real retail and fitness customer journeys.
- Multi-layer personalization (genetics, microbiota, blood, behavior).
- Modular white-label solution tailored to each partner.
- Focus on revenue generation for partners via premium subscriptions.

Henddu operates under a hybrid B2G and B2B business model tailored to the needs of governments and industrial actors in developing countries, especially in Africa. Here's a breakdown:

?? B2G (Business to Government)
Henddu sells and deploys turnkey air quality observatories for cities, states, and public agencies. This includes:
* Infrastructure installation (sensors, connectivity, power)
* Platform licensing (for data analysis, decision-making, forecasting)
* Capacity building (training of local teams)
* Maintenance and technical support (via annual contracts)
* Advisory services for environmental policy and planning
These projects are typically funded through national budgets, climate adaptation funds, or international development agencies.

?? B2B (Business to Business)
Henddu provides access to its digital platform and analytics to:
* Industries (e.g., cement, mining, energy) for compliance, ESG reporting, and risk monitoring
* Consulting firms and environmental auditors via APIs and dashboards
* NGOs and foundations working on public health or urban planning

Services include:
* Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) subscriptions
* Custom data services and alerts
* Impact assessments and pollution audits
Column33:
Henddu’s innovation lies in its unique ability to aggregate and harness diverse streams of data—ranging from ground-based monitoring stations to satellite observations, meteorological data, human activity, and public health indicators. This multidimensional approach enables the comprehensive collection, analysis, and dissemination of environmental intelligence in real-time.
To achieve this, Henddu has developed advanced digital platforms powered by Henddu Intelligence, a suite of three proprietary algorithms designed to transform complex data into actionable insights:
HOQA: A hyperlocal prediction algorithm (1 km resolution) that models human exposure to air pollutants.
Henddu-Spot: A detection tool that identifies critical pollution zones and analyzes associated risks.
Henddu-Cluster: A clustering algorithm that maps zones with similar pollution and vulnerability profiles.
Henddu's Data Strategy: What Gets Measured, Gets Improved

At the core of Henddu’s impact is its ability to transform environmental data into strategic indicators—delivered directly by communication tools to stakeholders (policymakers, tax administration, general public information, ...) —driving awareness, guiding decisions, and enabling meaningful action. 
This interconnected knowledge allows all the users to accelerate their transformations into prediction and decision-making for better air quality
Column34:
Henddu faces two types of direct competitors, differentiated by target segments:
?? B2G Segment (Governments, Cities, Agencies)
In this segment, competition mainly comes from public or donor-funded institutions and consulting firms offering fragmented solutions, often with limited technological integration or scalability.

Main Competitors:
* Airparif (France) and Irceline (Belgium) – Brings institutional credibility but limited to certain regions and traditional infrastructure.
* SEI Africa – Provides research and policy support but with a focus on analysis rather than deployment.
* Donor-funded university projects – Often set up temporary sensor networks (e.g., AirQo) but lack long-term deployment models or platform integration.
* Local consulting firms – Typically offer environmental impact assessments without real-time or digital infrastructure.
Henddu’s Edge: A turnkey, integrated, and low-cost observatory with smart analytics, offering both infrastructure and decision-making tools.

?? B2B Segment (Industries, Private Actors)
Here, the competition mostly comes from sensor manufacturers and IoT solution providers focused on selling hardware or APIs.
Main Competitors:
* Ambee (India) – Offers APIs for air quality data, but lacks tailored platforms for African governments/industries.
* Oizom (India) – Provides robust sensor hardware, often with platform support, but limited to monitoring without forecasting or spatial analysis.
* Kunak (Spain) – Strong in precision hardware but positioned mostly as a sensor provider, not as a GovTech platform.
* Clarity – Focuses on modular air monitoring, but often deployed in pilot-scale, donor-funded projects.

 Henddu’s Edge: The combination of sensor integration, proprietary AI analytics, forecasting tools, and a governance-centered digital platform designed for long-term ownership and sovereignty by African clients.

In summary, Henddu’s uniqueness lies in bridging both worlds—technical innovation and public governance—delivering not just air quality data, but decision-enabling intelligence.

Column6: P.O.D.G Development SAS provides solutions for eco-friendly agriculture, with quality production and high yields, ensuring food security for the population and economic sovereignty for producers. Water and soil are sources of life, let's protect them !
Column33:
Polyter® is a puzzle technology that combines fertiliser, water retention, growth activator and biostimulant in one.
Composition: Cross-linked potassium acrylate and acrylamide copolymer based on cellulose
Minimum releaseable fertiliser content: 0.50% total nitrogen (0.15% ammoniacal nitrogen and 0.35% nitrate nitrogen), 0.80% soluble phosphoric acid, 0.20% soluble potassium and 0.03% soluble magnesium
Dry matter: 88.5% - Particle size: 0.315 to 3 mm
Mode of action: Incorporating NPK elements and trace elements through grafting, the membrane allows for very rapid absorption of liquids (160 to 500 times its initial dry weight depending on water quality) and release by osmotic pressure from the nodulated root mass. This saves at least 50% of water and 30% of fertiliser inputs. Depending on local parameters (soil, temperature, evaporation and plant type), the system lasts between 3 and 5 years.
Effects on plants: Water stress and nutrient deficiencies are limited. Germination, establishment and regrowth of the plant are greatly enhanced. It increases root mass by 3 to 5 times. Growth is faster and development cycles are multiplied by 1.5 to 3 times. It increases yields and optimises the quality of agricultural production. The crop cycle is shortened, thus accelerating fruiting. It strengthens natural resistance to diseases and microbial attacks. It amplifies the production of humic matter and dry matter.
Effects on the soil and biodegradability: It loosens and improves soil porosity. Acting as a real ‘synthetic earthworm’, it aerates the soil. It stabilises and fixes the soil, while restructuring the humus and reducing losses through evaporation and percolation. Two keys to degradation: the number of bacteria in the soil and UV rays, if it is found on the surface. By reducing the negative effects of leaching on soil structure, it protects the environment and groundwater, while increasing the earthworm population.
Fertilisation and treatment included for the sole benefit of the plant without leaching into the soil.
Retention and resistance to high temperatures and delay in water stress.
Activation of root and leaf growth, accelerated growth cycle.
Increased yields, quality and stability thanks to biostimulation.
Polyter® ensures beautiful, uniform and early harvests, high nutritional quality and better endurance during storage and transport.
Column34:
Many retainer-type products from the fine chemicals industry (nappies, paints, films, etc.) are available on the agricultural market but do not offer the specific properties of Polyter, which has been specially developed for plants.
There is no ‘physical’ association with plants. The polymer and the root live ‘side by side’ without nodulation.
The captured water is released into the soil or through the growing medium in excessive or insufficient quantities.
No fertilising or treating agents are included in the manufacturing process, although they are sometimes combined with slow-release fertilisers (such as Osmocot).
Above 25°C, these fertilising elements are released too quickly, which is harmful to the plant and makes them unsuitable for use in hot and desert areas.
These retainers have low mechanical strength in the soil and are also brittle when crushed, with inadequate cross-linking.
Many other major differences have been identified that demonstrate the uniqueness of our technology.

Column6:
Transforming captured CO2 into renewable base chemicals for a sustainable chemical industry.
Deeptech spin-off of CNRS / University of Montpellier.
Column31:
We research, design, manufacture, distribute, maintain electrolyser stacks that are capable of reducing CO2 into ethylene (e-ethylene) and other base chemicals (e-chemicals)
Our direct customers are base chemical producers, who must incorporate sustainable material in their production. The fact that our e-chemical are a drop in replacement means that they can progressively ramp up production to meet increasing quota and mix with it with traditional chemicals in any proportion without modifying the downstream supply chain.
We partner up with EPC (Engineering Procurement and Construction) companies to deliver full e-chemical production units built around our electrolysers.
Column33:
Our technology consist in reducing captured CO2 into base chemicals (monomers such as ethylene, propylene etc.) via electrolysis, employing renewable electricity.
Our patented cathode catalyst and our proprietary know how in integrating it in the electrolyser's cell, enable us to transform CO2 into base chemicals in one pass, with excellent performances in terms of energy efficiency and yield. This contrasts with most of our competitors that still rely on CO (carbon monoxide) as either feedstock or intermediate product.

Column6: Co Print is dedicated to driving innovation in 3D printing technology. Since our founding in 2020, we have remained focused on pioneering advancements to enhance the 3D printer ecosystem for users worldwide.

Column6: iAVC developed ROMAIN application. Deployed since February 2025 in France, the app is intended for healthcare professionals. ROMAIN informs in real time the arrival of patients needing immediate emergency care.
Column31:
As far as the market is concerned, in France over 20 million people visit emergency departments every year. Of these, 6 million are transported by the SAMU. It is these 6 million patient transports that interest iAVC.
These include stroke patients, heart attack victims, pregnant women and children, and we may also be interested in organ transport.
Specifically for stroke, there are 150,000 stroke victims every year in France. 8,000 of whom required mechanical thrombectomy. Of these, around five thousand are transferred to one of the 48 specialized centers.

Column6: eyREACT is a EU AI Act compliance platform with automated risk assessment (10 minutes vs 10 weeks), real-time compliance monitoring, one-click audit reports, regulatory update alerts and template library. Avoid huge penalties - stay AI Act compliant.
Column31:
tiered B2B SaaS subscription with optional enterprise services. Here's a breakdown:

Core Model: Tiered SaaS Subscription (B2B)
 
Starter: Small teams, early adopters. Basic system registration, risk classification, one-click exportable documentation packs for regulators or internal audits

Professional: Mid-sized businesses (50-500 employees). Automated assessments, monitoring alerts, integration with AI inventories

Enterprise: Large orgs with complex needs. Custom compliance workflows, audit trail logs, on-prem deployment, user management.

Professional services (one-time or retainer): Onboarding, training, AI system mapping, internal policy development, live updates with AI Act amendments, local regulator guidance.
Column33: Modern web application built with React/Node.js, focusing on security, compliance, and ease of use for non-technical users.
Column34:
Direct competitors - EU AI Act-specific platforms - don't exist. eyREACT appears to be first-to-market for EU AI Act-specific compliance.

Indirect/Partial Competitors
Generic Compliance Platforms:
OneTrust - General privacy/compliance management (adding AI modules)
Protiviti - Risk and compliance consulting with AI services
Thomson Reuters Regulatory Intelligence - Regulatory tracking (not AI-specific)

AI Risk Management Tools:
Fiddler AI - AI observability and monitoring
Arthur AI - AI model monitoring and bias detection
Weights & Biases - ML experiment tracking (limited compliance features)

Legal/Consulting Services:
Traditional law firms - Manual compliance consulting
Big 4 consulting (Deloitte, PwC, etc.) - AI risk advisory services
Boutique AI law practices - Specialized legal guidance

Key Competitive Advantage
eyREACT's Position:
First-mover advantage - Purpose-built for EU AI Act
SME-focused - Affordable vs. enterprise consulting
Self-service platform - No need for expensive lawyers
Regulation-specific - Not generic compliance tool

The EU AI Act is so new (effective August 2025) that dedicated compliance platforms barely exist, creating a significant market opportunity for eyREACT.

pgvector for semantic search on ESG-tagged embeddings

Python 3.12 micro-services built with FastAPI (REST + SQLAlchemy/GraphQL)

Next.js 14 (React 18, TypeScript) with Server Components and App Router
UI kit: Tailwind CSS + Radix UI; PWA-ready and internationalised (i18n)

PostgreSQL 16 (row + JSONB) for transactional data
S3 object storage for evidentiary files; 
Redis for low-latency caching and rate-limit state

Containerised with Docker and orchestrated on AWS 
GitHub Actions CI/CD, blue-green deploys, automated schema migrations

Observability stack: 
AWS CloudWatch
Prometheus + Grafana
OpenTelemetry, Jagger

End-to-end encryption (TLS 1.3 in transit, AES-256 at rest)
OAuth2/OIDC SSO, role-based access control, audit logging, SOC 2–ready controls

SENSIPH is a contactless physiological monitoring technology with embedded intelligence. It enables continuous measurement of sleep, respiration, heart rate, and movements in a non-intrusive way.
Incubated at INRIA.
Column31:
Our business model follows a hybrid B2B / B2B2C approach, structured around three main revenue streams, aligned with our target customer segments:

?? 1. Direct Sales of Devices
We plan to sell the connected mattress device directly to:

a/ Medical-social institutions (e.g., IME, SESSAD, FAM) for collective use within facilities,
b/ Pediatric and psychiatric hospitals, for contactless monitoring during sleep, crises, or transitions,
c/ Families, through medical prescription or support mechanisms (e.g., MDPH, healthcare mutuals).

?? 2. SaaS Subscriptions (Software-as-a-Service)
Each device will be connected to a digital platform for analysis and longitudinal monitoring, with access via:

a/ Monthly subscriptions for institutions (multi-user dashboards, clinical monitoring tools),
b/ Simplified plans for families (parameter visualization, alerts for stress or physiological desynchronization).
c/ This generates recurring revenue and offers continuous added value through algorithm updates and personalized data interpretation.

?? 3. B2B2C Licenses and Strategic Partnerships
We intend to establish software or hardware licensing agreements with:

a/ Telemedicine platforms (API integration),
b/ Health insurers and mutuals (packaged solutions for child health monitoring and prevention),
c/ Coordinated care networks (in neurodevelopment, psychiatry, pediatrics).

This channel expands home accessibility and helps reduce the financial burden for families.
Column33:
Our solution combines medical-grade physiological monitoring with non-intrusive, contactless sensing, leveraging several advanced technologies:

?? 1. Ballistocardiography (BCG)
We use passive vibromechanical sensing based on ballistocardiography to monitor:

a/ Heart rate and variability (HR, HRV),
b/ Respiratory patterns,
c/ Hemodynamic signals,
d/ Motor activity.

This approach is contactless, calibration-free, and highly suited to hypersensitive pediatric populations, especially children with neurodevelopmental disorders.

?? 2. High-Sensitivity Accelerometer Network
The sensing device integrates high-resolution accelerometers directly into the mattress structure to detect micro-vibrations linked to physiological activity — ensuring signal quality in real-life sleep conditions.

?? 3. Vibrational Digital Twin (Biomechanical Modeling)
We developed a volumetric digital twin to model:

a/ The vibrational behavior of the human body,
b/ Signal propagation through the mattress,
c/ Sensor optimization and signal enhancement.

This enables robust, interpretable physiological readings.

?? 4. Advanced Signal Processing & AI
Our pipeline includes:

a/ Real-time signal filtering,
b/ Noise and motion artifact rejection,
c/ Feature extraction (e.g. HRV, cardio-respiratory coupling),
d/ Machine learning for pattern detection and clinical insights.

?? 5. Cloud-Connected Platform (SaaS) (in development)
We are developing a cloud-based software platform for:

a/ Longitudinal monitoring and stress/sleep tracking,
b/ Multi-user dashboards for clinicians and caregivers,
c/ Real-time alerts and data visualization,
d/ Compliance with GDPR and HDS (French health data hosting) standards.

This platform will enable remote follow-up, personalization of care, and integration into coordinated care pathways.
Column34:
Our project operates at the intersection of medical monitoring, pediatric care, and neurodevelopmental disorders. Direct competitors fall into three main categories, each with significant limitations compared to our solution:

?? 1. Medical-Grade Devices (e.g. Philips, GE Healthcare)
A/ Strengths: High clinical accuracy, validated in hospital settings.

B/ Limitations:

B1- Intrusive (require skin contact sensors or electrodes),
B2- Complex setup (needs trained staff, calibration),
B3- Restricted to hospitals (not suited for home use or children with sensory issues).

?? 2. Consumer Health Trackers (e.g. Withings Sleep Analyzer, Oura, Fitbit)
A/ Strengths: Affordable, easy-to-use, accessible for the general public.

B/ Limitations:

B1/ Lack of clinical validation,
B2/ Low reliability in children or neurodiverse populations,
B3/ Not suitable for high-sensitivity use cases (e.g. autism, sleep disorders).

?? 3. Contactless Monitoring Devices (e.g. EarlySense, Nanit, radar/camera-based systems)
A/ Strengths: Contactless or remote monitoring.

B/ Limitations:

B1/ Environmental sensitivity (positioning, noise, lighting),
B2/ Limited precision (especially in detecting subtle physiological changes),
B3/ Often lack multi-parametric capabilities or robustness for clinical use.

? Our Differentiation
A/ Fully passive and contactless, with no calibration required.
B/ Designed for neurodivergent children, with high sensory tolerance.
C/ Multi-parametric and clinically relevant (HR, respiration, hemodynamics, motion).
D/ Integrated vibrational digital twin for signal enhancement.
E/ Suitable for home, hospital, or care facility use, even in real-life, non-controlled conditions.

Column6: We create smart glasses that solve mobility issues of people with low vision, by combining AI and robotics to understand reality, and mixed reality to adapt this information to the remaining vision of the users, so they can perceive it and move around safely.
Column31: Our business model is B2B2C. We sell our product, BIEL SMARTGAZE, through specialized LV opticians, who configure the product to match the specific needs of the patient. The retail price of our device is €4,900, including first year support service (40€/month). Support service includes free device reconfiguration according to the evolution of user’s visual condition, software updates and a 50% discount on product renewal after 3 years. As it is a medical device, this price will be reimbursed fully or partially by healthcare services, social services, insurance companies, and institutions related to visual impairment in most European countries.
Column33: We have created BIEL SMARTGAZE, an assistive technology device that uses spatial computing to enable people with LV to move around safely, combining AI and robotics to understand reality (obstacle detection, terrain changes, etc.) and mixed reality (MR) to present this information in a way that users can perceive. BIEL SMARTGAZE also includes complementary audible indications and vision enhancement functions such as zoom vision, light conditions adaptations, contrast improvements, adapting to the needs of each patient, to get the most out of their remaining vision, and thus providing a complete solution for people with LV.
Column34:
So far, the only solutions are guide dogs and white canes for people with LV. But Guide dogs are costly (>30.000€) and difficult to obtain. White canes provide limited information not offering complete autonomy. Geolocation apps, like Google Maps, present issues due to their inherent inaccuracies in positioning and inability to detect obstacles. However, we can commercially consider other electronic glasses and "wearable" type devices for improving visual impairment as competitors. 

•	E-Sight: Pioneers in glasses for LV. Reliable and mature product. Designed for static use without mobility functions.
•	OrCam: Focused on the recognition of people and objects. They don’t improve vision or mobility.
•	Retiplus, Nueyes, Oxsight: Include magnification and image enhancement, without mobility functions.
•	Irisvision: Reading and vision improvement. It doesn’t include mobility functions.

In contrast, our glasses are designed to be safe, comfortable, and affordable (priced at 4,900€), enabling users to confidently navigate their surroundings and have full autonomy. BIEL GLASSES, therefore, is positioned in the market as the best solution available to solve mobility issues for people with LV.

Column6: We use AI to discover and design novel biologics for therapeutics and biosensors, aiming to revolutionize healthcare through innovation
Column31:
Diagen AI operates on a partnership-based, B2B business model centered on AI-driven biologics design. Our core offering is an AI-powered platform that enables the discovery and design of novel peptides and proteins for use in therapeutics, diagnostics, and biosensors. We collaborate with biotech, diagnostics, and life sciences companies that lack in-house AI capabilities, offering modular services across the biologics discovery pipeline—from dataset curation and model training to candidate generation and prioritization.

Revenue is generated through a combination of upfront design fees, milestone payments tied to in vitro, in vivo, and preclinical success, and long-term royalty agreements for commercialized molecules. To ensure early revenue, we also engage with bioreagent suppliers and companies in lower-regulatory markets (e.g., veterinary health) to design and supply custom biologics. Additionally, we have explored blockchain-based bio-economy models by applying our ML expertise to molecule mining within decentralized networks.

This scalable and collaborative model allows us to remain capital-efficient while expanding our technological and commercial footprint across the biologics landscape.

Column6: IDBlock is a 4th-gen hybrid identity service enabling foreign tourists to access mobile services without a local phone number and with BlockPay, users can pay easily using their credit cards from their home country, without needing a local bank account.
Column31: Crosshub operates a transaction platform model that mainly generates revenue from simple payment transaction fees generated from a base of authenticated users. After completing identity verification through IDBlock, users can use payment services in various affiliated apps, and the fees per payment incurred in this process are repeatedly accumulated to create a stable revenue stream. The authentication service is provided free of charge when linked with external apps, thereby lowering the barrier to entry for users and promoting service expansion.
Column33:
Crosshub uniquely addresses the challenges of cross-border identity verification and payments through its blockchain-based, next-generation hybrid identity solution, IDBlock, and its global simple payment platform, B-Pay. IDBlock utilizes passport-based credentials and applies Zero-Knowledge Proof (ZKP) technology to issue Anonymous Verifiable Credentials (AVC), ensuring that users retain full control over their personal data and only disclose information with explicit consent. This approach fundamentally resolves the privacy and data exposure issues commonly found in conventional authentication systems.

Unlike existing services that are often limited to local users, our solution is fully interoperable across both Web 2.0 and Web 3.0 environments, making it applicable across diverse sectors including finance, transportation, healthcare, travel, and digital platforms. IDBlock is designed as a unified infrastructure that can support scalable, global identity verification.
Column34: Rather than competing directly with conventional identity verification providers, we view large-scale infrastructure companies like Oracle as our primary competitors. These companies dominate centralized identity and data management systems, offering robust databases and enterprise solutions. However, their centralized architectures inherently limit scalability, flexibility, and privacy. In contrast, our ZKP-based AVC technology provides decentralized, privacy-enhanced identity verification that is secure, lightweight, and interoperable across platforms. As the demand for user-controlled identity and data sovereignty increases, traditional data giants may enter this field, but our early-mover advantage, patented core technology, and proven interoperability across both Web 2.0 and Web 3.0 ecosystems position us strongly to lead the next generation of identity infrastructure.

MAUD is a privacy-first data platform and marketplace for automotive and mobility sectors. It enables compliant, consent-based data sharing, delivers data-driven leads, enhances customer engagement, drives value creation and builds trust.
Column31:
MAUD's business model centers around empowering individuals to own, control, and monetize their personal driving and vehicle-related data.

Key elements of the business model include:

Data Ownership: Users retain full ownership and control of their data by a secure personal data vault.

Data Monetization: Users can choose to unlock and share their data with third parties (like insurers, dealerships, or researchers) on our marketplace in exchange for compensation or benefits.

Privacy & Security: MAUD uses secure, encrypted databases and servers to ensure privacy and prevent unauthorized access to user data.

B2B Services: MAUD partners with automotive related businesses seeking user-consented automotive customer data to improve services, develop products, or conduct research.

Incentives: The platform incentivizes users through rewards or payments for sharing their data, making them active participants in the data economy.
Column33:
The MAUD solution is a comprehensive open-source data platform and cloud-based ecosystem with the following characteristics:

Responsive WebApp: MAUD is accessible through a browser-based WebApp, optimized for all devices including smart phones, eliminating the need for downloads.

Two-Factor Authentication (2FA): MAUD employs 2FA via SMS codes through the Authy service by Twilio, enhancing account security.

Data Fragmentation & Distribution: Data is fragmented and distributed across multiple databases located in Frankfurt, Germany, adhering to stringent data protection regulations.

Encrypted Data Vault: User data is stored in a highly secure, encrypted digital vault, compliant with GDPR standards. Only users possess the keys to access their personal data.

Behavioral Analysis: MAUD employs AI and machine learning algorithms to analyze driving behavior and patterns, providing users with insights into their driving habits and recommendations for safer, cost efficient and environmentally friendlier driving.

Hybrid Blockchain: MAUD is developing a hybrid blockchain system to facilitate secure and transparent data transactions.

Greencoin: A sustainability-focused cryptocurrency under development, Greencoin aims to reward users for eco-friendly driving behaviors and can be used for environmentally conscious purchases.
Column34:
Unlike connected car data platforms like Otonomo, LexisNexis or OnStar, MAUD distinguishes through
- User-Centric Data Ownership and Management,
- enhanced consumer dataset (contracts, bills, non-connected cars and customer experience) 
- Strong Focus on Privacy & Security,
- Direct Data Monetization for Consumers,
- Sustainability-Focused Rewards,
- Marketplace for data-driven sale and targeted advertising.

Pay-per-use options are available for one-off services, and add-ons like advanced monitoring or international filings can be booked flexibly. We also maintain a global affiliate network with partner law firms and receive commissions for referrals, creating an additional revenue stream. Through B2B partnerships with startup hubs and legal platforms, we further expand our reach. The result: a highly scalable, recurring revenue model with strong value for emerging brands worldwide.

As a cloud-based SaaS solution, it’s scalable, always up to date, and accessible from anywhere. We continuously integrate new AI models to improve accuracy and user experience. In short: we combine legal tech and AI innovation to simplify a traditionally complex process—and give startups real power over their brand protection.

Mid-size compressor OEMs show strong interest in partnerships with us as they often do not have the resources for disruptive in-house innovations.
