Column6: Ezymob develops 100% digital software solutions to give people with special needs (visual and cognitive disabilities) greater autonomy and freedom when travelling on public transport networks.
Column31:
Our business model is based on B2B2C. Our target customers are public transport authorities (AOMs), cities and transport operators responsible for running transport networks. 

Our final target is people with visual and cognitive disabilities who need a tool to help them travel more independently.
Column33:
The Ezymob application accompanies its user at each step of his path : it takes him to the station, allows him to locate the turnstiles, guides him to the platform, guides him to the door and then to an available seat, and finally it announces when he must get off the train. These steps are repeated as many times as necessary if the user has to make connections. 

The artificial intelligence algorithm we have developed allows the user to analyze his environment through his smartphone to locate the infrastructure that will allow him to continue his path.

In order to guide the user during his route, the application integrates this artificial intelligence algorithm allowing the user to orient himself in real time. This deep learning algorithm as well as the user guidance algorithm are technological innovations developed internally by the Ezymob team in collaboration with our community of testers.
Column34:
Today, the mobility market for the visually impaired is becoming increasingly competitive, with many companies focusing on developing innovative solutions to improve their day-to-day accessibility: Navilens, Evelity (Okeenea), Vioo, Aurizone, Phitech, Rightear. 

However, our competitors rely mainly on hardware infrastructures coupled with software solutions.

Ezymob is the only complete solution, running on the smartphone and without any hardware infrastructure, which accompanies the user throughout their journey. This is a significant advantage for transport organising authorities, as it means that there are no expenses associated with the cost of installing hardware in the conurbation, which makes it easier to deploy Ezymob in terms of logistics.

At snap DISCOVERY, we enable mind-driven control through our AI-powered Brain-Computer Interface (BCI). No hands, no barriers, just pure thought. From gaming to assistive tech, we are redefining what interaction means.
Column31: SNAP DISCOVERY operates a hardware-enabled SaaS business model focused on Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI) for gaming. We offer non-invasive EEG headsets bundled with software that enables real-time brain signal decoding for hands-free control and adaptive gameplay. Revenue is generated through hardware sales/licensing, SaaS subscriptions, and SDK/API licensing to game developers and XR partners. Our competitive edge lies in low-latency neural decoding and seamless integration into gaming environments, turning brain activity into a new form of immersive interaction.
Column33: SNAP DISCOVERY employs a proprietary technology stack to enable real-time brain-computer interaction in gaming and other software. At the core is a non-invasive EEG headset with dry electrodes, designed for comfort and high-quality signal acquisition. Neural signals are processed locally using embedded AI on NVIDIA Jetson modules and ARM-based processors, ensuring low-latency performance without reliance on cloud connectivity. Our deep learning models decode motion imagery, attention, and cognitive states in real time. The BCI software toolbox allows seamless calibration, training, and integration into game engines like Unity and Unreal. Developers can access these capabilities through our SDK and APIs, enabling intuitive, thought-based game control and adaptive gameplay mechanics.
Column34:
NextMind (acquired by Snap Inc.) Focus: Visual cortex-based BCI for controlling interfaces with intention detection. Status: Integrated into AR/XR research; limited standalone commercial development post-acquisition.

Neurosity (Notion headset) Focus: EEG-based wearable for productivity and developer tools with gaming potential. Strength: Developer-friendly SDK, focus on mental state tracking and intent. Limitation: Less focused on immersive gaming; more general-purpose.
OpenBCI (Galea + Ultracortex) Focus: Open-source BCI hardware for research and experimental gaming/XR.Strength: Strong research community and integration with VR devices. Limitation: Requires technical expertise; not optimized for consumer-level gaming.

Emotiv (EPOC, Insight) Focus: EEG headsets for research, wellness, and limited gaming applications.
 Strength: Established hardware, research validation.
 Limitation: Higher latency, less real-time control focus, less immersive integration in games.

FaceHeart Vitals™ is an FDA-cleared software that transforms any camera into a contactless health monitor—measuring vital signs in 5 seconds, fully offline, no wearables needed.
Column31: FaceHeart adopts a B2B software licensing model, providing our proprietary AI-based contactless vital sign monitoring solution—FaceHeart Vitals™—as a Software Development Kit (SDK) and API to enterprise partners. Our clients include healthcare providers, telemedicine platforms, wellness app developers, smart device manufacturers, and insurers. Through flexible SDK licensing, we enable partners to integrate medical-grade, camera-based health monitoring into their existing systems and products, without the need for additional hardware.
Column33:
FaceHeart Vitals™ utilizes remote photoplethysmography (rPPG), computer vision, and AI-driven signal processing to enable contactless measurement of vital signs—such as heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, and oxygen saturation—using only a standard camera.

Key technologies include:
rPPG: A non-contact method for extracting physiological signals from video frames.
Computer Vision: Enables robust facial detection and tracking in real time.
AI Algorithms: Analyze signal patterns to deliver accurate, medical-grade measurements.
Edge Computing: All processing is performed locally on the device, requiring no internet or cloud connection, ensuring full privacy and low latency.

Efficiency: Appolo reduces the time and human resources needed to prepare for certification.

Accessibility: Through Appolo, small and medium-sized training organizations can access structured, affordable, and compliant guidance 24/7.

Flat-rate certification fees based on audit type and scope.

Subscription or access-based models for Appolo (e.g. for document preparation support or follow-up audits).

Value-added services like pre-audit reviews or training (provided within the limits of non-consultancy).

Column6: Dieng Innovation is launching Smooth, an administrative platform that provides personalized support to every student. It offers schools and institutions accurate data to enhance student support and effectively combat student hardship.
Column31:
Smooth repose sur un modèle B2B2C, s’adressant aux gouvernements, établissements de l’enseignement supérieur et directement aux étudiants.

Abonnement institutionnel (B2B)
Les établissements (universités, grandes écoles, CROUS, etc.) et les gouvernements locaux ou nationaux souscrivent à un abonnement annuel pour déployer Smooth auprès de leurs étudiants. Le tarif est modulé selon le nombre d’utilisateurs, les fonctionnalités activées (tableaux de bord, reporting, interconnexion avec les services publics) et le niveau de personnalisation requis.

Licences sectorielles ou territoriales (B2G)
Des licences sont proposées aux institutions publiques (ministères, régions, collectivités) pour équiper tout un territoire ou un réseau d’établissements. Cela inclut des services d’analyse de données anonymisées pour orienter les politiques publiques en faveur des jeunes.

Offre premium pour les étudiants (B2C)
Une version gratuite permet aux étudiants d’accéder aux services essentiels. Une offre premium, à tarif symbolique ou subventionné, propose des services complémentaires (alertes personnalisées, aide au remplissage automatique de dossiers, accompagnement humain, etc.).
Column33:
Vérification automatique de documents : une IA de traitement d’image (OCR + détection de fraude) permet de lire, analyser et valider instantanément les pièces justificatives (CNI, attestations, relevés, etc.) avec un haut niveau de fiabilité.

Assistant administratif personnalisé : un agent conversationnel intelligent, basé sur un modèle de langage avancé (type LLM), guide l’étudiant 24/7 dans ses démarches, répond à ses questions, et adapte ses conseils en fonction du profil et de la situation en temps réel.

Analyse prédictive de situation : un moteur d’analyse comportementale utilise des données d’usage (anonymisées) pour détecter des signaux faibles de décrochage ou de précarité, permettant aux établissements ou institutions d’intervenir plus rapidement.

Ces IA sont intégrées via des API modulaires et interopérables, permettant à Smooth de s’adapter aux besoins de chaque établissement, tout en assurant sécurité, conformité RGPD et scalabilité.

Smart Dr.Friend offers non-wearable sleep care solutions using grounding technology, personalized diagnostics, and natural materials. The app tracks sleep patterns, analyzes data, and provides smart features like sleep logs and relaxation tips.
Column31:
Dr.Friend is currently operated as a premium functional bedding brand, distributing its products directly to consumers (D2C) through its official online store and various domestic and international e-commerce platforms.
With strong word-of-mouth and a high repurchase rate based on positive customer experience, the brand is building its credibility in the sleep care market.
In the near future, Smart Dr.Friend will introduce a subscription-based sleep care service connected with a mobile app, allowing users to track and improve their sleep through real-time health data. This business model will expand the company’s role from simply selling products to becoming a holistic sleep care solution provider.
Column33:
'-Grounding (Earthing) Technology: Discharges static electricity from the body and connects to the Earth's natural electrons, helping restore bioelectrical balance.

-Electromagnetic Shielding Technology: Uses silver fibers and shielding fabrics to minimize exposure to EMFs emitted by electronic devices during sleep.

-Functional Fabric Technology: Utilizes premium materials with antibacterial, deodorizing, and breathable properties to maintain a clean and comfortable sleep environment.

-Ergonomic Design: Bedding structure is optimized to support the natural posture of the human body during sleep.

-Smart Sleep Monitoring Technology (in development): Collects data such as sleep cycles, heart rate, and body temperature using IoT sensors, and provides users with tailored feedback and recommendations via a connected mobile app.
Column34:

Withings (France) – Specializes in non-contact sleep analyzers that monitor sleep cycles, heart rate, and sleep apnea.

Column31:
Illizeo Cloud Solutions' business model is based on an integrated offering of SaaS (Software as a Service) and HR consulting services, specifically designed for organisations of all sizes. This approach aims to simplify and automate HR processes, while offering flexibility tailored to customers' needs.

SaaS offering: all-in-one HR platform
Illizeo offers a modular cloud software suite to manage the entire employee lifecycle within a single secure platform. Modules include :
- Employee profile management
- Time Management (Absences, Attendance, Tracking)
- Onboarding and offboarding
- Working time and absence tracking
- Payroll management, with integration with certified partner solutions
- Document management and electronic signature
- Expense claim management
- Performance management
- Flex Office Management

This offering is designed to be flexible, with a ‘pay-as-you-go’ approach per employee and per module. Illizeo offers a free one-month trial period, enabling companies to test the functionalities without commitment.
Column33:
1. Cloud infrastructure
Cloud computing: Illizeo offers a 100% cloud solution, accessible via a browser, with no local installation. This suggests the use of cloud infrastructure services for hosting and scalability.

2. Integrations and interoperability
Third-party connectors: The platform integrates with existing HR systems and third-party applications (accounting, time management, etc.), promoting interoperability. 

3. Technology partnerships
SAP SuccessFactors, Doxis SER, SwissSalary, Team Tailor: Illizeo is a partner of these solutions, offering implementation, customisation and support services.

?? Security and compliance
Illizeo centralises HR data in a single secure database, guaranteeing confidentiality and compliance with local regulations, particularly in terms of payroll and human resources management.

Illizeo Cloud Solutions uses a modern cloud infrastructure, flexible integrations and automation tools to provide a comprehensive HR solution that is adaptable to the needs of SMEs.

WAS Company is a climate-tech enterprise dedicated to transforming the construction and waste management industries through circular innovation. Founded with a bold mission to turn the world's most complex waste streams into building materials.
Column31:
WAS Company operates a circular, production-based, and territorially scalable business model, focused on transforming industrial and post-consumer waste into high-performance construction materials through modular, low-impact technologies.

1. Primary Revenue Streams
Sale of sustainable construction materials: Commercialization of products such as pavers, blocks, panels, and modular systems made from plastic waste, rubble, and mining residues.

Implementation of modular plants ("WAS Hubs"): Design, installation, and operation of local micro-factories that convert waste into value-added products. These may be operated directly by WAS Co or through partnership models.

Strategic projects and technical consulting: Specialized services for governments, companies, and organizations in circular economy solutions, waste recovery, and regenerative infrastructure development.

2. Value Proposition
Reduction of environmental and logistical costs by processing waste locally.

Replacement of traditional materials with low-carbon, high-durability alternatives.

Regulatory compliance and ESG positioning for public and private partners.

Territorial impact, creating local jobs, strengthening circular value chains, and reducing landfill dependency.

3. Customer Segments
Construction companies and real estate developers

Municipal and regional governments

Industrial waste generators (mining, manufacturing, agri-industry)

Public-private partnerships and impact investment funds

4. Scalability Strategy
Territorial Hub Model: Replication of micro-factories in regions with high waste generation and infrastructure demand.

Strategic local partnerships: Joint implementation with governments, NGOs, or anchor companies to ensure cultural adaptation and operational sustainability.

Continuous material innovation: Development of new products from complex waste streams, tailored to technical standards and local needs.
Column33:
Technologies Employed by WAS Company
Modular Waste Processing Systems

Custom-designed, decentralized micro-factories (“WAS Hubs”) capable of processing diverse waste streams—plastics, mining residues, demolition debris—into construction-grade materials.

Adaptable to various scales and geographies, enabling localized production and circular supply chains.

Advanced Material Formulation

Proprietary blends and composite technologies that convert complex, low-value waste into high-performance building products.

Tailored to meet structural, thermal, and environmental standards with a focus on recyclability and durability.

Thermo-Mechanical Transformation

Low-energy, high-efficiency systems that combine heat, compression, and shaping processes to mold recycled materials without chemical additives or binders.

Quality Control & Compliance Tools

On-site testing protocols and technical validation methods to ensure consistency, structural integrity, and compliance with local construction norms.

Circular Design Integration

All products are engineered for circularity, enabling reuse, reprocessing, or disassembly at the end of life, supporting zero-waste goals.
Column34:
Direct Competitors of WAS Company
ByFusion (USA)

Focus: Converts non-recyclable plastics into construction-grade building blocks using steam and compression (ByBlocks).

Difference: Focused only on plastics, limited versatility in product types and waste streams.

Miniwiz (Taiwan)

Focus: Develops high-end construction and consumer products from various recycled materials.

Difference: More design-focused and urban-centric; less focused on scalable, modular infrastructure or heavy-duty construction use.

CarbonCure (Canada)

Focus: Injects captured CO? into concrete during mixing to reduce emissions.

Difference: Does not upcycle waste; focused solely on concrete and carbon capture enhancement.

Gjenge Makers (Kenya)

Focus: Recycles plastic waste into paving bricks using local, low-tech methods.

Difference: Operates on a smaller scale, localized impact with limited technical diversification or modular system scalability.

Interface / Everloop (USA/Global)

Focus: Circular flooring systems and building materials from recycled inputs.

Difference: Product line is narrower and more interior-focused (e.g., carpets), not heavy construction.

What Differentiates WAS Co
Multi-stream waste processing: Not limited to plastics—also processes mining tailings, construction debris, etc.

High-performance construction products: Designed to meet or exceed industrial standards.

Decentralized, modular production (WAS Hubs): Scalable model adaptable to different territories and waste ecosystems.

Circular, regenerative design focus: From input to end-of-life, all materials are designed for reuse and environmental restoration.

For those who refuse to choose between tradition and innovation: a patented smart strap that adds clinical-grade stress, sleep, and recovery tracking to your finest watch — with zero compromise in style.
Column31:
1. B2B Partnerships
We license our technology and supply smart straps to:
- Luxury and premium watch brands (e.g., Swiss watchmakers)
- Strap manufacturers and OEMs
- Co-branding and white-label options available

2. B2C / D2C
We offer a curated strap collection sold directly to consumers via:
- Retail partners, e-commerce, and select social media/blogger collaborations
Column33:
1. Patented Smart Strap Electronics Implementation 
Proprietary integration of electronics into the watch strap — combining biometric sensors, a miniaturized PCB, and BLE communication in a mechanically flexible, design-conscious form factor.

2. PPG (Photoplethysmography) Sensors
For real-time monitoring of heart rate, HRV, and stress - optimized for accuracy in a non-rigid, wrist-worn setting.

3. Motion & Sleep Tracking Sensors
Accelerometer and gyroscope track steps, movement patterns, and sleep cycles with ultra-low power consumption.

4. Custom PCB & Microelectronics
Miniaturized circuit board designed specifically for wrist dynamics and constrained form factors - ensuring signal quality and mechanical durability.

5. Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)
Enables secure, low-power wireless data transmission to paired devices or apps.

6. Embedded Firmware
Custom-developed firmware manages sensor data, device control, and Bluetooth protocols - scalable for future features and integrations.

7. Algorithmic Interpretation
We collaborate with experts like CSEM and Firstbeat Analytics to deliver validated insights on stress, sleep, and recovery - with potential for clinical-grade metrics.
Column34:
Watchibia is not entering an existing category — it's creating a new one.

We address the growing desire for health tracking in a way that respects personal style, tradition, and emotional connection to mechanical watches. No screen. No second device. Just beautifully integrated intelligence.

Others Have Tried — But Not Quite Beautifully: 
Whoop - additional device;
Oura - additional device; 
Apple Watch / Garmin / Fitbit - additional device, replacement.
We are pioneering the category of:
?? Smart health-tracking straps for traditional watches
?? Designed to complement, not replace

Recov’up est une appli 100% gamifiée de prévention santé en entreprise. Grâce à l’IA, les salariés s’évaluent, identifient leurs risques TMS et psycho, et accèdent à des contenus interactifs pour bouger, soulager leurs douleurs et booster leur bien-être.
Column31:
Notre business model repose sur la vente d’un logiciel SaaS aux Services de Santé au Travail (SPST), conçu pour répondre aux obligations réglementaires d’août 2021 en matière de prévention. Ce logiciel métier leur permet d’accompagner les entreprises dans l’évaluation des risques (TMS, RPS), la mise en place d’actions de prévention ciblées et le suivi personnalisé des salariés.

Nous proposons également une offre complémentaire QVT (Qualité de Vie au Travail), vendue en additionnel aux entreprises via les SPST. Cette offre gamifiée favorise l'engagement des salariés, la réduction de l’absentéisme et l’amélioration du bien-être au travail.

-  Double cible :
SPST : licence SaaS annuelle + accompagnement
Entreprises : vente additionnelle via prescription SPST (QVT, prévention, RSE)

- Valeur ajoutée :
Conformité réglementaire
Prévention active et mesurable
Réduction des arrêts et absentéisme
Valorisation des actions QVT et RSE des entreprises
Column33: Recov’up utilise une technologie SaaS basée sur l’intelligence artificielle pour analyser les auto-évaluations des salariés et personnaliser les contenus de prévention. La plateforme repose sur une architecture web cloud sécurisée, accessible sur tous les supports, et conforme au RGPD. Elle intègre des mécaniques de gamification pour favoriser l’engagement, ainsi que des tableaux de bord permettant aux SPST et aux entreprises de suivre en temps réel les usages, les indicateurs de santé et l’impact des actions menées. L’ensemble est pensé pour s’intégrer simplement dans les pratiques métier des services de santé au travail, tout en garantissant la confidentialité des données.

Column6: As a lead operator specializing in comprehensive energy renovation for condominiums, we aim to scale up renovation projects, ensuring long-lasting performance, and accelerating the energy transition on a large scale. Making large-scale renovation smarter!
Column31:
Our business model is based on comprehensive management of the entire energy renovation value chain, from the study phase to post-renovation consumption monitoring.

As a single point of contact, we provide each condominium with a clear, understandable, and tailored solution, ensuring real, contractually guaranteed energy savings from the study phase onward.

Current Revenues:
Assistance to Project Management (AMO) Services:
- Direct billing to condominiums or project holders for full support (diagnostics, subsidy applications, company selection, monitoring).
- Target Clients:
? Property managers
? Social landlords
? Private individuals
? Public authorities

Future Developments in the Business Model:
- Third-Party Financing:
We are implementing a mechanism where the energy savings generated will pay for the renovation costs, ensuring zero upfront costs for co-owners. This opens the door to inclusive and profitable mass renovation.
- Industrialization of Our Collaborative Digital Platform:
Our digital platform integrates all our technical and financial expertise across operations. It enables:
o Automation of time-consuming tasks
o Real-time project monitoring
o Data centralization
o Smooth coordination between all stakeholders (co-owners, property managers, contractors, financiers)
o And freeing up time for social support of co-owners.

Strategic Positioning:
We are not just a service provider: we are a structural player capable of scaling up energy renovations while maintaining a high level of energy performance and human support.

Commercial Objective :
First Experiments and Tangible Results (2024-2025)
In 2024, Rénover Pour Demain already completed:
500 feasibility studies for 15 condominiums, representing €37 million in projected generated works.

Clear Path to Massification:

2025-2028: Successful pilot in Corsica, our home region.
? Studies completed: 1,613
? Revenue: €11,653,022

2029: Expansion to Île-de-France to adapt our solution to large cities and the needs of complex condominiums.
? Studies completed: 3,193
? Revenue: €20,239,968

2032: National deployment covering major French regions, before expanding internationally.
? Studies completed: 19,728
? Revenue: €131,068,692

Thanks to its standardized, profitable, and scalable approach, Rénover Pour Demain is positioning itself as a key player in comprehensive and high-performance energy renovation.
Column33:
Rénover Pour Demain has developed a collaborative digital platform that revolutionizes the management and monitoring of energy renovation projects in condominiums. This tool centralizes all technical, administrative, and financial data, streamlines coordination among stakeholders, and ensures optimized project tracking.

Automation and Simplification: By reducing and standardizing time-consuming tasks, the platform frees up time for social support and co-owner monitoring.

Real-time Project Monitoring: Instant access to documents, project progress updates, and alerts on deadlines.

Dedicated Interface for Professionals – "La Fabrique à Rénover": Property managers, project managers, design offices, contractors, and funding organizations can directly track and interact via the platform.

Personalized Space for Each Co-owner: Visibility on their financing plan, required documents, tracking of received subsidies, and remaining costs.

Optimized Management of Public Grants: Centralization of administrative files to streamline relationships with financiers and reduce processing times.

Guaranteeing Energy Performance: Thanks to precise post-renovation monitoring, the platform allows for the evaluation of actual energy savings and ensures compliance with contractual commitments.

This digital approach, combined with an integrated business and financing module, enables the industrialization and massification of energy renovation, guaranteeing better coordination and maximizing the impact of operations.
Column34:
Currently, no operator offers such a comprehensive solution. As a lead renovation operator and integrated project coordinator for condominiums, we combine technical-financial engineering, performance guarantees, a consortium of strategic partners, consumption monitoring, and a collaborative digital platform.

Partial Competition:
- Design offices (technical approach but without overall project management).
- Traditional AMO (Assistance to Project Management) (administrative and/or technical support without an integrated approach).
- Engie Solutions (Energy Performance Contract (EPC) for the industrial sector, but not specifically for condominiums).
